Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Social Insights Specialist (Meltwater Specialist)




London, Amsterdam

6 months FTC




About Us: Fractal is a dynamic and innovative AI company that is committed to delivering cutting-edge solutions to our clients. We are seeking a highly skilled and proactive Data & Insights Specialist with strong communication and presentation skills to support the adoption and strategic use of Meltwater across our brands and business units. This role is critical in enabling teams to extract actionable insights from social and media intelligence, build and maintain a robust media scorecard, and ensure consistent, high-quality reporting across markets.




Responsibilities:




· Meltwater Enablement & Adoption

Act as the go-to expert for Meltwater, supporting onboarding, training, and day-to-day usage across multiple brands and BUs.
Partner with brand teams to embed Meltwater into their workflows and decision-making processes.
Collaborate with the global Meltwater team and internal stakeholders to ensure alignment with client’s insights engine strategy.




· Media Scorecard Development

Lead the creation and refinement of a standardized media scorecard to track brand performance, media impact, and consumer sentiment.
Ensure the scorecard is actionable, scalable, and aligned with business KPIs.




· Insights Generation & Reporting

Conduct daily monitoring and analysis of Meltwater dashboards and alerts.
Deliver timely, insightful reports to brand teams, highlighting key trends, risks, and opportunities.
Leverage AI-powered summaries and dashboards to streamline reporting.




· Cross-Functional Collaboration

Work closely with Consumer Market Insights, Communications, Digital, and Marketing teams to ensure insights are integrated into strategic planning.
Support the development of use cases and best practices for Meltwater adoption across markets.




Preffered Qualifications:




Background in FMCG or consumer brands
Experience with AI-enabled reporting tools and dashboarding.
Familiarity with Unilever’s digital ecosystem is a pre, while knowledge of GDT capabilities and tools (e.g., Brand DNAi, Smart Briefing) is a plus




Ideal Candidate Profile:




Proven experience in consumer insights, media intelligence, or social listening roles.
Deep familiarity with Meltwater or similar platforms (e.g., Brandwatch, Talkwalker).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate data into compelling narratives.
Experience working in a matrixed, multinational organization.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Comfortable working independently and driving initiatives across diverse teams.




Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by clicking Introduce Yourself in the top-right corner of the page or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Medior Data Analyst - Amsterdam | 40 hours




Urban Gym Group is an industry pioneer within the European wellness and fitness community, with over 40 clubs and studios in major cities across the Netherlands and The United Kingdom. You might know us from brands such as Trainmore, ClubSportive, Renessence, BTY CLB, TRIB3, PILAT3S and Gymbox. Our ambitious domestic and international growth plans require an expansion of our Business Intelligence team.




We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will play a key part in driving our data-driven decision-making, making a significant impact on our continued success. Working closely with our Finance, Marketing, and Analytics teams, you will extract valuable insights from our data, helping us optimise operations, enhance member experiences, and support our ambitious growth plans.




Key responsibilities:

Conduct market research and analyses to identify new club locations.
Develop business cases for club expansion, including new builds, mergers, and acquisitions.
Build ETL processes to structure data from various sources for business use.
Create data views, tables, and reports supporting daily operations and strategic goals.
Design dashboards that enable informed, data-driven decisions.
Analyze growth to identify high-performing areas and new opportunities.
Query databases for insights on key metrics like revenue and member retention.
Use data to boost member retention, inform marketing strategies, and support revenue growth.




You:

2 to 4 years of experience in a data-focused role (e.g., Data Analyst, Data Engineer, or BI Specialist).
Proven expertise in data pipeline creation, data visualization, and analytics.
Advanced proficiency in SQL with a strong understanding of Azure SQL.
Hands-on experience building ETL pipelines, ideally using Python or Azure Synapse Analytics.
Proficient in Power BI, with a track record of designing impactful dashboards and reports.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Industry experience in fitness/wellness or retail is preferred, with insights into customer retention, revenue optimization, and business expansion.
Experience in consulting or retail is an asset, especially in roles focused on addressing business challenges.
Able to communicate complex data insights in a clear, actionable format for non-technical audiences.
You are based in or around Amsterdam




We offer:

A competitive salary plus 8% holiday pay
Hybrid way of working
26 holidays per year (based on full-time employment) and the option to exchange public holidays
Unlimited access to all our high-end fitness locations for you and a +1
Unlimited access to well-being services for you and your family via OpenUp
An inspiring head office, a short 10-minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station
A diverse and energetic team of 500 colleagues pushing boundaries and supporting one another

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Data Analyst to join a globally respected asset manager's global data operations team. This is a hands-on operations role, ideal for someone who combines analytical knowhow with a service-oriented mindset and enjoys working at the heart of investment data.

You will be responsible for:

Ensuring accurate and timely setup and maintenance of investment data (e.g. securities, pricing, analytics).
Performing business and data analysis to improve daily production and project workflows.
Supporting data operations processes and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.
Collaborating with global teams to maintain consistent and reliable data handoffs.
Monitoring key metrics and escalate issues appropriately.
Delivering exceptional internal customer service and communication across teams.



Requirements


3+ years' experience in financial services, ideally in data, operations, or analytics.
Strong Excel skills and an understanding of core investment data concepts.
Ability to manage complex data workflows and communicate effectively with technical and non-technical audiences.
Analytical mindset with the ability to troubleshoot and problem-solve.
Excellent communication skills and a team-oriented approach.
Experience with security master data, pricing, or analytics data is strongly preferred.



Benefits



Initially 6-months contract, with a strong expectation to be extended. Rate to be discussed.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Analytics Platform
Description:
Why Choose Eneco?

At Eneco, we're on a mission to be climate neutral by 2035 — not just for ourselves, but for all our customers. Digital innovation plays a key role in achieving this, and our Analytics Platform team is at the heart of that effort. We aim to empower the organization to become truly data- and metric-driven, helping teams measure their impact through actionable KPIs, integrated into our OKR framework.

To support this, we're looking for a Data Analyst who’s passionate about enabling data-informed decisions across the business. While Power BI is our current visualization platform, we're focused on future-proofing our data landscape and are exploring more scalable and code-first analytics solutions. This is an opportunity to help shape that evolution.




What Will You Do?

As a Data Analyst in the Analytics Platform Team, you will be a key enabler of data-driven decision-making across Eneco and Oxxio. Your role goes beyond dashboards, you will help us drive consistency and clarity in how we measure business outcomes and create reusable, scalable analytics capabilities.




While you will support our existing Power BI infrastructure, your focus will be on building a future-ready analytics environment. You’ll work closely with data professionals, product teams, and business stakeholders to align metrics to our OKRs, improve accessibility to trusted insights, and make sure analytics tools and processes evolve alongside our ambitions.




You Will Be Responsible For:

Enabling the organization to become more metric- and KPI-driven by building robust, scalable analytics solutions.
Supporting the governance and improvement of our current visualization toolset (e.g., workspace structure, permissions, deployment).
Collaborating with IT and other teams to align visualization tools with broader data infrastructure.
Designing and maintaining centralized data models and reporting templates that promote reuse and consistency.
Driving continuous improvement by integrating experimentation methods (e.g., A/B testing) into Power BI-based analytics workflows.
Supporting the rollout of analytics capabilities and best practices across teams through training, documentation, and workshops.
Contributing to the future direction of our analytics platform — including the exploration of BI-as-code or alternative visualization tools.




Is This You?




Must Have:

Strong analytical skills and a structured approach to building KPI- and OKR-driven reporting.
Experience using Power BI in a professional environment.
Understanding of data modeling and performance optimization for analytics products.
Experience in supporting and enabling others with reporting and data literacy.
Solid communication skills, able to work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders




Nice to Have:

Experience with Power BI system administration and governance.
Experience with Azure (Data Lake, Synapse) and/or Snowflake.
Familiarity with dbt or similar data modeling tools.
Understanding of CI/CD and automation for BI tools (e.g., PowerShell, REST APIs).
Experience with other BI tools or BI-as-code environments.
Experience in Agile/Scrum/Kanban settings.
Dutch language skills.




This Is Where You’ll Work

You’ll be part of the Analytics Platform team. Working closely with data engineers, analysts, and scientists who build and maintain foundational capabilities for the entire Eneco organization. The team ensures consistency in tooling and best practices while fostering a strong learning culture.

You’ll also be part of the broader Eneco Data & Analytics community, where we support each other’s growth and collaborate across value streams to create business impact.




Who We’re Looking For

A forward-looking Data Analyst who sees tools like Power BI as enablers — not end goals.
Someone who wants to help Eneco evolve toward a mature, scalable, and metrics-focused analytics practice.
A team player who enjoys empowering others and contributing to an enterprise-wide transformation.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Analytics Platform
Description:
Why Choose Eneco?

The One Planet strategy we are committed to here at Eneco sets an ambitious goal to be climate neutral by 2035. We want to achieve that goal for both us and our clients. To make it happen, we are dedicated to offering our customers innovative digital capabilities and smart solutions. Our team is working towards creating an exceptional online customer experience, through modernizing the Eneco chat, app and web environments. We are striving to deliver a superior digital customer experience that will stimulate and make it easier for our customers to become greener, every day.




What Will You Do?

As a Technical Digital Analyst in our Analytics Platform Team, you will play a key role in enabling data-driven decision-making across Eneco's business and product teams. We're looking for someone who can proactively support and build on our Digital Analytics foundational infrastructure. You will work closely with stakeholders (e.g. Data Analysts, Product Analysts, Media Specialists, and Product Managers) to deploy, maintain, and optimize analytics solutions (GA4, GTM, GBQ) that support Eneco’s digital transformation.




You Will Be Responsible For

Monitoring, supporting, and maintaining the Digital Analytics foundational infrastructure for Eneco and Oxxio (and other brands on occasion).
Ensuring operational GA4 (configuring, training and supporting colleagues, monitoring) is up to date and running smoothly.
Ensuring operational GTM (client-side and server-side) deployment, optimization, review of workspaces, and tag management is working correctly.
Supporting product and business teams by identifying necessary measurements, reviewing measurement plans, and proposing measurement solutions for our apps, websites and chatbots.
Improving Digital Analytics end-to-end infrastructure.




Is This You?




Must Have:

Strong understanding of digital analytics concepts, (web/app) tracking, and methodologies
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills
Proficient in (server-side) GTM, GA4, Firebase, and user feedback and experimentation tools (e.g., GrowthBook, Optimizely, GetFeedback, Hotjar)
Proficient in writing custom JavaScript (for tagging) and SQL (for querying and analysis)
Experience working with online marketing and advertising pixels (e.g., Google Ads, Affiliates)
Strong understanding of privacy-related topics (e.g., GDPR, Telecommunicatiewet, Consent Mode)
Passionate about knowledge sharing (e.g., documentation, training colleagues, workshops)
Basic statistics knowledge for hypothesis testing




Nice to Have:

Knowledge of data modeling using dbt and Snowflake DWH
Good understanding of data visualization (e.g., Power BI and Google Looker Studio)
Familiarity with Azure, Kubernetes, and Docker
Ability to communicate technical topics clearly to non-technical stakeholders
Dutch language skills are a plus




This is Where You Will Work

You will be working collaboratively with other Data Analysts, Data Engineers, and Data Scientists within the Analytics Platform Team. The team is responsible for maintaining and onboarding all digital analytics and experimentation-related tools. Each specialist focuses on their specific area of specialization to enable value streams to reach their objectives without worrying about the foundational tech infrastructure.




For Digital Analytics, you will not be working alone; instead, you can grow and learn alongside the Senior Digital Analyst. Within the team, we foster a culture of learning, actively encourage proactive collaboration, celebrate successes, and use failures as opportunities for growth and improvement.

Show more

Title: Mid-Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Mid-Senior Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for transforming raw data into actionable business insights, building interactive dashboards, and developing reporting solutions to support strategic decision-making.

This role is best suited for professionals who thrive in fast-paced environments, have strong expertise in Power BI, and are passionate about using data to drive business performance.

Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis & Business Intelligence


Collect, clean, and analyze data from multiple sources (databases, APIs, external files)
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI or similar BI tools
Create compelling data visualizations to effectively communicate insights to stakeholders
Perform advanced data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and business opportunities
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into reporting solutions
Ensure data accuracy and consistency through validation processes
Build and maintain data models to support reporting and business intelligence needs
Provide analytical insights to support both operational and strategic decision-making.


Reporting & Visualization


Design and implement reporting frameworks to deliver timely and accurate business metrics
Automate recurring reports and develop self-service analytics solutions
Create real-time dashboards for monitoring business performance
Maintain and enhance existing reporting infrastructure
Provide training and support to end users on dashboards and reporting tools.


Requirements

Education & Experience


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or related field
3-5 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or reporting roles
Proven experience delivering end-to-end data projects
Strong English communication skills (written and spoken).


Technical Skills


Strong proficiency with Power BI (required) or other BI platforms (Tableau, QlikView, Looker)
Expertise in DAX and Power Query for advanced Power BI development
Proficiency in Python or R for data analysis and automation
Experience with ETL tools and processes
Knowledge of cloud data services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
Familiarity with API integrations and data connectivity
Experience with data warehousing concepts and dimensional modeling.


Data Management & Governance


Strong understanding of data quality management
Familiarity with data governance frameworks and compliance standards
Knowledge of data security and privacy best practices
Show more

Title: Supply Chain Data Analyst (Multiple Locations in Europe)
Description:
We are seeking a Supply Chain Data Analyst to join our Supply Chain team. The position can be based in any of the following locations: Warsaw (PL), Hoofddorp (NL), London (UK), Barcelona (ES), Milan (IT), Oberhausen (DE), or Paris (FR).







About Barentz

Barentz is the global specialty ingredients solution provider. The company sources branded specialty ingredients from leading manufacturers worldwide and its ingredient experts provide value-added technical support which includes pre-mixing, blending, ingredient formulation and ingredient testing from its state-of-the-art, customized formulation centers and application laboratories in EMEA, Americas and Asia-Pacific.




Established in 1953, Barentz has operations in more than 70 countries with a strong presence in Europe and North America, and a rapidly growing network in Latin America and Asia-Pacific. With a turnover of €2.3 billion, the company employs over 2,800 people worldwide and serves more than 27,000 customers. For more information, visit: www.barentz.com




At Barentz, our core values are the foundation of our success. They unite and inspire us, define our identity, and guide our daily efforts. We are one team with one goal, driven to achieve greatness together. Our core values:

• We are One Team,

• We are Knowledge Driven,

• We are Strong Partners,

• We are Entrepreneurial,

• We embrace Change,

• We live by Integrity.




If you’re passionate about these values and ready to make a difference, we want you on our team! Apply now and be a part of our exciting journey to achieve our purpose.







About this role

Job Purpose

The Supply Chain Data Intelligence and Analytics Coordinator is responsible for gathering, managing, analysing, and interpreting data across the end-to-end supply chain. This role supports data-driven decision-making, improves operational performance, and enhances efficiency. By translating raw data into actionable insights through scorecards, dashboards, reports, and predictive models, this role serves as a vital link between supply chain operations and strategic outcomes.




Key Responsibilities

Data Management & Analysis

Collect, clean, and validate supply chain data from various internal and external systems (e.g., F&O ERP, CRM, 3PL WMS/TMS, and Principal platforms).
Support the design and development of supply chain scorecards, dashboards, and reports for key performance indicators (KPIs) such as OTIF, inventory turns, and forecast accuracy.
Perform descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analytics to uncover trends, identify gaps, and highlight improvement opportunities.
Maintain data accuracy and support analytical consistency across platforms.




Performance Monitoring & Reporting

Coordinate the regular update and distribution of supply chain performance metrics.
Monitor key indicators such as logistics costs, inventory levels, lead times, supplier performance, and demand planning accuracy.
Support monthly business reviews and cross-functional meetings by providing timely, insightful data analyses.




Tool & System Optimization

Collaborate with IT and data teams to enhance data integration and analytics infrastructure.
Leverage tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Excel, SQL, and optionally Python/R for advanced modelling and visualizations.
Uphold data governance standards to ensure consistency, reliability, and accessibility across the supply chain ecosystem.







About You

Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in supply chain management, Data Analytics, Industrial Engineering, Business Intelligence, or a related field.
2–5 years of experience in supply chain analytics, logistics, or operations.
Strong analytical skills with proficiency in Excel, SQL, and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Experience working with ERP systems, especially Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O, and an understanding of end-to-end supply chain processes.
Proven ability to work with large datasets to extract and communicate actionable insights.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work cross-functionally.




Preferred / Optional Qualifications:

Experience with Python, R, or other data science tools.
Familiarity with forecasting models and supply planning tools.
Knowledge of data warehousing solutions (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery).
Exposure to AI/ML applications within supply chain environments.







Skills/profile:

Strong problem-solving mindset with exceptional attention to detail.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities under tight deadlines.
Proactive and self-motivated, with a focus on continuous improvement.




Key Interdependencies & Responsibilities

Serve as a liaison between supply chain, commercial, finance, and IT teams, ensuring alignment on analytics needs and priorities.
Support key supply chain projects through ad-hoc data analysis and scenario modelling.
Provide training and guidance to end users on dashboards, reporting tools, and data interpretation as needed.







Why Barentz?

At Barentz, you’ll be part of a dynamic, international company built on strong values. Our "One Team, One Goal" mentality is reflected in everything we do — from how we work together to how we support our people.

Competitive package including bonus structure.
An inspiring multinational company in a fast-growing and innovative business
Flexible and hybrid working environment.
Fringe benefits depend on your location.







Interested?

If you feel excited reading the above and want to join our journey, please send your resume in English by using the Apply button. Any questions regarding this position, please contact Jill.Lan@barentz.com

HTML:
We are seeking a Supply Chain Data Analyst to join our Supply Chain team. The position can be based in any of the following locations: Warsaw (PL), Hoofddorp (NL), London (UK), Barcelona (ES), Milan (IT), Oberhausen (DE), or Paris (FR).



About Barentz

Barentz is the global specialty ingredients solution provider. The company sources branded specialty ingredients from leading manufacturers worldwide and its ingredient experts provide value-added technical support which includes pre-mixing, blending, ingredient formulation and ingredient testing from its state-of-the-art, customized formulation centers and application laboratories in EMEA, Americas and Asia-Pacific.


Established in 1953, Barentz has operations in more than 70 countries with a strong presence in Europe and North America, and a rapidly growing network in Latin America and Asia-Pacific. With a turnover of €2.3 billion, the company employs over 2,800 people worldwide and serves more than 27,000 customers. For more information, visit: www.barentz.com

Job ID: No.257

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Nederlands is vereist)

Amsterdam, Nederland

Tot €45.000 + benefits




Wil jij onderdeel worden van een divers data team dat zich onderscheid op de retail markt doormiddel van een eigen platform? Word de nieuwe data / business analist en sluit je aan bij een snelgroeiend retail – technologie bedijf.




Het bedrijf

Het bedrijf werkt met uiteenlopende retail relaties en voorziet retailers van klantinzichten en oplossingen doormiddel van data. Een snelgroeiend bedrijf met een multidisciplinair team om hard mee aan de slag te gaan aan het platform.




De Rol:

Als Data Analist ga je binnen het bedrijf aan de slag met data inrichting en beheer van een retail-analytics platform, waarbij je een cruciale rol kunt spelen bij business bevorderingen van de klant. Wat meer informatie wat betreft de rol:




Het aanleveren van analyses en inzichten intern en voor de klant
Support bij ad hoc analytische klant aanvragen
Inrichten en beheer van data en data – bronnen
Het opzetten van pipelines, en een bijdrage leveren aan het inrichten van dashboards en data solutions.
Bewaken van data kwaliteit.
Communiceren met retail-klanten ter bevordering van de business.




Expertise

Ervaring met Python, R, SQL, en meer
Uitstekende communicatie vaardigheden
Een innovatieve mindset die bijdragen aan verdere ontwikkelingen binnen het bedrijf
retail ervaring is een plus




The Benefits

Een passend salaris bij ervaring en achtergrond
30 vakantie dagen
Laptop / telefoon vergoeding
Een pensioen regeling




Interesse? Reageer doormiddel van het sturen van je CV via de knop naar Elisabeth Oudman.

Title: EMAT Data Analyst
Description:
PIPECARE Group is currently looking for EMAT Data Analyst to join our team.

By providing technology and service focused solutions to the international arena of the oil and gas industry, the PIPECARE Group of companies has been helping our customers ensure the integrity of their pipeline and facility assets for over 20 years. Due to our global focus and international growth, Pipecare is seeking experienced UT/UTCD Integrity Engineer [Level 3] to support our continued growth.

The selected candidate will be working with our project execution teams to ensure the timely and accurate reporting of in-line inspection results, with a focus on our custom-tailored reporting solutions to satisfy our customers’ needs. This includes the review of customer requirement specifications, processing of in-line inspection data, the analysis and identification of pipeline features and anomalies within processed data sets, application of industry accepted anomaly assessment criteria, ensuring the quality and accuracy of the final results, and compiling the results of our inspection activities in a concise, comprehensive custom tailored report for our customers.

Industry/sector: Oil & Gas / In Line Inspection services

Qualification: Certification in EMAT technology [Level 3]

Min years of experience: minimum last 15+ years working as EMAT Data Analyst

Other requirements: solution – oriented attitude; hands on approach; disciplined; team player; self-motivated

Responsibilities include:


Checking and approving the tool performance during the PTT
Checking the data quality of ILI runs
EMAT Data Analysis (Valid or expired ASNT LIII or LII Certificate)
Checking and implementing dig verification task at sites and preparing relevant reports
Reviewing the software inter phase
Reviewing software user manuals
Preparing/Reviewing DAD quality documentation
To ensure accurate tool sensitivity values are provided to TM in Tool Checklist
To prepare a specific Run assessment report
To identify obstructions in the pipeline.
To produce technically valid Preliminary / Final report
To inform HO-DAD about the results and/or to implement the results into the reports
To ensure that the coordinates are synchronized with the data
To alert the R&D regarding software problems
To update the documentation
To produce and update standard quality procedures
To alert the DA Team Leader / DA Manager regarding software problems
Execute all other tasks as requested by DA Team Leader or DA Manager and/or Executive Team within the assigned job role


Qualified Candidates will possess:


College degree in engineering or related fields.
Database development and implementation experience.
Process analysis, requirement / functional specification development experience.
Quality assurance of databases, reporting experience.
Experience of working on large, complex and multiple databases
Proficient in using analytical tools and instruments, for instance Excel, Microsoft Access, Minitab and SPSS
High ability to work with numbers.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Analytical mind which can process information logically
Professional level of English language


Job requirements:


Ability to work for extended periods of time in a stationary position at computers and workstations
Ability to pass vision acuity and color differentiation examinations
Business travel may be required for internal training, internal meetings, site visits, and customer meetings [international travel may be required]
Ability to work flexible hours based on business and project needs
Ability to work either independently or within a team to ensure project success


Physical and Mental Requirements:


Lifting and Carrying: Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds
Mobility: Must be able to walk and climb to perform duties, including maneuvering within a refinery or plant environment and accessing elevated platforms via ladders and stairwells
Communication: Sufficient clarity of speech and hearing, or other communication capabilities, to communicate effectively
Focus and Multitasking: Ability to maintain focus and multitask effectively
Safety Equipment: Must be able to wear safety equipment as required by the safety department for personal protection, if/where needed in manufacturing environments.
Personal Mobility and Reflexes: Sufficient personal mobility and physical reflexes, with or without reasonable accommodations, to perform office duties and travel to off-site locations when necessary


About PIPECARE Group:

PIPECARE Group offers comprehensive In-Line Inspection Services to identify and size pipeline threats, Utilizing advanced technologies such as Magnetic Flux Leakage, Transverse Field Inspection, Ultrasound, and specialized tools, PIPECARE ensures precise detection and assessment of various pipeline anomalies.

What we do:

In-Line Inspection Services

PIPECARE provides In-Line Inspection Services to locate, identify, and size threats, supporting integrity management requirements.

Check out our AI Technology and other cutting-edge technologies by clicking the following YouTube Links:

PIPECARE Group - YouTube

SMART AI CALIPER - Inspection Experience Like Never Before

Inspection Technologies

Magnetic Flux Leakage (MFL): Detects and sizes general corrosion and metal loss anomalies, especially circumferentially oriented.

Transverse Field Inspection (TFI): Detects and sizes general corrosion and metal loss anomalies, primarily axially oriented.

Ultrasound (UT): Detects and sizes general and other metal loss anomalies with high depth sizing accuracy.

Ultrasonic Crack Detection: Detects and sizes cracks and colonies of cracks.

Caliper (Geometry): Detects and sizes deviations in the ideal circular shape of a pipeline (dents, ovalities, wrinkles, etc.).

Specialized Tools and Technologies

Combo Tools: Use multiple measurement systems in various combinations.

Specialized Tubing Technologies: Designed for Furnace and Downhole Operations.

Equal Opportunity Employer: We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst / Data Visualization Expert
Description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they are doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

Data Analyst / Data Visualization Expert

6 month FTC

Location: Eindhoven (onsite 3 days per week)

Fractal is a strategic AI partner to Fortune 500 companies with a vision to power every human decision in the enterprise. Fractal is building a world where individual choices, freedom, and diversity are the greatest assets. An ecosystem where human imagination is at the heart of every decision. Where no possibility is written off, only challenged to get better. We believe that a true Fractalite is the one who empowers imagination with intelligence. Fractal has been featured as a Great Place to Work by The Economic Times in partnership with the Great Place to Work® Institute and recognized as a ‘Cool Vendor’ and a ‘Vendor to Watch’ by Gartner.

About The Role

As a Data Analyst / Data Visualization Expert you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets and creating compelling visuals that communicate insights effectively to various stakeholders. Your role will involve both rigorous data analysis and the design of clear, precise, and engaging visualizations.

Key Responsibilities


Conduct thorough data analysis to identify trends, correlations, and patterns within datasets.
Develop impactful data visualizations using tools such as QuickSight, QlikSense, Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Create dashboards and reports that effectively communicate data findings to technical and non-technical audiences.
Ensure data integrity and quality by continuously auditing and cleansing data.
Work alongside cross-departmental teams to integrate data-driven insights into business strategies.
Provide technical guidance on best practices for data visualization and data storytelling.
Stay informed about the latest trends and techniques in data visualization and analytics.



Qualifications


Bachelor's/Master degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in data analysis and data visualization.
Proficient in using data visualization tools such as QuickSight, QlikSense,Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Strong analytical skills and experience with analytics tools such as SQL, Python, or R.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to convey complex data insights in a simple and impactful way.
Demonstrated ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team environment.
Strong attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.
Experience with dashboard design and data storytelling.
Preferred: Java engineering experience for data processing and system integration tasks.



If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by clicking Introduce Yourself in the top-right corner of the page or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!

Title: Data Analist
HTML:
Als Data Analyst bij DHL eCommerce ben jij de sleutel tot het onderhouden, uitbreiden, rapporteren en analyseren van onze operationele (stuur)informatie. Je zorgt ervoor dat onze informatie altijd accuraat en up-to-date is, zodat we de beste service kunnen bieden aan onze klanten. In een dynamisch netwerk houd je de ontwikkelingen scherp in de gaten, bijvoorbeeld door het begeleiden van aanpassingen in de businesslogica naar aanleiding van wijzigingen in pakketroutes. Je begeleidt de implementatie van nieuwe logicaschema’s door IT. Samen met stakeholders vanuit Operations en Sales breng je nieuwe netwerken in kaart en zorg je ervoor dat deze goed worden geïntegreerd in onze rapportages.


Je rapporteert de informatie die is opgeslagen op het DHL-dataplatform via Microsoft Power BI. Bij complexe vraagstukken bied je ondersteuning en advies en voer je analyses uit in Power BI of Excel om de efficiëntie van onze operaties te verbeteren. Jouw inzichten maken het verschil in onze logistieke processen!


Jouw nieuwe werkplek

Je komt te werken op het hoofdkantoor van DHL e-Commerce in Utrecht. Hier maak je deel uit van een jong en dynamisch team van Data Analysts binnen ons Operations-team. We stimuleren samenwerking en innovatie en luisteren altijd naar jouw ideeën en feedback. Bij DHL e-Commerce hechten we veel waarde aan een inclusieve en ondersteunende werkcultuur, waar iedereen de kans krijgt om te groeien en zich te ontwikkelen.


Dit ben jij

Je hebt ervaring met Microsoft Power BI en Excel en beschikt over sterke analytische vaardigheden op hbo- of wo-niveau. Communicatieve vaardigheden zijn essentieel, omdat je regelmatig overleg hebt met stakeholders. Je bent probleemoplossend ingesteld en kunt goed samenwerken met IT-teams en andere afdelingen. Daarnaast ben je leergierig en bereid om nieuwe inzichten te verwerven om onze processen te verbeteren.


Dit krijg jij

  • Een salaris tussen de €3700 - €4000 bruto op basis van 40 uur, gebaseerd op je kennis en ervaring;
  • Reiskostenvergoeding van €0,23 per kilometer, met een maximum tot 30 km enkele reis;
  • Een goede pensioenregeling;
  • Standaard 23 vakantiedagen en 8% vakantiegeld;
  • Cao à la carte: een budget dat je kan inzetten voor extra vakantiedagen of salaris;
  • Een laptop en telefoon van de zaak;
  • Opleidings- en trainingsmogelijkheden vanaf dag één;
  • Mooie doorgroeikansen binnen de organisatie;
  • De mogelijkheid tot hybride werken.


De toekomst van bezorgen is geel-rood

DHL eCommerce is het meest toonaangevende logistiekbedrijf ter wereld. Dat klinkt misschien opschepperig, maar zo bedoelen we het niet: we zien het namelijk niet als een verdienste, maar als een verantwoordelijkheid. Dankzij onze positie kunnen we het verschil maken voor onze mensen, het milieu en de maatschappij. En dat blijkt: we zijn een Great Place to Work, Top Employer 2025 en helpen via DHL Cares ontzettend veel mensen die dat hard kunnen gebruiken – daar zijn we trots op!


Solliciteren?

Solliciteer dan nu met je cv en eventueel een motivatiebrief. Heb je vragen over de vacature of wil je meer informatie? Aarzel dan niet om contact op te nemen met Eva Hazes, Corporate Recruiter, via eva.hazes@dhl.com. We kijken ernaar uit om van je te horen!


Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Title: Retail Data Analyst
Description:
Discover a world where we empower frontline teams, optimise retail operations, and innovate to create seamless shop experiences for our customers in Retail Operations & Training.

Share your talents

As our new Retail Data Analyst, you’ll play a crucial role in driving commercial performance by turning data into clear, actionable insights. Through your work, you'll help shape decisions across commercial programs, sales, and operational planning—making a tangible impact on our Retail business.

You have a passion for transforming complex data into simple, compelling stories. Whether you’re diving into country-level KPIs, analyzing training or promotions, or advising internal teams on dashboarding solutions, your insights will directly influence strategic actions across our Retail markets. Strong project management and stakeholder engagement skills will be essential, as you’ll either lead or support key initiatives, always working alongside a collaborative and ambitious team.

In This Role You Shine By


Analyzing and preparing data from PowerBI to uncover trends, relationships, and opportunities for improvement.
Translating insights into clear summaries and dashboards tailored to a non-technical audience.
Evaluating retail performance (e.g., campaigns, commercial moments and events, short shelf-time items) and share actionable recommendations to steer future- and interim results.
Deep diving into key topics affecting shop floor performance and retail programs.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to align on forecasting, stock levels, promotions, innovations, and long-term planning.
Continuously optimizing and supporting the reporting processes for accuracy, transparency, and impact.


Bring all of you

High on energy, low on ego, and with lots of humor. You’re hands-on, proactive, and driven by both your own success and that of your team. You combine a brand-first mindset with a data-driven approach, contributing to the growth of Rituals as an iconic well-being brand.


2–5 years experience in a retail environment is essential
Strong stakeholder management skills—building trust, aligning priorities, and communicating clearly across teams and partners.
Solid project management capabilities—planning, prioritizing, and driving initiatives forward independently and in a team.
High attention to detail and accuracy, with a strong numeric and analytical skill set.
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment.
A proactive, hands-on mentality and a structured way of working.
Excellent written and spoken communication skills in English.
Comfort navigating change, ambiguity, and business challenges with optimism and resilience.


About The Team

Together with 7 colleagues you are part of our young and ambitious Retail Commercial Development Team which is part of the bigger Retail & Training team at our Central Head office in Amsterdam. Our team consist of a fun mix of people with various backgrounds and areas of expertise. We all have a huge sense of commitment, we love to connect with each other, exchange ideas and knowledge.

Rituals offers a challenging role in an eager and diverse team, where empowering your colleagues (and vice versa) is part of the deal. Although our proposition encompasses attractive benefits and a compensation package, the international scope and impact of the position may appeal to you even more. You will spend (quite some of) your time at our Amsterdam HQ. We hope you can appreciate the view of one of the most iconic Amsterdam canals.

The Next Steps


Our recruiter will contact you within 10 working days
First interview with the Hiring Manager follows
Online assessment
A second interview with Team Members
In the event of a positive outcome, you will receive a proposal with the terms of employment


If you have any questions, reach out to Camilla at camilla.milson@rituals.com. Please note, applications via email will not be accepted.

Benefits of working at Rituals


Training, coaching & development opportunities
Staff discount on Rituals products
Attractive bonus
Numerous health & wellbeing initiatives
Company & team events
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Over de functie

Bij Yielder Group werk je als Data Analist (Power BI) op het snijvlak van data en marketing. Je verzamelt en structureert marktdata, borgt de kwaliteit en vertaalt dit naar heldere dashboards en rapportages. Samen met BI en marketing verbeter je processen en help je mee richting te geven aan datagedreven marketing automation. Jouw analyses maken het mogelijk om klantprofielen steeds slimmer en meer geautomatiseerd op te bouwen.




Wat jij zoekt:

Een rol waarin je data echt kan laten spreken
Samenwerken met BI en marketing in een groeiend team
De kans om te bouwen aan datagedreven processen




Wat jij krijgt:

Een marktconform salaris + vakantiegeld
Ruimte voor eigen initiatief en ontwikkeling
Jaarlijkse bonus tot 10% en 50% pensioenbijdrage




Over de organisatie:

Yielder Group helpt organisaties groeien met datagedreven marketing
Werken in een groeiend team met korte lijnen en veel energie
Ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen en ideeën echt tot uitvoering te brengen




Klaar voor de volgende stap?

Herken jij jezelf in deze vacature of wil je meer weten? Solliciteer direct!

Title: Data & Analytics Consultant
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.









Job Description



Who will you be working with?

The Amsterdam Data Science team is young, diverse and growing. You will work in a team that challenges you and invests in your professional development. We have a flat structure and rely on the entrepreneurial spirit of our colleagues. Taking the initiative is strongly encouraged. We strive for well-being, diversity and knowledge sharing within the team, so that we can grow together.



What you are going to do

As a Data & Analytics Consultant, you will work with our Data Scientists, Data Engineers and other consultants at Sia, on various client projects in multidisciplinary teams. You will use your analytical mindset and data skills to solve complex business problems and deliver actionable insights.



Responsibilities include:



Work closely with Sia consultants on assignments with an analytical challenge
Identify business problems by extracting, interpreting and explaining insights from data
Develop statistical and analytical methods to solve specific operational problems
Ensure that the deep insights generated from advanced analytics translate into business impact
Present results and conduct workshops at customer sites

Who you are



You want to make business impact, not only by doing data analysis, but also by making recommendations through inspiring presentations
You have the ability to adapt quickly and work across different business areas within a challenging environment
You have exceptional analytical and quantitative problem solving skills
You have the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
You have excellent communication skills and can present complex concepts in a synthetic way
You have a good track record of leadership in an academic, professional or extracurricular setting.


Qualifications



What you need



Completed WO Master's degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Business Analytics or a related field of study.
You are a young graduate or already have several years of experience in a similar position.
Good skills in Python and at least one other analytical language (e.g. R, SQL)
Experience with data visualization and reporting (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)
Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques or optimization is a strong plus
Fluent in English and Dutch, both written and oral. Additional languages are a strong plus.

What we offer



Training opportunities to develop yourself further
Opportunities to work on international assignments
Flexible working hours
A meritocratic approach to promotion
Performance related bonus
An attractive package (e.g. lease car, health insurance, pension scheme)


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position



Non-Dutch speaker will unfortunately not be accepted



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Show more

Title: Analyst
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today, our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity, and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change, helping clients initiate, navigate, and benefit from transformation. Optimism is our force multiplier, mitigating downside and maximizing opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our +3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results; our optimism transforms outcomes.





Job Description



Collecting, analyzing, and structuring information to support projects.



Personal & professional growth



Works on personal growth and learns the intricacies of the profession and sector by being curious and showing interest
Shows ownership of tasks, asks for help/questions in time when stuck, and aligns expectations with the project team
Collaborates constructively with colleagues and stakeholders and demonstrates reliability

Client & quality



Supports (senior) consultants in successfully executing projects by:
Collecting information
Analyzing and making this information insightful
Preparing workshops

Sia’s growth



Commerce: Assists in developing commercial opportunities and proposals
Knowledge: Shares acquired knowledge internally

Portfolio: Stays informed about the services and projects delivered by Sia





Qualifications


You have completed your Master’s Degree
You have 0 to 2 years’ experience within a consultancy firm
Sectoral knowledge: Telecom & Tech / Financial Services / Automotive / Life Sciences
Outstanding collaborative team player and good communication skills
Analytical mind, exploring options and able to synthesize into conclusions
Dutch and English communication and presentation skills are mandatory

What do we offer?



Competitive salary with extra advantages: a company car or flexible mobility plan, a clear and structured yearly salary increase and bonuses
Training plan to develop yourself as an expert in your discipline
You have the opportunity to work from home, the client or from our offices in Amsterdam or Maastricht
Working in an international environment which creates opportunities to share knowledge and work together on international projects with colleagues all over the world


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position

Title: Data Analytics Consultant
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. 



With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.





Job Description



As a Data Analytics Consultant, you will be at the heart of delivering impactful data-driven strategies to our clients. You will collaborate closely with local and international clients to bridge the gap between business objectives and technical execution.



You will help deliver actionable data-driven solutions & insights, and present the results in an interactive, easily understandable manner.



What you will do



Collaborate with stakeholders to define business goals and shape solution blueprints through workshops and mock-ups.



Prepare and validate data by mapping, extracting, cleaning, enriching, and performing feature engineering to establish stable datasets for analysis.



Design, implement, and automate interactive dashboards and customized reports that cater to specific client requirements using advanced visualization tools.



Conduct comprehensive statistical analysis and exploratory data investigations to extract actionable insights supporting decision-making.



Translate complex technical and analytical findings into clear, understandable presentations for non-technical stakeholders.



Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analytics, applying innovative approaches to enhance service offerings.



Provide guidance and support to business users and team members in leveraging data effectively, contributing to a data-driven culture and continuous learning.



Within Sia, you will



Contribute to enhancing Sia’s Data Science and Generative AI offerings through internal training sessions, working groups, and publications.



Represent Sia at professional events, actively contributing to thought leadership (articles, white papers, webinars).



Support business development by crafting proposals/offers, identifying collaboration opportunities, and nurturing long-term client relationships.





Qualifications



About You



You bring:



A Master's degree in Business, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.



0–3 years of experience in data analytics or a relevant consulting or industry role.



Fluency in Dutch or French, and English.



Strategic thinking with strong analytical skills and a proactive approach.



Experience in clearly communicating and presenting complex ideas to varied audiences.



Efficient collaboration with various stakeholders, internally and externally, to gather requirements and support data-driven decisions.



Eagerness to work alongside and learn from more experienced colleagues while contributing fresh ideas to team projects.



Interest in applying innovative analytics and AI solutions to drive sustainability and create meaningful business impact.



Your technical toolkit:



Hands-on experience with Python or R for data analysis.



Proficiency with SQL and Microsoft Excel for data manipulation.



Familiarity with dashboarding tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.



Knowledge of cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a strong plus.







Why Join Us?



Tailored career development with ongoing training in analytics, AI, and consulting skills.



Project diversity: Collaborate on high-impact assignments across sectors and geographies.



Flexibility: Hybrid work model combining office, remote, and client-based work.



Attractive compensation package including annual raises, bonuses, and personalized mobility options.



Global network: Be part of a vibrant international consulting community with thought leaders in AI and analytics.





Additional Information



Unfortunately, we are unable to provide a work permit for this position.



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or disciplinary actions, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, and business needs.











Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: Retail Data Analyst
Description:
Retail Data Analyst | Sports & Lifestyle Brand | Global Powerhouse | Superb Culture | Real Growth Potential | €50,000 - €56,000 + Benefits




Zachary Daniels are delighted to be partnered with one of the globe's most recognisable sports & lifestyle brands in the recruitment of a Retail Analyst.




Our client has a brilliant reputation in the market and is continuously improving; whether that be their product, their training or their facilities, they are improving and they are growing. Their head office culture is phenomenal which is a main selling point to anyone joining this global powerhouse. They give responsibility, they develop and they reward! Plus you get great discount and very good hybrid working and flexi hours....




This is the perfect time to join the business as they plan to double in size over the next 3 years.

The Role:

As a Retail Analyst, you will play a crucial role in turning complex retail data into actionable insights that help shape key business decisions across stores, channels, and product categories. You'll be at the heart of our data-driven retail strategy - identifying trends, unlocking opportunities, and enabling smarter decision-making across the business.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyse large and complex datasets to provide insights into retail performance, customer behaviour, and operational efficiency
Develop dashboards, automated reports, and visualisations using Power BI and Excel to track KPIs and trends
Support cross-functional teams with data-driven insights on inventory management, sales performance, and store operations
Monitor and analyse transactional data to identify patterns and opportunities for optimisation
Collaborate with merchandising, operations, and finance teams to support strategic planning and execution
Drive continuous improvement in data quality, reporting efficiency, and business intelligence processes




What We're Looking For:

Proven experience analysing large, complex retail datasets
Strong working knowledge of Power BI and Excel for data visualisation, reporting, and automation
Solid understanding of retail operations, sales metrics, and inventory management
Experience working with transactional data and turning raw data into actionable business insights
Strong commercial acumen with excellent attention to detail and communication skills
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment




Why Join Our Client?

Be part of a brand with global reach and unstoppable energy
Collaborate with passionate, forward-thinking professionals
Enjoy a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits
Access to exciting employee perks, including product discounts and exclusive events
Opportunity to make a real impact in a fast-moving, high-growth business




Ready to Join the Movement?

If you're passionate about retail analytics and want to contribute to one of the most iconic brands in the world, we'd love to hear from you.

BBBH34203

Show more
HTML:
Retail Data Analyst | Sports & Lifestyle Brand | Global Powerhouse | Superb Culture | Real Growth Potential | €50,000 - €56,000 + Benefits


Zachary Daniels are delighted to be partnered with one of the globe's most recognisable sports & lifestyle brands in the recruitment of a Retail Analyst.


Our client has a brilliant reputation in the market and is continuously improving; whether that be their product, their training or their facilities, they are improving and they are growing. Their head office culture is phenomenal which is a main selling point to anyone joining this global powerhouse. They give responsibility, they develop and they reward! Plus you get great discount and very good hybrid working and flexi hours....


This is the perfect time to join the business as they plan to double in size over the next 3 years.

The Role:

As a Retail Analyst, you will play a crucial role in turning complex retail data into actionable insights that help shape key business decisions across stores, channels, and product categories. You'll be at the heart of our data-driven retail strategy - identifying trends, unlocking opportunities, and enabling smarter decision-making across the business.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Analyse large and complex datasets to provide insights into retail performance, customer behaviour, and operational efficiency
  • Develop dashboards, automated reports, and visualisations using Power BI and Excel to track KPIs and trends
  • Support cross-functional teams with data-driven insights on inventory management, sales performance, and store operations
  • Monitor and analyse transactional data to identify patterns and opportunities for optimisation
  • Collaborate with merchandising, operations, and finance teams to support strategic planning and execution
  • Drive continuous improvement in data quality, reporting efficiency, and business intelligence processes


What We're Looking For:

  • Proven experience analysing large, complex retail datasets
  • Strong working knowledge of Power BI and Excel for data visualisation, reporting, and automation
  • Solid understanding of retail operations, sales metrics, and inventory management
  • Experience working with transactional data and turning raw data into actionable business insights
  • Strong commercial acumen with excellent attention to detail and communication skills
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment


Why Join Our Client?

  • Be part of a brand with global reach and unstoppable energy
  • Collaborate with passionate, forward-thinking professionals
  • Enjoy a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits
  • Access to exciting employee perks, including product discounts and exclusive events
  • Opportunity to make a real impact in a fast-moving, high-growth business


Ready to Join the Movement?

If you're passionate about retail analytics and want to contribute to one of the most iconic brands in the world, we'd love to hear from you.

BBBH34203

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analytics – Analyst – Groningen – ALTEN Nederland




De functie




Als onderdeel van ons groeiend bedrijf zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Analytics – Analyst om ons team te versterken en bij te dragen aan lopende klantprojecten in Groningen.




Als Data Analytics – Analyst omvatten je belangrijkste taken:




Data Analytics & Modeling: Ontwikkelen en optimaliseren van datamodellen met behulp van dimensionale modelleringstechnieken ter ondersteuning van analytische besluitvorming
Data Pipeline Ontwikkeling & Automatisering: Ondersteunen bij het ontwerp, de implementatie en automatisering van datastromen voor efficiënte gegevensextractie, transformatie en laden (ETL/ELT-processen)
Dashboard Ontwikkeling: Ontwerpen en bouwen van interactieve dashboards en datavisualisaties met behulp van business intelligence-tools
Samenwerking & Klantbetrokkenheid: Actief samenwerken met stakeholders om bedrijfsbehoeften te vertalen naar technische analysemogelijkheden
Ondersteuning van Digitale Transformatie: Identificeren en implementeren van datagestuurde oplossingen ter verbetering van bedrijfsprocessen
Projectbetrokkenheid: Ondersteunen van de volledige implementatiecyclus, inclusief requirement gathering, testen en uitrol




Jouw profiel




Bachelor- of masterdiploma in een relevante richting
3–5 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie
Vaardig in SQL, dimensionale modellering en data pipeline ontwikkeling
Ervaring met tools zoals Tableau, Power BI of SAP Analytics Cloud
Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels
Gewenste soft skills: communicatievaardig, analytisch, proactief, leergericht




Arbeidsvoorwaarden

Je krijgt een vast contract
Je krijgt een leaseauto met tankpas
Mogelijkheid tot hybride werken
Maandelijkse netto onkostenvergoeding
27 vakantiedagen met de mogelijkheid om 10 extra dagen bij te kopen
Pensioenregeling zonder eigen bijdrage




Waarom kiezen voor ALTEN?




Impactvolle projecten in belangrijke sectoren: Draag bij aan betekenisvolle initiatieven in sectoren zoals defensie, transport, telecom en financiën, waar jouw expertise echt het verschil maakt.
Een breed klantenportfolio: Werk samen met zowel grote marktleiders als innovatieve middelgrote bedrijven en verzamel zo diverse en verrijkende ervaringen.
Versterk je loopbaan dankzij SDG’s expertise: Profiteer van voortdurende leermogelijkheden, technische communities en kennisdeling, versterkt door de integratie van SDG binnen ALTEN.
Een cultuur van innovatie en samenwerking: Ontplooi je in een omgeving die creativiteit waardeert, kennisdeling aanmoedigt en gezamenlijk succes stimuleert.




Over ALTEN




ALTEN is een wereldwijde leider in engineering- en technologieconsultancy, en ondersteunt topklanten in hun innovatie- en R&D-strategieën. Met meer dan 57.000 medewerkers in meer dan 30 landen zijn we actief in sectoren zoals lucht- en ruimtevaart, automotive, telecom, financiën, energie en life sciences.




ALTEN Netherlands is een belangrijke entiteit binnen de ALTEN Group, met kantoren in Eindhoven, Capelle aan den IJssel, Apeldoorn, Groningen en Amstelveen. Onze 550+ consultants leveren hoogwaardige oplossingen in technologie en IT. Al meer dan 20 jaar dragen we in Nederland bij aan impactvolle projecten in hightech, defensie, transport, telecom en financiën, en ondersteunen we bedrijven in hun technologische transformatie.




Een belangrijke stap in onze ontwikkeling was de overname van SDG, erkend als pionier in Data, Analytics & AI-consultancy en expert in complexe systeemengineering. Deze strategische stap heeft onze technische expertise vergroot en ons aanbod van geavanceerde oplossingen verbreed. Door de integratie van SDG’s kennis kunnen we innovatieve oplossingen bieden die extra waarde creëren voor zowel onze klanten als consultants, in Nederland en daarbuiten.




Klaar voor jouw volgende uitdaging?

Solliciteer nu en neem deel aan boeiende en impactvolle projecten bij ALTEN Nederland!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Nederlandstalig)

Amsterdam, Nederland

Tot €40.000 + benefits




Wil jij onderdeel worden van een divers data team dat zich onderscheid op de retail markt doormiddel van een eigen platform? Word de nieuwe data / business analist en sluit je aan bij een snelgroeiend retail – technologie bedijf.




Het bedrijf

Het bedrijf werkt met uiteenlopende retail relaties en voorziet retailers van klantinzichten en oplossingen doormiddel van data. Een snelgroeiend bedrijf met een multidisciplinair team om hard mee aan de slag te gaan aan het platform.




De Rol:

Als Data Analist ga je binnen het bedrijf aan de slag met data inrichting en beheer van een retail-analytics platform, waarbij je een cruciale rol kunt spelen bij business bevorderingen van de klant. Wat meer informatie wat betreft de rol:




Het aanleveren van analyses en inzichten intern en voor de klant
Support bij ad hoc analytische klant aanvragen
Inrichten en beheer van data en data – bronnen
Het opzetten van pipelines, en een bijdrage leveren aan het inrichten van dashboards en data solutions.
Bewaken van data kwaliteit.
Communiceren met retail-klanten ter bevordering van de business.




Expertise

Ervaring met Python, R, SQL, en meer
Uitstekende communicatie vaardigheden
Een innovatieve mindset die bijdragen aan verdere ontwikkelingen binnen het bedrijf
retail ervaring is een plus




The Benefits

Een passend salaris bij ervaring en achtergrond
30 vakantie dagen
Laptop / telefoon vergoeding
Een pensioen regeling




Interesse? Reageer doormiddel van het sturen van je CV via de knop naar Elisabeth Oudman.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Drive the future of sustainable mobility - with data!

We are looking for a Data Analyst to help SnappCar make smarter choices and turning data into insights and solutions to support the shift towards a more data-driven way of working.

At SnappCar, we're on a mission to halve the number of cars on the road by making car ownership unnecessary. Our peer-to-peer car sharing platform is active in the Netherlands and Germany – and we’re growing fast. As a Data Analyst you will help us improve the product, grow the community, and accelerate the shift towards shared mobility.

About The Job

As our Data Analyst, you’ll play an important role in enhancing decision-making across departments—from product and marketing to support, finance and sales. You’ll translate data into insights, while building and improving pipelines and data models using tools like Apache Airflow and Power BI. Success in this role depends not just on technical skill, but also on an understanding of business needs and an ability to transform data into tangible business impact.

What You’ll Be Doing


Build and maintain dashboards and reports (Power BI, Mixpanel, Snowflake) that support decisions across teams
Analyze user behavior, funnels, and marketplace trends to uncover growth opportunities
Support the product and growth team with smart data models, A/B testing, and experiment design
Strengthen and scale the data stack to ensure reliable, efficient pipelines and models
Work closely with stakeholders to present insights, challenge assumptions, and drive data-informed decisions


As we’re a scale-up, your scope will be quite broad, which is a great opportunity to learn. So next to analysis, you’ll also get to work and learn on more data engineering and data science projects.

About You


2–4 years of experience in data analytics, preferably in a product-led or marketplace environment
Proficiency in SQL and experience with BI tools (such as Power BI, Looker Studio, Tableau)
Familiarity with A/B testing methodologies and statistics
Bonus: experience with Python/R and other data modeling tools
Strong communication skills – you can tell a clear story with data
A proactive mindset and a natural curiosity to dig deep into numbers
Affinity with sustainability, mobility, or the sharing economy is a plus


Ideally we are looking for someone with relevant experience under their belt (2-4 years). And most importantly: you identify yourself with SnappCar’s mission and values, and are able to work in a scale-up environment.

Next to this, we want to stress that SnappCar is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from individuals of all races, genders, ages, religions, disabilities, and sexual orientations. We value the perspectives and experiences that individuals from diverse backgrounds bring to our organization, and we strive to create a workplace where everyone feels welcomed and supported. Therefore, we encourage qualified candidates of all backgrounds to apply.

What We Bring To The Table

At SnappCar we recognize the demands of being a data analyst, and want to make sure that next to a challenging and engaging position we offer you the following:


A meaningful impact on sustainability
Competitive salary
End-of-the-Year financial bonus, based on company performance
Unlimited Holiday Policy
Snabbatical (1 month paid leave after 3 years of employment, and 3 months leave after 5 years) to give you time to recharge
8% yearly holiday pay
Free rides (SnappCar credits to save on commutes!)
A very creative, energetic and international working environment at a great HQ office in the centre of Utrecht
A supportive team driven by innovation and growth with whom we have lots of fun team days and other events.
A laptop to do your work
A yearly budget for professional growth opportunities
Travel expenses paid (so you can actually get to the office on office days)
Delicious healthy lunches on office days


Lots of fun, teambuilding and celebrating successes together!

Apply for the job

If you’re excited about using your data skills to support a greener future at SnappCar, we’d love to meet you!

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Ben jij op zoek naar een rol waarin je data kunt structureren en écht impact maakt in een organisatie die nog volop groeit?




Houd je van procesverbetering, communiceren met teams én wil je iets moois opbouwen in een dynamische omgeving? Dan is deze organisatie op zoek naar jou!




Over de functie




Als Data-Analist stap je in bij een organisatie waar data en systemen nog in ontwikkeling zijn. Je helpt mee met structureren en mee te werken aan het data warehouse om rapportages te maken die financiële en vastgoedprocessen verbeteren. Samen met het research team werk je aan efficiëntere workflows en nieuwe tools, terwijl je stakeholders meeneemt in het data landschap. Je denkt strategisch mee over processen zoals projectmanagement en facturatie, en onderhoudt contact met IT-leveranciers om de basis te versterken




Je krijgt veel vrijheid om zelf vorm te geven aan je werk met kansen om te leren en te groeien in een organisatie die echt de volgende stap wilt maken.

Jouw werkzaamheden:

Data structureren
Rapportages maken voor financiën en vastgoed
Samenwerken met research om processen te verbeteren
Uitleggen van data-oplossingen aan stakeholders
Strategisch meedenken over businessprocessen
Contact onderhouden met IT-leveranciers




Over de organisatie

Onze klant is een Nederlandse organisatie met een rijke geschiedenis, gericht op het behoud van waardevolle gebouwen. Deze organisatie biedt een unieke kans om iets moois op te bouwen. Het team is klein en samenwerkend, met veel ruimte voor ontwikkeling.




De organisatie is op zoek naar een specialist die ervaring heeft met IT maar zich meer in de business wilt verdiepen, of iemand die al business ervaring heeft maar graag meer technische kennis zou willen opdoen.




Wie ben jij?

Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar ervaring binnen data of business
Kennis van SQL is een pré
Je spreekt goed Nederlands en kunt communiceren met business en IT
Je bent analytisch, houdt van verbeteren en bent communicatief sterk
Ervaring met vastgoed of procesverbetering is een pré




Wat bieden ze jou?

Salaris tussen €3.802 en €4.885 per maand
Werktijden van 24-40 uur, flexibel (minimaal 3 dagen op kantoor)
29 vakantiedagen per jaar bij fulltime
Pensioen 100% premievrij door de werkgever
Mobiliteitsvergoeding
Laptop en mobiele telefoon




Interesse?




Wil jij bijdragen aan de datagedreven groei van deze organisatie? Solliciteer dan direct! Stuur je cv mee, dan nemen we snel contact met je op.

Show more

Title: FP&A Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our FP&A team at Bizzdesign. Are you searching for a challenging new position within a dynamic international company? Then look no further because we might have a match!




Who are we?




Bizzdesign is a SaaS company with 25 years in the Enterprise Architecture and Strategic Portfolio Management industries, with our HQ in Enschede. Our platform helps large enterprises, including Fortune 500 companies, make better decisions through Enterprise Architecture. We recently acquired Alfabet and MEGA International, expanding our portfolio and enhancing our offerings. With over 600 people from 32 nationalities working across 19 countries, we are growing fast and making an impact.




At Bizzdesign, we pride ourselves on a culture of trust, flexibility, and no-nonsense collaboration. You will join a flat, transparent organization where autonomy is valued, and your voice matters; no layers of red tape, just smart people solving meaningful problems together. We believe in empowering our team with the freedom to work how and where they work best, supported by a strong foundation of mutual respect and accountability. If you are someone who thrives in a high-trust, low-ego environment and values results over hierarchy, you will fit right in.




What impact will you make?




As a Data Analyst in our FP&A team, you’ll be at the heart of transforming data into actionable insights that fuel smarter decisions across the business. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to translate their needs into impactful dashboards, models, and analyses that shape strategy and execution.




What will you do?




Acting as a trusted analytics partner to domain managers, providing data-driven insights and recommendations.
Building and maintaining scalable Power BI dashboards that are both insightful and future-proof.
Using Salesforce and other data sources to create meaningful reports and ensure consistent KPI definitions.
Designing and analyzing experiments with statistical models to validate ideas and guide decision-making.
Supporting the development of predictive analyses and contributing to strategies that identify growth opportunities and improve business performance.
Contributing to improving reporting tools and supporting data governance initiatives.




This role gives you the freedom to bring your expertise and ideas to life while making a visible impact on cross-departmental collaboration and decision-making.




Who are you?




You are a data storyteller with a strong technical foundation and a passion for turning numbers into business value. Curious, proactive, and collaborative, you thrive in a fast-paced, international environment and enjoy being a bridge between business and technology.




We are looking for someone with:




4+ years of experience in data analytics, ideally in a SaaS international setting.
Strong expertise in Power BI and Salesforce (must-have).
Advanced skills in SQL and Excel, with solid experience in BI tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, or similar).
A strong quantitative background (engineering, econometrics, sciences, or business analytics).
End-to-end understanding of databases, data warehouses, APIs, and data integration processes.
Ability to communicate complex insights in a clear and compelling way to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A self-starter mindset with eagerness to continuously improve processes and challenge the status quo.




What’s in it for you?




A competitive salary package, including an annual bonus
Premium pension plan to secure your future
28 vacation days with the option to buy 10 extras for ultimate flexibility
Hybrid working with 2 days a week in the office
An NS Business Card or mileage reimbursement to support your commute
Personal IT budget to upgrade your setup
Monthly work-from-home allowance to support your ideal home office setup
Supportive, collaborative team culture
Work with an international and diverse group of colleagues
Your input is valued, regardless of role or tenure

Recruitment process




In this role, you can expect the following interviewing process:

An initial screening call with our Internal Recruiter (30 minutes)
1st Interview with our FP&A and Business Applications managers (30 minutes)
Case-study development (2-3 hours)
Final Interview: CFO & peer combination (30 minutes)




Please submit your CV in English, as only this format will be reviewed.




Are you ready to start building your future with us?
