Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Scheduling isn't simply filling shifts. It's finding the sweet spot that enables businesses to grow and team members to enjoy the perfect work/life balance.






At Planday from Xero, we aim to use Agentic AI to build a future where managers can seamlessly free up invaluable time for their business and teams. We're not just building software: we're on a mission to make shift work more human, to change work/life balance from a luxury to a reality for all shift workers. We're using advanced technology to help humans reach their full potential. At work and in life.






Founded in 2004, Planday is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark and helps create perfect schedules for hundreds of thousands of users across the world.






As a Senior Data Analyst, you'll play a strategic role in transforming complex data into actionable insights that directly fuel our business growth and critical decisions. In this role, you'll bejoining our Data & Analytics team and will be reporting to our Head of Data.






You'll craft compelling data narratives, turning raw information into valuable assets that guide product development and key strategic choices. Collaborating across teams, you'll uncover pivotal metrics and deep customer insights, empowering informed decisions throughout Planday. Through impactful visualizations and persuasive communication, you'll ensure these insights resonate with stakeholders at all levels. Furthermore, you'll leverage advanced analytical techniques to pioneer predictive modeling and automation, fostering a culture of data-driven innovation that is central to Planday's continued success.







What you'll do

Collaborate cross-functionally with product, commercial, and leadership teams to define, track, and report critical metrics, delivering comprehensive customer insights.
Design and maintain robust data models that transform raw data into high-value assets, ensuring accuracy and quality.
Develop impactful, hands-on solutions, visualizations, and dashboards across the business, primarily utilizing Tableau to communicate insights effectively.
Leverage expert proficiency in Python, R, and SQL for advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and ensuring high data quality.
Apply advanced statistical analysis techniques for summarizing, interpreting, and predicting data, alongside machine learning concepts for predictive modeling techniques.
Translate complex data into clear, actionable narratives through compelling data storytelling, impactful presentations, and strong interpersonal communication.







Success looks like

Creating exceptional data models that consistently deliver accurate, high-quality data assets, underpinning strategic initiatives.
Proactively delivering actionable insights and critical metrics that directly lead to informed decisions and tangible business improvements for product and commercial teams.
Developing and implementing intuitive and highly impactful visualizations and dashboards that significantly elevate data-driven decision-making across Planday.
Providing insights and recommendations that are consistently trusted and acted upon by product and commercial teams, stemming from rigorous analysis and robust data practices.
Communicating complex data insights clearly, fostering understanding and alignment among stakeholders, resulting in measurable positive business impact.
Solving problems proactively and addressing data-related challenges, leading to continuous improvement and advancement in our analytical capabilities.
Sucessfully exploring and implementing advanced analytical techniques, including machine learning, to unlock new opportunities and generate groundbreaking insights.







What you'll bring with you

Proven expertise in Python, R, and advanced SQL (including window functions, CTEs) for advanced data management and statistical analysis.
Proficiency in crafting compelling data stories, leveraging visualization tools like Tableau to transform complex datasets into clear, impactful visualizations that resonate with diverse stakeholders.
Proven capability in product opportunity sizing, metric development, and building robust metric trees to guide product strategy and evaluation.
Mastery of advanced statistical analysis techniques, including hypothesis testing, various regression models, and time series analysis for forecasting.
Solid understanding and practical experience with user activity tracking tools like Mixpanel, Amplitude, or similar product analytics platforms.
Demonstrated ability to lead and optimize data wrangling and cleaning processes across multiple, complex projects.
Experience in designing and analyzing experiments (e.g., A/B tests) to establish causal relationships and inform data-driven decision-making.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into compelling narratives through data storytelling and high-impact presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
A highly analytical mindset, consistently identifying and solving complex data challenges with innovative solutions that directly drive data-driven strategic decisions.
Practical application of machine learning fundamentals to solve specific business problems through predictive modeling.







At Planday, we offer you

Benefits like pension, health insurance, inclusive support for new parents and generous vacation
On top of your annual base salary, you are offered to be part of an Employee Share Plan
Growth and progression opportunities – we want you to grow with us
Flexible remote work
Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities
Meaningful work – everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe
Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities







Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.






At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.






As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.






All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

Show more

At Planday, we offer you

    • Benefits like pension, health insurance, inclusive support for new parents and generous vacation

    • Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities

    • Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities



Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.



At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.



As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.



All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

    • Demonstrated ability to lead and optimize data wrangling and cleaning processes across multiple, complex projects.
    • Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into compelling narratives through data storytelling and high-impact presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
    • A highly analytical mindset, consistently identifying and solving complex data challenges with innovative solutions that directly drive data-driven strategic decisions.
    • Practical application of machine learning fundamentals to solve specific business problems through predictive modeling.



At Planday, we offer you

    • Benefits like pension, health insurance and generous vacation
    • Flexible remote work
    • Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities
    • Meaningful work – everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe
    • Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities



Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.



At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.



As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.

All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst – Business Improvement
Place: Esbjerg, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to be a part of a dedicated team working with Business Improvements across of Semco Maritime? Do you have a solid understanding of data, and do you have what it takes to match this with business needs? Do you want to work in a dynamic organizational setting, where every day is different? If so, we want to hear from you!

Your position

In your new position as Data Analyst in the Business Improvement department, you will be a valuable member of a dynamic team working with business improvements through digital transformation. You will work closely together with the business and develop needed digital improvements supporting Semco’s growth strategy.

Your place of work will be in Esbjerg, Denmark. The position is full-time, and you can expect Attendance at our office in Esbjerg on daily basis.

We are a team where a mindset for continuous improvement and optimization are key. As well as being agile towards supporting the business needs.

Your Tasks & Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst, you will be part of a team developing the needed digital data tools supporting Semco Maritime growth.

Your Tasks Will Include But Are Not Limited To


Support the organization with ad-hoc data analyses
Operational automation of manual workflows
Management of individual stakeholder needs
Maintenance of existing portfolio of solutions


Your Profile & Qualifications

We are looking for a newly graduated with relevant education, with solid understanding of data. It will be beneficial if you have knowledge of the entire Microsoft Power Platform like Power BI, Power apps, Power Automate etc.

You have a great overview, the ability to see the big picture, a structured approach, and are a team player.

You find it easy to work independently and take the initiative. You have drive and are motivated by a fast-track environment. You have a positive mindset and care deeply about the success of your work, your colleagues and the wider objectives set by the organization. You are able to communicate with others on a good and efficient basis and engage in the development of the department.

We expect you to have excellent written and verbal communication skills in Danish and English.

Technical Skills Knowledge of or basic understanding of concepts relating to the Microsoft power platform

MS Power Platform


MS Power Automate – Not mandatory, but beneficial
MS Power BI – Intermediate or above average.
MS Power Apps


Other Relevant Skills


SQL – basic
Excel incl. Power Query and VBA Coding


Welcome to Semco Maritime

At Semco Maritime, we create change. For people. For projects. And for the global energy sector. With us, you will join a community of over 2,500 of the most dedicated thinkers and doers in the energy industry who are driving real change and making their own personal mark on the global energy landscape.

While everyone knows why the energy transition is vital, we are concerned with the journey. How to get there. By providing the answers needed to make change real. Because we believe that global energy ambitions can only be realized through hard work and clever pragmatic solutions. This is what we do. This is what we invite you to participate in.

Safety is at the core of everything we do, and we are committed to protecting our people, partners, and the planet as we work towards a sustainable energy future.

So yes, working for us will change the energy sector – and may well change you too.

Care to join the movement?

Change. With us.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Aiming for new heights

At Scalepoint, we aim for the stars. Our ambition is clear: we want to conquer the world. We successfully help insurers help their customers. We support 26 insurers in five countries around Europe.




We’re on the lookout for a Business Intelligence Analyst who’s eager to turn complex data into clear insights and real business impact. In our BI team, you won’t just be building dashboards—you’ll be shaping how we understand our customers, track our performance, and make decisions.




You’ll join a tight-knit team who live and breathe data, partnering with stakeholders across the company to deliver reporting, analysis, and tools that matter. One day you might be delivering a KPI dashboard for a customer meeting, the next you’re helping Finance ensure invoicing runs flawlessly. Whether it’s deep-dive analysis, data modelling, or enabling self-service reporting, you’ll be right at the heart of it—working closely with our Insights & Reporting Lead, our Head of BI, and our development teams.




What kind of geek are you?

At Scalepoint, you will meet other geeks. They love to go to work – just like you. We’ll be looking forward to working with you if you are a world champion when it comes to:




Analytical mindset

You love making sense of complex data—finding the story in the numbers and turning it into dashboards or reports that spark better decisions, sharper insights, and greater value for both our customers and our business.




Fast learner

New tools and systems don’t scare you—they excite you. You don’t need to know everything we use today, but you have the curiosity and drive to pick it up quickly. You’ll be working with Microsoft Fabric, Power BI, Excel, MSSQL, and whatever new tech helps us get the job done.




Collaborative problem-solver

You thrive in a team setting and see challenges as puzzles to be solved together. Whether you’re working with developers, product managers, or customer-facing teams, you bring your skills, ideas, and a can-do mindset to move projects forward.




What to dive into

At Scalepoint, there’s always room for developing and exploring great ideas. We know it takes high ambitions to conquer the world.

You’re ambitious and full of ideas—and you’ll get the space to put them into action. Working closely with your teammates, you’ll dive into:

Designing and implementing solutions that make end-users self-reliant and confident in using data.
Developing and building BI tools that maximize our team’s impact across the business.
Collaborating directly with customers to understand reporting needs, translate them into practical solutions, and continuously evolve the value we deliver through data.
Driving knowledge sharing so insights and best practices travel across the whole organization.




You must be able to read & write Danish and English. You have preferably worked in a similar role, but most importantly you have something unique to offer and a drive to make a difference at Scalepoint.




Are you ready to jump on our ride? Submit your application and CV now. We will review the applications and conduct interviews continuously.




If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Head of Business Intelligence, Morten Vang-Pedersen, by phone at +45 27908047




About us

Scalepoint spirit in everyday life

Come as you are. That’s how we prefer it. You can easily leave dress codes, permanent lunch buddies, and corporate business attitudes at home. Our office is filled with kudos and high fives – and we believe that everyone is doing their best.




We have employees from 11 nationalities across our offices in Copenhagen, Poland and Switzerland. 63% of us ride a cycle to work. 42% eat vegetarian meals during lunch. 38% are parents. And 52% don't regularly work out. But our sport and events team tries to keep us moving by offering activities such as climbing, mountain biking, running and padel tennis. However, we cannot change the fact that we have a very generous attitude to sweets and cake. But that’s ok; there's a lot to celebrate at Scalepoint.




We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
Are you eager to work with data analytics and HR? Want to help us take our data work to the next level in an HR department overseeing more than 5000 employees internationally? And does it sound good to work for a company owned by a foundation with a strong social purpose, donating more than 10 million Euros yearly to children and youth at risk? Then keep reading – this could be your thing!




About the job

Egmont's Corporate HR team is looking for someone to help us build a stronger data foundation. As our HR Data Analyst, you'll be essential in ensuring we have accurate, well-organised data to meet internal and external reporting requirements. Furthermore, you’ll help our divisions making better, data-driven decisions.




You'll be creating reports for both local and corporate management and supporting our local HR teams with their data needs. We're looking for someone who can make data accessible and useful across companies and HRIS systems. You'll be involved in building solutions to streamline and improve our data handling. Likewise, it is important that you can explore ways to automate our data processes freeing up time for more strategic HR initiatives.




Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

- Gather and consolidate data from various HRIS systems ensuring data validity and accuracy for reporting and analysis.

- Develop and maintain automated and ad hoc HR reports, including those related to pay equity and workforce demographics.

- Identify opportunities for automation and process standardisation to improve data quality.

- Collaborate with local HR teams to identify data needs and ensure alignment with group-level reporting requirements (e.g., pay transparency, CSRD).

- Collaborate with local IT teams to guide the development and maintenance of API integrations for data flow between HRIS systems and Egmont’s HR data hub.

- Analyse HR data to identify trends, patterns and insights for business improvements

- Oversee Egmont’s engagement survey, including secure validity in respondent data and administration in survey tool.




By fulfilling these responsibilities, you'll play a key role in enabling data-driven decision-making across our HR function and contributing to the success of Egmont's divisions.




What you’ll bring:

- A relevant degree or equivalent experience demonstrating a strong understanding of business principles and data analysis.

- Working experience in data management is desirable, particularly within an HR context.

- Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, Power BI, etc.

- Good at building relationships and working with different teams across an organisation.

- Experience working in an international and decentralised organisation would be great.

- Fluent in English and one of the Scandinavian languages.

- Experience with data processing and API integrations in Python or similar is a plus.

- Knowledge of data querying in SQL or similar is a plus.




What can you expect:

You’ll be part of our Corporate HR function consisting of 10 HR professionals. In addition, you’ll collaborate with HR representatives working locally at division- or company level across all operating countries. We value a supportive environment that allows you to manage your responsibilities effectively. Moreover, we encourage cross-functional collaboration at all levels, giving you the opportunity to interact with a wide range of stakeholders and contribute to a variety of projects.




If you have any questions regarding the position please contact: HR Data Manager, Trond Svela Sand (+45 21 84 44 65; trond.sand@egmont.com).

If you are passionate about data analysis and want to make an impact in HR, we would love to hear from you.




Work address:

Vognmagergade 11

Copenhagen K, DK, 1148

Denmark




Please submit your application (CV and cover letter) as soon as possible. We will conduct interviews on an ongoing basis. Please use "Apply Now" on this site. We do not receive applications sent by e-mail.




Application deadline is 31/08/2025.




About Egmont

Egmont is a leading Nordic media group focused on strong content and platforms within film, tv, cinema, streaming, gaming, e-commerce, marketing services, educational platforms, magazines and books. Proud owner of strong companies like Nordisk Film, TV 2 in Norway, Lindhardt og Ringhof and Story House Egmont. Being a foundation, all profit is reinvested in our media companies and donated to help improve the lives of vulnerable children and young people and support film talents.

We bring stories to life.

Title: Analyst
Description:
Do you enjoy simplifying complexity, working with many stakeholders, and helping people succeed through better digital tools? Are you able to listen, challenge, and guide decision-making in areas where opinions are strong and diverse? Do you see the value in working with data?

If so, BESTSELLER TECH is looking for you to join our Master Data team as our new Analyst.

YOUR TEAM

Join BESTSELLER TECH’s Master Data team – a dedicated and collaborative group based in Brande and Aarhus. We meet weekly in person, thrive on strong partnerships, and take pride in building and owning our own systems. Together, we make sure data is structured, governed and geared for the future.

You’ll work closely with teams across sourcing, retail coordination, country admin, TECH and finance. Our current priorities include improving data quality, reducing duplicates, cleaning up outdated processes, and assigning clear ownership across core entities. Long-term, we’ll also explore new technologies to strengthen our foundation further.

YOUR ROLE

As our new Analyst, you will bridge business and technology to improve the way BESTSELLER handles its most critical data—covering customers, suppliers, users, and locations. Your core mission will be to understand how our business works, identify where we can do better, and collaborate with developers to create sustainable and scalable solutions.

You will take part in the entire lifecycle: from early dialogue and process understanding to defining user stories, supporting testing, and guiding rollouts. You'll help us turn manual, fragmented work into structured, automated processes that support our brands and functions worldwide.

More specifically, you will


Analyze business needs and system landscapes to propose efficient, scalable solutions.
Collaborate across global teams to align on priorities and outcomes.
Participate in or lead workshops to align expectations, challenge assumptions, and uncover root causes of data challenges.
Support the delivery and rollout of features, including communication, documentation, and change support.
Help drive a more data-driven culture through knowledge sharing, training, and structured guidance with our stakeholders.
Assist in driving and expanding a shared Data Governance framework across Master Data entities.


YOUR PROFILE

You are a people-oriented problem solver with a curious mindset and a passion for meaningful change. You thrive in complex environments and feel energised by the opportunity to improve how things work – and how they could work better. You’re confident facilitating dialogue across diverse teams and turning input into action. You ask the right questions, challenge assumptions, and make progress – even when perspectives vary.

We imagine you bring:


Experience working with data – such as modeling, structuring, and organizing complex datasets.
A strong analytical mindset and the ability to uncover improvement opportunities through business process analysis.
Solid communication skills and an ability to guide stakeholders.
Comfortable educating users and stakeholders about master data management principles and how to apply them in daily operations.
Experience with SQL and process design or system development is an advantage.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Jacob Zachariasen at +45 52 15 10 61. To apply, send us your CV as soon as possible and no later than 1st of September 2025. We review and interview candidates on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to close the job ad once we find the right candidate.

Location: Brande or Aarhus.

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 400 people strong, located in Denmark, Spain and Rwanda. We are excited about what we do, but there’s more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.

Title: Senior Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our client is looking for a Senior Analyst with a sharp investigative mindset and a passion for ethical business practices to join our growing team.

This role can be based in Berlin or Copenhagen, or can be based remotely within Europe.




What You’ll Do:

• Lead or support integrity due diligence, investigations, and business intelligence assignments

• Work closely with our global subcontractor network and freelance researchers

• Scope and develop proposals for new assignments

• Help train and mentor new hires and junior analysts

• Contribute to research innovation, knowledge development, and marketing efforts




What We’re Looking For:

• 1-3 years’ experience in business intelligence, integrity due diligence, or corporate investigations

• Experience in the Nordics (emerging markets experience a plus)

• Full professional English + working proficiency in a Scandinavian language

• University degree in Politics, IR, Security, Social Sciences, Law, or related fields

• Strong analytical, organisational, and communication skills

• A collaborative and independent work ethic - even in remote settings

Show more

This role can be based in Berlin or Copenhagen, or can be based remotely within Europe.


What You’ll Do:

• Lead or support integrity due diligence, investigations, and business intelligence assignments

• Work closely with our global subcontractor network and freelance researchers

• Scope and develop proposals for new assignments

• Help train and mentor new hires and junior analysts

• Contribute to research innovation, knowledge development, and marketing efforts


What We’re Looking For:

• 1-3 years’ experience in business intelligence, integrity due diligence, or corporate investigations

• Experience in the Nordics (emerging markets experience a plus)

• Full professional English + working proficiency in a Scandinavian language

• University degree in Politics, IR, Security, Social Sciences, Law, or related fields

• Strong analytical, organisational, and communication skills

• A collaborative and independent work ethic - even in remote settings

Title: Analyst
Description:
Do you enjoy simplifying complexity, working with many stakeholders, and helping people succeed through better digital tools? Are you able to listen, challenge, and guide decision-making in areas where opinions are strong and diverse? Do you see the value in working with data?

If so, BESTSELLER TECH is looking for you to join our Master Data team as our new Analyst.

YOUR TEAM

Join BESTSELLER TECH’s Master Data team – a dedicated and collaborative group based in Brande and Aarhus. We meet weekly in person, thrive on strong partnerships, and take pride in building and owning our own systems. Together, we make sure data is structured, governed and geared for the future.

You’ll work closely with teams across sourcing, retail coordination, country admin, TECH and finance. Our current priorities include improving data quality, reducing duplicates, cleaning up outdated processes, and assigning clear ownership across core entities. Long-term, we’ll also explore new technologies to strengthen our foundation further.

YOUR ROLE

As our new Analyst, you will bridge business and technology to improve the way BESTSELLER handles its most critical data—covering customers, suppliers, users, and locations. Your core mission will be to understand how our business works, identify where we can do better, and collaborate with developers to create sustainable and scalable solutions.

You will take part in the entire lifecycle: from early dialogue and process understanding to defining user stories, supporting testing, and guiding rollouts. You'll help us turn manual, fragmented work into structured, automated processes that support our brands and functions worldwide.

More specifically, you will


Analyze business needs and system landscapes to propose efficient, scalable solutions.
Collaborate across global teams to align on priorities and outcomes.
Participate in or lead workshops to align expectations, challenge assumptions, and uncover root causes of data challenges.
Support the delivery and rollout of features, including communication, documentation, and change support.
Help drive a more data-driven culture through knowledge sharing, training, and structured guidance with our stakeholders.
Assist in driving and expanding a shared Data Governance framework across Master Data entities.


YOUR PROFILE

You are a people-oriented problem solver with a curious mindset and a passion for meaningful change. You thrive in complex environments and feel energised by the opportunity to improve how things work – and how they could work better. You’re confident facilitating dialogue across diverse teams and turning input into action. You ask the right questions, challenge assumptions, and make progress – even when perspectives vary.

We imagine you bring:


Experience working with data – such as modeling, structuring, and organizing complex datasets.
A strong analytical mindset and the ability to uncover improvement opportunities through business process analysis.
Solid communication skills and an ability to guide stakeholders.
Comfortable educating users and stakeholders about master data management principles and how to apply them in daily operations.
Experience with SQL and process design or system development is an advantage.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Jacob Zachariasen at +45 52 15 10 61. To apply, send us your CV as soon as possible and no later than 1st of September 2025. We review and interview candidates on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to close the job ad once we find the right candidate.

Location: Brande or Aarhus.

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 400 people strong, located in Denmark, Spain and Rwanda. We are excited about what we do, but there’s more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.
Show more

Title: Student Analyst
Description:
Are you driven by analyzing, solving and communicating clear, actionable recommendations to problems and challenges? Do you want to work with and translate market, industry, competitor and consumer analysis in a global organization?

Look no further and use your analytical mindset by joining ECCO’s Consumer & Market Intelligence team as a Student Analyst in Copenhagen.

ECCO’s Consumer & Market Intelligence team is looking for a motivated and analytical student analyst to join the company's efforts to drive growth through a data-driven and consumer-centric mindset. Based in our Copenhagen office, you will work with stakeholders across departments and regions, providing valuable market, industry, competitor and consumer insights.

You will have the chance to utilize and develop your quantitative and qualitative analytical skillset, improve your data storytelling abilities and build on your business acumen in a global context. You will be an integral part of key business process by supporting decision-makers with crucial insights and recommendations in a timely manner, making sure that the organization is continuously up to date on the market, industry, competitor and consumer landscape. Furthermore, you will included in ad-hoc projects in collaboration with different functional areas throughout the ECCO Group.

Tasks & Responsibilities

Your primary tasks will include:


Assist with data collection, cleaning and analyses of market, industry, competitor and consumer trends.
Create reports and presentations to communicate findings to a broad variety of stakeholders throughout ECCO’s global footprint.
Support the team on various ad-hoc projects and administrative tasks.
Being an integral part in overseeing and utilizing external data providers.
Being involved in building business cases in a cross-functional setting.


The role is part-time, and the expected workload is 15-20 hours per week with flexibility around your studies and exam periods, and willingness to travel if necessary.

Profile

The ideal candidate for the position can say yes to the following:


Enrolled in a relevant bachelor’s/master’s degree (Business Administration, Economics, Finance, Marketing, etc.), preferably having just embarked on your master’s or being at least on the 3rd semester of your bachelor’s.
A strong business acumen and analytical approach to problem-solving.
High degree of proactiveness and confidence.
Attention to detail and curiosity to challenge status quo.
Proficient in English (both written & verbal). Additional language skills are an advantage but not required.
Proficient in Excel and PowerPoint. Prior experience with data visualization software (Power BI) and SQL (Snowflake) is an advantage but not required.
Willingness to take responsibility for projects and deliverables.


A position with global impact

Joining ECCO’s Consumer & Market Intelligence team, you will be part of a new and still expanding team based across our Global HQ in Bredebro/Tønder and office in Copenhagen. However, your daily work and tasks will see you engage with stakeholders across the globe – spanning from Asia through Europe to North America – making you a part of a multicultural workplace, with different cultures, perspective and ideas that you can learn and grow from.

You will open a door rich with opportunities to pursue future career opportunities across functions or location globally upon graduation. We believe in continuous learning and development professionally, but also personally.

Are you up for the challenge?

Applications and interviews will be reviewed ongoingly until the right candidate is found, so do not hesitate to send over your application!

For additional information, please do not hesitate to reach out to Gabrina Tan (Senior Analyst, Consumer & Market Intelligence) on +45 4012 6475.

Imagining yourself at ECCO? Get a glimpse of what your new exciting career entails on

CREATE THE FOOTPRINTS OF TOMORROW

At ECCO, you become part of a meaningful, developing and multicultural workplace. You join a global family of more than 23,000 people who are proud to create the footprints of tomorrow.

Headquartered in Denmark, we are a family-owned company that offers international opportunities. Our offices and facilities have an informal culture and relaxed dress code - our shoe code is slightly stricter.

Join us and we guarantee lifelong learning - the speed of progress is up to you. So, if you´re curious, passionate and ready to make an impact, you´ll fit right in.
Show more

Title: Senior Specialist, eCommerce Analytics & Insights
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about driving eCommerce growth through data-driven insights and digital innovation?

If you have a strategic mindset, a deep understanding of digital analytics, and a talent for turning complex data into clear, actionable insights, you might be the perfect fit for our Senior Specialist, eCommerce Analytics & Insights role at Pandora’s Global Office in Copenhagen.

As a Senior Specialist in eCommerce Analytics & Insights, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our digital performance. You’ll lead the development and implementation of best-in-class website analytics practices, ensuring that data is not only accurate and reliable but also deeply embedded in our commercial decision-making processes.

You will act as the key liaison between Adobe data engineering teams and the broader analytics community, translating business needs into technical solutions and ensuring seamless collaboration across functions. Your insights will directly influence strategic initiatives, helping Pandora deliver exceptional digital experiences and drive measurable business impact.

In this role, you’ll also champion data governance, oversee data quality assurance, and lead the creation of advanced dashboards and visualizations tailored to senior stakeholders. You’ll work closely with regional eCommerce teams and internal partners to anticipate and exceed their analytics needs, while fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation. We are looking for a highly analytical, commercially minded individual with a strong foundation in digital analytics, stakeholder management, and data storytelling. If you thrive in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment and are passionate about the power of data to drive growth, we’d love to hear from you.

Key responsibilities:


Define and evolve best-in-class commercial website analytics practices aligned with Pandora’s digital transformation agenda
Act as the primary bridge between Adobe data engineering and commercial analytics teams
Integrate Adobe Analytics insights into core business workstreams to influence strategic decisions
Drive data integrity initiatives across all tracking and reporting mechanisms. Analyse, document and resolve inconsistencies while controlling business impact through stakeholder management. Lead advanced data analysis and visualization efforts, delivering insights through dashboards and reports with multi-system data inputs.
Build strong partnerships with regional eCommerce and internal teams to elevate performance reporting and consolidate strategic data needs into clear technical development requirements.
Promote continuous learning and innovation within the analytics function
Mentor colleagues and elevate the organization’s analytical maturity



Ideally, you have:


4–5 years of experience in website analytics, with at least 4 years owning or managing analytics systems
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Engineering, Economics, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
Proven ability to translate complex commercial needs into actionable analytics improvements
Experience with Adobe Analytics (certification is a plus)
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI
Strong understanding of eCommerce KPIs and the commercial impact of digital analytics



Furthermore, we hope to see that you are:


A strategic thinker with exceptional critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy in data interpretation
A clear communicator who can translate data into compelling stories for diverse audiences
Skilled at building trust and partnerships across technical and commercial teams
Proactive, self-motivated, and accountable for delivering results
Proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint



Your new team

Pandora is a company with a big heart, and we take great pride in treating our people well. You’ll join a passionate, ambitious team within an international, high-impact function.

Additional Information

Global Career Band: 5A

Did we get your attention?

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you! We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design, we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

Recognised by the Financial Times as one of Europe’s Best Workplaces and ranked #1 among Danish companies, Pandora is committed to building an inclusive and diverse workplace. We believe that reflecting the diversity of society in how we engage with our customers is essential to fulfilling our purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We are dedicated to nurturing a culture where everyone feels respected, valued, and empowered to thrive.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist (Randers SV, DK, 8940)
Description:
14/08/2025

Group CFO

DNK-Randers, Danish Crown Vej

Data Scientist

Do you believe there’s a connection between bacon and data? Do you want to be part of a team whose mission is to turn data into delicious insights?

At Danish Crown, we believe that just as bacon is a key product in our portfolio, data is the essential ingredient that drives our innovation and success, helping us to optimize processes, predict trends, and maintain our leadership in the industry – and we’re now looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our team and help us in this journey ahead of us.

Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist at Danish Crown, you will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets to uncover valuable insights, developing predictive models, and working closely with cross-functional teams to drive data-informed decision-making. You will be involved in various projects, such as:


Commodity, livestock, and product forecasting.
Object detection and tracking in real-time video feeds from production sites.


Success starts with a team

You will become part of the Data Science team within the Data, Analytics & AI space in the Global IT department. We work on multiple initiatives for various business units, with tasks around delivering data analysis and insights, modelling of complex data sources, and research and implementation of machine learning and deep learning models for tasks such as time-series forecasting, image recognition, or natural language processing, amongst others.

We are curious about the latest developments in our space, and therefore actively encourage everyone to have an innovative mindset and propose their ideas for further incubation.

Key Responsibilities

You’ll be part of helping Danish Crown become a data-first organization. Your main tasks will include:


Providing actionable insights, identify trends and measure performance by conducting advanced statistical and other analyses.
Developing analytical solutions by creating, testing and implementing complex models and algorithms.
Implementing scalable, sustainable solutions addressing business needs in collaboration with AI/ML and Data Engineers.
Explaining the design, functioning and output of analytical models/solutions to consumers.
Staying up to date with the latest trends and advancements in data science and machine learning.


Who are we looking for?

A passionate and detail-oriented colleague with a knack for uncovering insights from data, thriving in a collaborative environment and always eager to learn and apply new technologies.

With a strong analytical mindset, you enjoy solving complex problems and your excellent communication skills allow you to effectively convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.

Additional Qualifications


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar role.
Strong programming skills in Python. SQL is a plus.
Strong knowledge of machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling techniques.
Fluent in English. Understanding of Danish can be a plus.
Familiar with cloud platforms and version control.


Appetite For More?

If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Manager, Data Science Global IT, Francesc Joan Riera at (+45) 60 90 67 72.

We review candidates continuously, so let us know why you are the right candidate for the job and send it together with your CV. We aim for a start, as soon as possible – will wait for the right person.

We are a food company owned by Danish farmers supplying high-quality food to customers and consumers worldwide. From butchers to business developers, we're more than 24,000 colleagues, all committed to lowering our carbon footprint and becoming climate-neutral by 2050 for better food and a brighter future.
Show more

  • Strong knowledge of machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling techniques.
  • Fluent in English. Understanding of Danish can be a plus.
  • Familiar with cloud platforms and version control.

Appetite For More?

If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Manager, Data Science Global IT, Francesc Joan Riera at (+45) 60 90 67 72.

We review candidates continuously, so let us know why you are the right candidate for the job and send it together with your CV. We aim for a start, as soon as possible – will wait for the right person.

We are a food company owned by Danish farmers supplying high-quality food to customers and consumers worldwide. From butchers to business developers, we're more than 24,000 colleagues, all committed to lowering our carbon footprint and becoming climate-neutral by 2050 for better food and a brighter future.

Title: Student Analyst, Data & Sustainability, Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Urban Partners we believe that ‘powering the progress of cities and citizens’ is our opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable and equitable world. We do this by investing in assets, companies, technologies, and solutions. 

Becoming our new Student Analyst in the Sustainability team, you will have a unique opportunity to support Urban Partners in managing climate risks and opportunities. If you get energy from working for an internationally growing company and want to be part of making a difference, you may be our new team member.

The team

You will become a part of our Sustainability Team of 10 people, and you will support the team in analysing climate risk and opportunities, work on projects that decarbonize and improve the sustainability of urban ecosystems across our investment strategies.

We are a place where people truly work together as a team, valuing each other’s differences and the importance of each and every team member. Professional and personal development is something we give high priority, and with us you will develop by receiving and giving feedback from colleagues and by sparring with your team members. You will be a part of a powerhouse of brilliant and caring people raising the bar for the industry.

The position

Responsibilities

We expect that you can work about 15-20 hours per week with the opportunity to be flexible during exams. You will be supporting the company’s industry-leading sustainability professionals with primary responsibilities including:


Data analysis within transitional & physical climate risk
Research & development within decentral renewable energy solutions
Supporting strategic work within decarbonization roadmaps and action plans
Supporting GHG management & reporting aligned with leading standards such as SBTi


Qualifications

We expect that you are a 3rd or 4th year Bachelor's or Master’s student within economics, finance, data science, renewable energy or, similar, with excellent grades. You are interested in climate data management and business development and have strong communication skills and analytical capabilities. Besides, we hope that you are/have:


Skilled in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint. Experience with Power BI is preferred
Fluent in English
A strategic thinker that can navigate in high-complexity
A self-driven team-player
Highly organized and able to monitor and process many “moving parts” in a structured and effective manner (e.g., across several touchpoints with partners, managing and prioritizing inbound questions and requests)
Curious constant learner. Knowledge within renewable energy / sustainability is preferred, and interest in the area is required
Positive person that appreciates humor in the team
Some work or volunteer experience. Relevant work experience is a plus but not a requirement


What We Offer


Make a difference by helping create urban spaces and places that enrich people’s lives in the most sustainable way
Lead the industry with an innovator that is pioneering new approaches while raising standards and inspiring the industry
Learn and grow as part of a powerhouse of brilliant people where teamwork, feedback and different ways of thinking are at the core
Be your whole self in a purpose-driven culture with a strong sense of belonging, based on trust, celebration and caring for each other


Join Us

If you are interested, please let us know more about you as soon as possible, and no later than 1st of September 2025.
Show more

Title: Quantitative Research Analyst
Description:
Huge opportunity for sell-side researchers to join a buy-side firm with clear progression to trader and PM seats at a leading commodities firm.




Overview

Join an asset modelling team building in-house pricing libraries for commodity options. Design, implement and productionise stochastic models that drive valuation, optimisation and risk for complex optionality in commodity assets.




The Firm

Build best-in-class, proprietary optimisation models rather than buying off the shelf.
High autonomy, pragmatic culture and genuine work–life balance. Open to remote working.
Clear path to broaden into options trading or complex risk ownership as the platform scales.
Team track record in profitable commodity trading with ambition to lead model-driven decision making.




What you will do

Develop and extend options pricing libraries for commodities, with calibration and sensitivities.
Build stochastic models for assets and storages, including model choice, assumptions and risk implications.
Implement automatic differentiation to compute Greeks and accelerate calibration.
Partner with risk and trading to embed models into decision making and PnL attribution.
Own code from research to production with testing, performance tuning and documentation.




Requirements

Strong mathematics background in stochastic calculus and probability, with ability to apply theory.
Experience pricing exotic derivative libraries, not just using black-box libraries.
Solid coding skills in Python; exposure to C++ or Java is a plus.
Front-office quant experience in derivatives pricing or complex risk preferred.
2+ years professional experience.
MSc or PhD in a mathematic or quantitative field.
Experience with automatic differentiation frameworks for Greeks.
Options risk management know-how and interest in trading around complex risk.
Familiarity with energy options is a plus, not required.




Fit clarifications

Not e-trading or market making. Focus is modelling and valuation for options optimisation.
Backgrounds from front-office banking or competitors working on storage modelling are relevant.




Location

Denmark primary site. Flexibility for limited remote work.




Compensation

Base €80 - €120k
Bonus: capped at 200% of base. Potential formulaic PnL cut on the asset book at 0.X% depending on seniority and scope.

Show more

Title: AI Healthcare Data Specialist
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Ambu A/S is currently looking for an AI Healthcare Data Specialist to be based in Augsburg, Germany.

In Ambu we develop single-use endoscope solutions and the digital space is a fast growing part of the buisiness. The potential improvements that can be achieved with AI solutions are extraordinary. At the heart of these AI application lies the data and this is where you come in. We need your help to ensure the highest quality of data and annotatios for our deep learning models and your help to prove their performance in the clinic.

In this position you will join Ambu’s Algorithms team, a team of data specialists and deep learning engineers, with the common goal of bringing the best possible digital solutions to the doctors. The Algorithms team is currently based entirely at the Ambu headquarter in Ballerup, Denmark, but it is the company strategy to build up and expand our team in Augsburg, Germany. We believe it to be vital that you get integrated into the team quickly, therefore we expect you to start out your journey in Ambu, by spending 3 weeks at the headquarter in Denmark – getting introduced to the company, the work and the team. In addition, we expect that you travel at least 4 times to Denmark during the first year.

Key Responsibilities As AI Healthcare Data Specialist

Your work will be organised in an AI project team, where you in close collaboration with another AI Healthcare Data specialist will be responsible for getting the data. The focus will be on the clinical and data related tasks regarding user interaction, workflow understanding, data collection and annotation, clinical trials, implementation in products, and clinical documentation.

You will primarily...


Identify user needs and evaluate AI solutions to improve clinical workflow.
Design, establish and drive clinical data collection studies
Identify, define and communicate data and label needs/requirements
Ensure data quality and control
Clinical documentation package, including clinical risk related documentation


Experienced In Data Acquisition And Data Management

We are looking for an experienced candidate with a minimum of 5 years of experience working with clinical data collection studies. We imagine you may hold a Master of Biomedical Engineering or a similar field. Ideally, you have experience working with data annotation and anonymization. It is essential that you have a keen interest in AI and a drive for making clinical products. Desirable skills for this position are:


Knowledge of quality assurance in medtech
Experience working with medical personel
Experience in running clinical studies
Experience in data management, annotation and anonymization
General programming skillset – as a minimum in Python
General knowledge of deep learning theory and applications


As a person, you are highly motivated, self-driven, structured and with a strong sense of detail.

It is essential that you have excellent communication and English skills, both written and oral.

Ambu – a visionary and international workplace where your efforts matter

Ambu is a company that expands rapidly and has ambitious growth targets. We meet these targets through interdisciplinary teamwork between motivated and highly skilled employees. Your contributions and efforts are crucial to our success and by joining us you will get the opportunity to work in an international head office with an informal working environment.

We offer great opportunities for personal development. Furthermore, we offer a wide range of professional, social and financial employee benefits in addition to exciting job challenges and continuous professional and personal development.
Show more

Title: ESG & Impact Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a sharp, curious ESG & Impact Analyst to help shape how we measure what matters.




As a venture house spanning evergreen investment company PSV Foundry and the two individual VC funds PSV Tech and PSV Hafnium, we bring two decades of experience in VC fund building, startup investing and portfolio management to the table. Born out of DTU – The Technical University of Denmark – we’re not here to box-tick compliance. We’re all in on the one-to-one correlation between impact and business success. In this role, you’ll be key to making that connection real.




This is a hands-on role, ideal for someone who wants to work at the frontier of impact, tech, and venture. You’ll get a front-row seat to a vibrant community of founders and ecosystem players, and the chance to leave your fingerprints on something that’s built to scale.




What you’ll (actually) be doing

You’ll be working alongside our Head of ESG & Impact, directly supporting our mission to make ESG and Impact data useful, actionable, and founder-friendly. Your work help lay the foundation for how future startups across the Nordics, and possibly beyond, integrate impact strategy into their core business.




You’ll assist founders in understanding sustainability expectations, navigating early-stage ESG & Impact challenges, and co-creating simple, scalable impact strategies. Think; practical input on KPIs, diversity metrics, responsible AI use – and practical, founder-first playbooks.




You’ll support VC funds through due diligence processes, build and verify emissions baselines for target companies, and turn ESG-speak into clear, actionable reporting that matters to LPs. Think: Scope 3 progress across PSV, tailored impact frameworks aligned with funds strategies, policies that make sense for early-stage investing, systems to track, aggregate, and improve both financial and impact KPIs - from first deal to exit.




You’ll manage the backend of our ESG & Impact reporting process – collecting the right data, ensuring regulatory alignment (hello SFRD, CSRD and the Taxonomy), and improving how we use that data sheet to sharpen strategy and decision-making. Think: regular data collection, structuring, and analysis of ESG & Impact data – ensuring data accuracy and timely reporting to internal and external stakeholders.




You’ll assist in peer research on ESG regulation, impact trends, and responsible investment practices to keep PSV ahead of the curve.




What we think you bring

Let’s be honest we’re not hiring your CV. We’re hiring your brain. Your bias for action. Your “I haven’t tried it before, but I Googled it, or maybe more relevant, I asked the chat and made it work” kind of energy.




We want you who turns messy questions into clarity without asking for a 40-slide brief. The one who looks at a dashboard and thinks: Cool, but how does this help founders actually do better stuff?




We think this might look like:

You’re a BSc or MSc student in something like data science, sustainability, innovation, economics, or something similar that sounds clever on Linkedin.




You’re a student who flinches at the phrase “business as usual” and physically recoils when someone brings up CSR like it’s still 2006.




You’re “structured”, “data-driven”, and “know your way around a spreadsheet (don’t we all, after crying over one too many Google Sheets?)




You’re familiar with frameworks like the GHG Protocol and accounting, Sustainable Finance Disclosure Regulation, Taxanomy assessments etc. – aka the alphabet soup of sustainability.




You’re a person who “cares deeply about people and planet” and dreams in systems-thinking slides




In fewer words, if you’re someone who can hold a climate report and a commercial mindset in the same hand, then we really want to talk.




We’d love to hear from you - even if you don’t tick every box. This is just our best attempt to describe the role realistically. We don’t care about traditional credentials if your drive and mindset are aligned. Sometimes, the right person is someone we haven’t yet had the imagination to look for.

Show more
