Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Azure Data Engineer




Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses og MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi bruger teknologier som Databricks, Fabric, Spark, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory og Azure Synapse. Vi søger profiler med erfaring inden for enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som vil bygge innovative dataløsninger.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.




Hvilken rolle får du?




Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.




Din rolle bliver at




rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code, fx. Terraform
fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Du har en videregående uddannelse i software engineering, human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU samt erfaring i data engineering
Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring, kan skrive Python og har lyst til data engineering-delen - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
Du har erfaring med - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Spark - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling




Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere




Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.




Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.




Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.




Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Hvis du har under 5 års erfaring, bedes du også vedhæfte dine karakterblade i samme fil som dit CV. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Show more
HTML:
Azure Data Engineer


Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses og MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi bruger teknologier som Databricks, Fabric, Spark, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory og Azure Synapse. Vi søger profiler med erfaring inden for enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som vil bygge innovative dataløsninger.


cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.


Hvilken rolle får du?


Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.


Din rolle bliver at


  • rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
  • rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
  • bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
  • sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code, fx. Terraform
  • fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger


Hvad forventer vi af dig?


  • Du har en videregående uddannelse i software engineering, human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU samt erfaring i data engineering
  • Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring, kan skrive Python og har lyst til data engineering-delen - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme.
  • Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
  • Du har erfaring med - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Spark - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
  • Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
  • Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
  • Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling


Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

  • Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere


Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.


Hvad tilbyder vi?


Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.


Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?


Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.


Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.


Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.


Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.


Interesseret?


Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Hvis du har under 5 års erfaring, bedes du også vedhæfte dine karakterblade i samme fil som dit CV. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.


Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:


Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com


Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Title: Lead Data Analyst - Payments Data
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 30308

Welcome to Group Technology, where we pride ourselves on engineering solutions and direct Nordea’s transformation by providing a holistic technological view and structured understanding of the bank, and its surrounding environment to enable the Customer Vision and the Business Strategy.

Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We're not just a bank, we're a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.

About This Opportunity

To strengthen our team we are looking for an experienced Lead Data Analyst (Expert IT Analyst) who has skills to do hands-on data and requirement analysis work. The right candidate also understands other aspects of software development: Are we making solid architectural decisions? Are we able to improve our tech stack? Are we focusing on right things?

Your main responsibilities will be around the consolidation and harmonization, sourcing, storage and distribution of Payments Data to other solutions. It also includes integrations supporting different End2End payment flows in Nordea's target payment architecture.

What you’ll be doing:


Contributing to solution design, maintainability and architecture of applications
Designing both near real-time data pipelines and pipeline for traditional analytics
Interacting with product owners and stakeholders to clarify, elicit and translate requirements into implementation specifications
Data mapping, data modelling, solution design and working with Information architects
Performing quantitative data analysis with the aim to understand identified issues and to explain implications, and recommend solutions
Collaborating with developers and engineers, and properly document your design & solutions
Engaging with many different stakeholders, so the person we are looking for, is communicative and has skills to build relationships
Eliciting requirements (functional and non-functional) by co-operating with different stakeholders in a complex environment
Be responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement
Accessing complex and distributed datasets, and perform statistical analysis


The role is based in Copenhagen / Taastrup (DK) or Helsinki (FI).

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:


Are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships and loves sharing knowledge
Have a consultant mindset – actively participate in multiple initiatives at once
Can communicate constructively, and contribute to a productive work environment and good atmosphere in the team
Are an experienced analyst, always seeking the best solution


Your experience and background:


5-7 years of experience from designing data intensive solutions, data architectures and integration patterns
Understanding the importance of requirement elicitation techniques / analysis
Expert in ensuring that business requirements gets translated into functional and non-functional specifications
Excellent skills in SQL (Oracle, MSSQL or similar RDBMS)
Understanding of practices like Domain driven design, Event sourcing architecture patterns, microservices architecture and clean code
Understanding of CI/CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, REST, Maven and JUnit and also to have experience building distributed, highly available and high throughput applications
Degree in computer science and engineering, mathematical modelling or similar
Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration with different stakeholder groups


It is beneficial if you have:


Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain (ISO20022 standard, SEPA and Swift messages)
Experience in one or more cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/Google)


What We Offer

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.

People are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 31/10/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Finn Abildgaard at finn.abildgaard@nordea.com. Please note that we will proceed with potential candidates already during the application period.

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.
Show more

Title: Senior Client Insights Analyst
Place: Taastrup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
The Opportunity

Are you passionate about turning data into impact, with reports that actually make a difference? At the intersection of neuroscience, AI, and marketing, Neurons partners with some of the world’s leading brands - across industries, agencies, and platforms - offering a unique chance for a talented Insights Analyst to shape how top names make smarter creative and strategic decisions every day.

Your work here won’t just be “reports”; it will shape how clients see, understand, and act on their creative performance. You’ll work across key commercial insight services: from high-level meta-analyses of client testing data to scalable implicit research solutions that enable faster, sharper decisions. You won’t just deliver insights, you’ll bring clarity, confidence, and momentum to every client interaction, making Neurons an indispensable part of their marketing strategy.

And you’ll evolve around our cross-functional core—neuroscientists, PMs, AI engineers, commercial talents, visionaries and innovators, and BI experts—wiring the very neurons that energize every insight, that make Neurons who we are.

Your Impact


Lead high-impact brand strategy: Scale analysis into narrative-driven reports that steer executive creative and marketing decisions.
Drive Explore innovation: Own the design and delivery of streamlined implicit tests that fuel speed, clarity, and commercial growth while championing new methodologies.
Empower commercial teams: Co-present critical insights, advise on strategic positioning, and lead high-value engagements with integrity and long-term partnership in mind.
Define strategic wins: Initiate and steer cross-functional projects where your insight and vision shape enterprise-level solutions.
Be the insight architect: Serve as Neurons’ knowledge authority. Craft advanced frameworks, scale delivery methods, and mentor junior analysts.


Who You Are


You’re an insights-driven thinker and high-impact, proven performer, who transforms complex data into beautiful narratives and impactful decisions, and drives those decisions into sustained momentum.
You thrive in both structure and ambiguity, consistently bringing clarity and strategic direction when others are still figuring out where to begin.
You zoom in and out with exceptional ease - just as confident spotting intricate patterns in data as you are shaping and communicating the overarching strategic narrative.
Curious, compelling, and authoritative, you guide and inspire others with a blend of sharp strategic thinking, clear executive-level direction, and calm confidence.
You’ve built an impressive craft in senior research, analytics, or agency senior roles and you’re ready to make a profound and visible impact across the entire business and with key clients.


About Neurons

Neurons is a SaaS leader in applied neuroscience and AI. Our platform AI predicts consumer responses - attention, emotion, cognition, and memory - with a level of accuracy previously only possible through lengthy testing and post-hoc analysis. By harnessing the latest science and powerful AI models, we enable brands to understand, predict, and influence consumer behavior faster and at a greater scale.

Behind the scenes, our science is continuously supported by our implicit testing solutions that enable our revolution, and our clients to quickly validate creative and campaign direction through scientifically grounded online studies. Together, our tools give customers a powerful mix of speed, scale, and science.

Our Mission: To empower organizations everywhere with evidence-based, predictive insights that drive confident decisions and breakthrough outcomes.

Why Join Us?


Work at the absolute cutting edge. Your insights will shape enterprise-wide creative and go-to-market plans across regions, directly influencing decisions by VPs, executives, and brand stewards at some of the world’s most iconic brands.
Collaborate closely with pioneering neuroscientists, elite AI engineers, and visionary business leaders.
Enjoy a culture of learning, ownership, and impact. Backed by remote flexibility and competitive compensation.
Get access to unparalleled datasets and advanced tools, and help set the public agenda for AI and neuroscience in marketing.


Ready To Make A Difference?

Apply now with a portfolio or sample of your most impactful client insights, strategic reports, or enablement work. Let’s push the boundaries of what’s possible, together.

We are a company that takes pride in the health & well-being of all our employees, with initiatives such as yoga practice, healthy breaks, and mental health resources.

We enjoy coming together for our Friday Hygge, where you might find us singing karaoke, playing bingo, video games or board games.

Other benefits include:


In-house lunch
Pension Plan
Private Health insurance
Parental leave benefits
Quarterly company events
Team Events
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We're looking for a hands-on Data Platform Engineer to join a high-impact team building a scalable AWS-based data platform for a trailblazer in AI governance and analytics. You’ll collaborate across engineering, DevOps, and compliance teams to drive performance, observability, and data integrity across systems.




Responsibilities

Architect and evolve a scalable, high-availability cloud infrastructure on AWS
Build robust data platforms to support large-scale analytics and governance tools
Implement automation through Infrastructure as Code and CI/CD workflows
Lead container orchestration with Kubernetes, Docker, Helm, and ArgoCD
Support data infrastructure compliance, performance tuning, and reliability
Ensure alignment with cloud security and data governance standards




Ideal Candidate

3+ years of AWS infrastructure and DevOps experience
Deep expertise with Kubernetes, Docker, and tools like Terraform or Pulumi
Programming experience in Python and Typescript
Familiarity with distributed data systems and SQL optimisation
Fluent in English
Problem-solver with a collaborative and pragmatic mindset




This role offers a competitive salary, flexible hybrid working, and a chance to grow within an innovative company shaping the future of trustworthy AI and data infrastructure.

Show more

Title: Register in our candidate data base
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

Growing as fast as we do in Veo means that every day is different, exciting, and challenging, both on the front line and in the back office.

But that’s not the most remarkable thing about us.

The coolest thing is our people. We’ve attracted some of the brightest minds in the industry. They are the reason we can create a great product and do it while enjoying ourselves.

Does your dream job at Veo not appear on the list, then sign up in our candidate data base and we will get in contact with you if the right opportunity arises for you.

At Veo, you'll be part of a thriving work environment where every day brings new excitement. Our rapid growth ensures a diverse and ever-changing atmosphere. We believe in work-life balance and providing a positive culture that allows you to thrive personally and professionally.

Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Diversity and differences are valuable assets for us. We value diversity and inclusion and welcome people from all backgrounds. If you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

Values We Hold at Veo:

Dare - We take initiative, stay curious, and challenge the status quo in our work.

Own it - We drive impact by identifying opportunities, taking responsibility, and confidently executing.

Level up - We embrace growth, continuously learning and shaping our skills.

Play as a team - We collaborate across a diverse organization, leveraging shared insights for stronger outcomes.

Customer Centric - We deliver value by having close partnerships and a deep understanding of our customers (internally and externally)

We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. And you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.
Show more
HTML:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

Growing as fast as we do in Veo means that every day is different, exciting, and challenging, both on the front line and in the back office.

But that’s not the most remarkable thing about us.

The coolest thing is our people. We’ve attracted some of the brightest minds in the industry. They are the reason we can create a great product and do it while enjoying ourselves.

Does your dream job at Veo not appear on the list, then sign up in our candidate data base and we will get in contact with you if the right opportunity arises for you.

At Veo, you'll be part of a thriving work environment where every day brings new excitement. Our rapid growth ensures a diverse and ever-changing atmosphere. We believe in work-life balance and providing a positive culture that allows you to thrive personally and professionally.

Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Diversity and differences are valuable assets for us. We value diversity and inclusion and welcome people from all backgrounds. If you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

Values We Hold at Veo:

Dare - We take initiative, stay curious, and challenge the status quo in our work.

Own it - We drive impact by identifying opportunities, taking responsibility, and confidently executing.

Level up - We embrace growth, continuously learning and shaping our skills.

Play as a team - We collaborate across a diverse organization, leveraging shared insights for stronger outcomes.

Customer Centric - We deliver value by having close partnerships and a deep understanding of our customers (internally and externally)

We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. And you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about building scalable data products and enabling data-driven decision making across a global organization? Do you thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment where your work directly influences strategic outcomes? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

Shape the Future of Data at Pandora

Pandora is on a mission to harness the power of data to drive business transformation and deliver meaningful impact across the organization. As a Data Engineer, you will be part of a growing Data & Analytics function, working closely with product managers, architects, and stakeholders across the business to build high-quality data and BI products on our global Azure PaaS data platform.

This is your chance to play a pivotal role in building modern, scalable data infrastructure and pipelines, enabling self-service analytics, reporting, and innovation at scale.

Key Responsibilities

Data Product Development & Engineering


Design, build, and deploy scalable, high-performing data solutions on Pandora’s Azure-based data platform.
Create and maintain robust data pipelines that automate manual processes, optimize data delivery, and improve data quality.
Own and monitor your data products, ensuring continuous performance and business impact.
Apply a “build-once, consume-many” mindset to enable reusable data solutions that serve the wider business.



Collaboration & Business Impact


Work within cross-functional teams to deliver data features that support commercial use cases and strategic decision making.
Translate business requirements into technical designs and data models.
Partner with stakeholders across global teams to understand their needs and solve complex data challenges.



Innovation & Best Practices


Contribute to evolving our cloud-based data platform, moving from IaaS to modern Azure PaaS tools like Databricks, ADF, Synapse, and Data Lake.
Follow software engineering best practices including DevOps, CI/CD, unit testing, and version control with Git.
Stay current with trends in data engineering and bring forward new ideas to improve our data ecosystem.



Key Qualifications

What You Bring to the Team


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or related field.
5+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or in a software engineering role with a data focus.
Proven hands-on experience with tools like Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Data Lake, Synapse, SQL Server, T-SQL/U-SQL, and DAX.
Strong programming skills in Python, Scala, Java, or similar.
Experience with DevOps, CI/CD pipelines, Git, and unit testing frameworks.
Proficiency in working with large datasets, data modeling, and building data pipelines in cloud environments (preferably Azure).
Agile mindset and experience working in Scrum-based teams.
Strong communication skills and ability to present technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders.
Fluent in English.



Nice to Have


Experience with big data technologies like Spark or Hadoop.
Familiarity with real-time data processing tools such as Kafka or Spark Streaming.



Why Pandora?

At Pandora, innovation, sustainability, and inclusion are at the heart of everything we do. As part of our Data Engineering team, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the foundation of our data strategy while working with a global team of experts across Europe, India, and Thailand.

You’ll be empowered to take ownership, explore new technologies, and continuously improve how we use data to drive value across the business.

Additional Information


This role is based in our Global Office in Copenhagen, Denmark
Global Career Band 5



Did we get your attention?

We hope this opportunity excites you and encourages you to apply. If you see yourself in this position and believe Pandora is the right fit, we’d love to hear from you.

We process applications on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Learn more about us at www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake

You’ll work from our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, designed to foster creativity, collaboration, and sustainability. Our office holds a LEED Gold Certification for environmental design, minimizing natural resource use while delivering a truly inspirational workspace.

About Pandora

Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand. The company designs, manufactures, and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,500 points of sale, including more than 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs over 32,000 people globally and crafts its jewellery at two LEED-certified facilities in Thailand, using primarily recycled silver and gold. Pandora aims to be carbon neutral by 2025 and is part of the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. The company is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and reported revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.

At Pandora, we are committed to building an inclusive, diverse workplace where everyone’s contributions are valued and respected. We believe in giving a voice to people’s loves—both through our products and our culture.

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location: Copenhagen, Denmark

Job Type: Permanent

Industry: Financial Services / Capital Markets

Work Mode: Hybrid (On-site 4 days/week)




About the Client:

We have partnered with a Danish company specialising in Algorithmic Trading. The company has been the market leader in automating financial markets since 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




About the role:

As part of this role, you’ll help design, optimize, and implement calibration and benchmarking frameworks, establish best practices for data processing pipelines, and prototype innovative predictive time-series models. With short feedback cycles, direct deployment, and minimal bureaucracy, your work will have immediate impact.




Team Environment:

You'll join a collaborative, intellectually curious team that values technical input and personal initiative. The group is composed of highly qualified researchers with deep experience in statistics, modelling, and machine learning, working closely with software engineering and trading teams. Knowledge-sharing is integral, and all members contribute code, ensuring mutual understanding across specialties.




Candidate Profile:

PhD or MSc in a quantitative discipline (engineering, physics, computer science, mathematics, or related fields)
3+ years of experience
Strong foundation in mathematics and statistics
Experience with the full machine learning development cycle—from data processing to deployment and monitoring
Proficiency in Python, especially for data processing and numerical analysis
Solid grasp of computer science principles
Analytical, scientific mindset
Right to work in Denmark(We can't offer sponsorship)




Bonus skills:

Experience handling large, complex datasets
Familiarity with frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, XGBoost, or CatBoost
Additional programming experience in languages like C# or C/C++




What’s offered:

Flat organizational structure fostering trust and autonomy
Challenging, interesting problems to solve
Supportive and highly skilled team
Modern workspace with a hybrid work model
Comprehensive benefits including pension, health insurance, and generous leave

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vi arbejder kontinuerligt på at være en endnu mere datadreven organisation, og nu kan du være med på rejsen! Her får du muligheden for at blive en af vores eksperter i Power BI og spille en nøglerolle i udviklingen af fremtidens rapportering og i rådgivning af kollegaer på tværs af hele lufthavnen.

Du bliver en del af Data & Analytics, hvor vi er Center of Excellence med ansvar for analyse- og Power BI governance. Vi samarbejder tæt med dygtige analytikere i forretningen, som selv udvikler mange af deres løsninger. Vores rolle er at sikre kvalitet, ensartethed og støtte med rådgivning, undervisning og sparring.

Om at være Senior Data Analyst

Som Senior Data Analyst er du vores go-to person, når rapportering skal gå på tværs af forretningen, eller når ingen andre har taget bolden. Du planlægger og faciliterer workshops, hvor du med nysgerrighed og skarpe spørgsmål hjælper forretningen med at finde ud af, hvad de egentlig har brug for. Du er ikke bange for at udfordre, og du sørger for, at intet bliver overset.

Vi arbejder agilt med en dedikeret Product Owner, der holder styr på backloggen, prioriterer opgaver og sikrer fremdrift via Azure DevOps.

Derudover arbejder vi strategisk med citizen development for at demokratisere rapportering og data, og enable vores kollegaer til selv at udvikle løsninger i Power BI. Det gør vi også i høj grad med vores data community, DataHub, hvor du sammen med teamet har en vigtig rolle i at drive det til næste niveau og sikre udbredelse af best practices og viden på tværs i lufthavnen.

Vi ser frem til, at du bidrager med at

✈️Udvikle Power BI løsninger – især de større og koncernkritiske

✈️Drive vores Community of practice DataHub – inkl. oplæg og community engagement

✈️Sikre fremdrift i vores data literacy indsatser og identificere nye

✈️Definere og dokumentere best practices for udvikling, test og dokumentation af Power BI rapporter

✈️Udarbejde guidelines og undervise forretningen i brugen af Power BI.

Om hvordan du lykkes i jobbet

Du lykkes på den korte bane, når du forstår forretningens behov og kan lave Power BI løsningen ud fra hvad de har behov for og ikke ”bare”, hvad de vil have.

På den længere bane lykkes du, når du bidrager med din store erfaring og udvikler dig til vores absolutte ekspert ved løbende at holde dig opdateret på nye Power BI features og har lysten til at prøve dem af.

Du har formentlig en uddannelse indenfor IT eller dataanalyse, men det er ikke et krav. Det vigtigste er, at du har solid erfaring med Power BI og en stærk interesse for at arbejde med data.

Du motiveres af at gøre en forskel, både gennem dine egne løsninger og ved at hjælpe andre med at lykkes. Du trives med at dele din viden bl.a. gennem undervisning og community-aktiviteter.

Om afdelingen

Vi er et nyere, stadigt voksende team med en central rolle i at løfte datamodenheden.

Teamet består af både erfarne og nye kollegaer, og vi prioriterer både faglighed og fællesskab. Udviklingen i vores branche går stærkt, og derfor investerer vi løbende i kompetenceudvikling, bl.a. gennem konferencer, hackathons og interne læringsinitiativer.

Samtidig har vi det sjovt sammen på teamevents og torsdagsbarer, og vi tror på at stærke relationer skaber bedre resultater.

Om Sofie, din nye leder

Din nye leder er selv ny i CPH med opstart 1. oktober, men du vil møde hende til samtalerne så I lærer hinanden at kende. Her er, hvad hun siger om sig selv og sin ledelsesstil:

”Det er vigtigt for mig at have en åben og ærlig dialog med mine medarbejdere, med et særligt fokus på, at teamet selvstændigt skal kunne levere resultater. For mig betyder det, at du får meget ansvar og ejerskab for det du har lyst til at udvikle dig indenfor, både personligt og fagligt. Samtidig vægter jeg, at vi har det godt, så jeg gør en del ud af at sætte trivslen højt bl.a. ved at være tilgængelig når du har brug for det. ”

Om os | Hvad tilbyder vi

Du bliver en del af en helt særlig atmosfære og en organisation, der hver dag arbejder engageret for, at vores passagerer får den bedste rejseoplevelse.

Udover pension og IT-udstyr tilbyder vi

✈️Frihed til planlægning af dine opgaver – med mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra efter aftale med din leder

✈️Fri parkering, cykelservice, bilrengøring og rabataftaler

✈️Fysioterapi og træningslokale, yoga, rådgivning fra træner mv.

✈️Sundhedssikring – børn er dækket automatisk

✈️Individuelle check-in samtaler.

Om ansøgningen | Stig ombord på dit nye job

Vi ser frem til at læse din ansøgning, så send den gerne snarest muligt. Vi ansætter når den rette kandidat lander i indbakken.

Ansøgninger modtages kun via vores rekrutteringssystem.

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet inden da, kan sende en mail til Tenna Ørum Kristensen, Director – Data & Analytics - tenna.oerum-kristensen@cph.dk.

Det er en forudsætning for ansættelse, at du kan blive politigodkendt, ligesom du skal kunne opretholde politigodkendelsen gennem hele din ansættelse.
Show more

Title: Analytics Engineer Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
📢 Join Our Data Consultancy Team! 📢




Are you an experienced and passionate data expert looking for your next challenge? Pyne is seeking an Analytics Engineer Consultant to join our innovative and growing team. At Pyne, you’ll have the opportunity to make a significant impact while working in a fast-paced and forward-thinking environment.




Who are we?




Mission:

We started on a mission to deliver great work with effective tooling. From day one, we’ve built rock-solid data foundations, enabling companies to improve with data quickly. Now, as AI reshapes every industry, we help businesses stay globally competitive by embedding AI-powered workflows where they matter most.




Vision:

Rethinking Workflows for the Age of AI. We see a future where data engineering, analytics, and AI converge seamlessly with human creativity and critical thinking. By re-imagining processes end-to-end, we enable organizations to scale more sustainably and intentionally – automating where it makes sense, and amplifying human insight where it doesn’t.




Responsibilities:

Work closely with our clients to understand their business needs, scope requirements, and identify opportunities where data and AI can create value.
Lead and manage projects from scoping to delivery, ensuring impactful outcomes and smarter solutions than our clients initially imagined.
Develop business-directed reports, apps, and models that optimise workflows and drive decision-making
Contribute to a learning culture and stay ahead of emerging tools and methods




Requirements

Strong business acumen.
Ability to take ownership of app and dashboard scoping and design in collaboration with clients, ensuring the final product meets their real needs, even when that means challenging their initial ideas.
Experience with BI tools and frameworks (e.g., Power BI, Steep, Metabase, Looker, Streamlit, etc.).
Experience with SQL and dbt.
Proactive communication and self-starter mentality.
Ability to manage multiple clients/projects in a dynamic environment.
Experience with Python and data platforms like Snowflake, BigQuery, Databricks, and Fabric are a plus.
Understanding of data modeling and warehousing best practices. Strong data engineering skills are a plus. 
Familiarity with AI and automation frameworks (e.g., GPT, MCP, Streamlit, Pydantic AI, LangChain, Ollama, etc.) are a plus.
Danish is a plus.




If you don’t tick every box but are excited about the role, we still encourage you to apply! We value curiosity, potential, and drive.




What we offer:

Competitive salary, reflecting your skills and experience level.
Flexible work arrangements, including remote work options.
Extra perks such as team trips abroad and events to foster a fun and engaging work environment.
Work from our office in SOHO Kødbyen, a dynamic office environment with lunch, snacks of your choice, protein bars, and coffee on Pyne.
Opportunity to work closely with a talented and diverse team of data professionals.
Exciting challenges and opportunities to grow together with this young company.
A supportive and inclusive company culture that values diversity and encourages continuous professional development.




Ready to take your data expertise to the next level? Join us in shaping the future of data consultancy! Send your resume and a brief cover letter highlighting your passion for data and relevant experiences to elin@pyne.dk. 




We can't wait to hear from you!




Learn more about us at https://pyne.dk

Show more
HTML:
📢 Join Our Data Consultancy Team! 📢


Are you an experienced and passionate data expert looking for your next challenge? Pyne is seeking an Analytics Engineer Consultant to join our innovative and growing team. At Pyne, you’ll have the opportunity to make a significant impact while working in a fast-paced and forward-thinking environment.


Who are we?


Mission:

We started on a mission to deliver great work with effective tooling. From day one, we’ve built rock-solid data foundations, enabling companies to improve with data quickly. Now, as AI reshapes every industry, we help businesses stay globally competitive by embedding AI-powered workflows where they matter most.


Vision:

Rethinking Workflows for the Age of AI. We see a future where data engineering, analytics, and AI converge seamlessly with human creativity and critical thinking. By re-imagining processes end-to-end, we enable organizations to scale more sustainably and intentionally – automating where it makes sense, and amplifying human insight where it doesn’t.


Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with our clients to understand their business needs, scope requirements, and identify opportunities where data and AI can create value.
  • Lead and manage projects from scoping to delivery, ensuring impactful outcomes and smarter solutions than our clients initially imagined.
  • Develop business-directed reports, apps, and models that optimise workflows and drive decision-making
  • Contribute to a learning culture and stay ahead of emerging tools and methods


Requirements

  • Strong business acumen.
  • Ability to take ownership of app and dashboard scoping and design in collaboration with clients, ensuring the final product meets their real needs, even when that means challenging their initial ideas.
  • Experience with BI tools and frameworks (e.g., Power BI, Steep, Metabase, Looker, Streamlit, etc.).
  • Experience with SQL and dbt.
  • Proactive communication and self-starter mentality.
  • Ability to manage multiple clients/projects in a dynamic environment.
  • Experience with Python and data platforms like Snowflake, BigQuery, Databricks, and Fabric are a plus.
  • Understanding of data modeling and warehousing best practices. Strong data engineering skills are a plus. 
  • Familiarity with AI and automation frameworks (e.g., GPT, MCP, Streamlit, Pydantic AI, LangChain, Ollama, etc.) are a plus.
  • Danish is a plus.


If you don’t tick every box but are excited about the role, we still encourage you to apply! We value curiosity, potential, and drive.


What we offer:

  • Competitive salary, reflecting your skills and experience level.
  • Flexible work arrangements, including remote work options.
  • Extra perks such as team trips abroad and events to foster a fun and engaging work environment.
  • Work from our office in SOHO Kødbyen, a dynamic office environment with lunch, snacks of your choice, protein bars, and coffee on Pyne.
  • Opportunity to work closely with a talented and diverse team of data professionals.
  • Exciting challenges and opportunities to grow together with this young company.
  • A supportive and inclusive company culture that values diversity and encourages continuous professional development.


Ready to take your data expertise to the next level? Join us in shaping the future of data consultancy! Send your resume and a brief cover letter highlighting your passion for data and relevant experiences to elin@pyne.dk. 


We can't wait to hear from you!


Learn more about us at https://pyne.dk

Title: Student Assistant- Internal Audit (Early Careers)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a curious and data-savvy Student Assistant to join our Group Internal Audit team. This role is ideal for a student who is passionate about data analytics, business intelligence, and digital enablement within a governance and risk context.

You will support the team in delivering data-driven insights, maintaining dashboards, and monitoring data quality to help ensure transparency, learning, and accountability across the organization.

Key Responsibilities


Assist in the development and maintenance of dashboards (e.g., Power BI) to support audit planning, execution, and reporting.
Support data quality monitoring and validation routines to ensure reliability of audit data.
Help transform raw data into actionable insights through structured analysis and visual storytelling.
Participate in audit-related projects, especially those involving automation, analytics, or reporting.
Provide administrative and ad-hoc support to the audit team as needed.


Who You Are


A Bachelor’s or Master’s student at CBS (e.g., Business Analytics, Finance, Economics) or DTU (e.g., Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science).
Comfortable working with data tools such as Power BI, Excel, and ideally some exposure to SQL, Python, or R.
Interested in how data, risk, and governance intersect in a global business environment.
Structured, detail-oriented, and eager to learn from a team of experienced professionals.


What You’ll Gain


Hands-on experience in data-driven internal auditing within a global organization.
Exposure to real-world applications of analytics in risk, compliance, and performance monitoring.
A collaborative and flexible work environment that supports your academic journey.
Opportunities to contribute to digital transformation and insight generation in a high-impact function.


Maersk is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking. Maersk is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, colour, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.

We are happy to support your need for any adjustments during the application and hiring process. If you need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website, apply for a position, or to perform a job, please contact us by emailing accommodationrequests@maersk.com.

Title: Graduate Data Scientist
Place: Vester Hassing, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Veovo is a market leader in Airport Smart Technology. With a global footprint of customers and capabilities that cover Airport Operations, Revenue management and Passenger Flow. Some of the world’s largest airports rely on Veovo.  Focused on driving airport performance, our solutions enable airports to handle more aircraft and more passengers, with less delays and less queues. Our platforms are built on a modern tech stack, often delivered from the cloud as SaaS and leveraging intelligence to enable our customer to “go brilliantly”.

Our clients span continents, but all share one thing in common~ they’re big names in airport excellence, with even bigger digital goals. With offices in the UK, Poland, Denmark, New Zealand and the US, Veovo offers a world of opportunity

At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports. At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports.

The Opportunity

We focus on solutions in the analysis of queue and movement patterns as well as capacity forecasts. Our product, is cloud-based system that collects and analyzes data via proprietary (Bluetooth / WiFi) sensors, as well as third-party data sources such as camera, radar, infrared counters, coils, boarding cards, calendars, etc.

The solution primarily helps airports to forecast passenger appearance, optimize staff resources, reduce queue and travel times, and improve the experience for the passengers. In addition, we also create solutions for road traffic, railway stations, ports, ski resorts and amusement parks, with similar work and end-results.

Are you ready to be part of the team that brings our brilliant solutions "live" around the world?

The size of our installations are growing rapidly, and we are therefore seeking a skilled analytical person, who can help implement our solutions to help airports predict passenger arrival and flow. The implementation covers requirements, design, and calibration of the system. The calibration is carried out in-house via the setup of our filtering engine.

The Specifics


Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Combine models through ensemble modeling
Present information using data visualization techniques
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Collaborate with engineering and product development teams


What we are looking for


Knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C++ is an asset
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Analytical mind and business acumen
Experience in data mining
Problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication and presentation skills


What we offer in return


A job in a growing industry.
Employment immediately or by agreement.
An exciting position in a company with good working conditions with an open, direct and informal tone
A company where ideas are accelerated into action, and everyone can play a part in the development.
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development through independent work assignments.
Workplace~ Hækken 2, Vester Hassing, 9310 Vodskov
37 hours working week


Show more

Title: Deputy Data Director
Place: Listed, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Position Summary

Mission for Arizona, the 2020 Arizona Democratic Coordinated Campaign, is seeking a highly motivated and organized Deputy Data Director for our statewide program. The AZ Coordinated Campaign will play a critical role in electing Mark Kelly, and Democrats up and down the ballot including U.S. House and State Legislative districts across the state.

Key Responsibilities


Work with in-state and national stakeholders to accomplish the following:
Design and build reports and tools for the Arizona Coordinated team in line with key programmatic priorities, including, but not limited to Organizing, Mobilization, and Voter Protection teams
Assist in developing targeting and resource allocation
Create and maintain data standards to ensure data capture and hygiene
Develop and present VAN | Votebuilder training materials to the Organizing Team in statewide, small group and one-on-one settings
Respond to data support requests and flags
Support other members of the Data Team to complete projects as necessary


Preferred Skills & Qualifications


Willingness to learn and adapt to new skills and platforms used by other team members
Ability to communicate effectively within teams and across departments
A desire to thrive in a fast-paced work environment and implement creative solutions to unique problems
A technical skillset that includes familiarity or proficiency in a variety of programming languages/software such as (but not limited to) MS Excel, Google Suite, SQL, Tableau, Python, QGIS and R
One previous cycle of campaign experience or equivalent political experience in a technical role and familiarity with Votebuilder / VAN preferred
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Show more

Title: Quantitative Analyst - Macro Trading
Description:
Do you have a solid quantitative toolbox and a passion for understanding how data can shape markets? Would you like to explore the fascinating intersection of econometrics, macroeconomics, and energy trading in a high-impact role?




We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our Macro Trading team at InCommodities Europe – someone who is eager to learn, driven by curiosity, and ready to grow into a role where quantitative thinking meets real-world trading. Could this be you?




Be part of something new – and bold

In our Macro Trading team, we rethink how macroeconomic data, and econometric modelling can drive energy trading decisions. We are building our team like a start-up – high autonomy, low bureaucracy, lots of responsibility – but with the backing of a mature, successful company.




This is a rare opportunity to join us at an early stage and help shape our quantitative foundation for trading across the power, gas, and emissions markets.




What you will work on

Apply econometric and statistical methods to analyze and forecast key macro and market variables.
Build and improve models that help inform and guide trading decisions.
Collaborate closely with analysts, quants, and traders to explore market dynamics and translate insights into action.
Contribute to the development of a robust macroeconomic framework that supports both discretionary and systematic strategies.




Who you are

You have, or are close to completing, a master’s degree in economics, finance, statistics, mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
Previous work experience in a relevant position is a plus but not required.
You are passionate about econometrics, data modelling, and real-world applications of economic theory.
You are curious and proactive, eager to understand how markets work and how to quantify them.
You can code – ideally in Python – and enjoy working with data.
You are not afraid to ask questions, test ideas, and iterate.




What you can expect from us

A fast-learning environment where theory meets trading floor – and where you will see your work matter.
Flexibility, freedom, and the opportunity to grow quickly into areas that match your skills and interests.
A culture that values honesty, transparency, and rethinking the way things are done.
An informal and flat organization with no dress codes, no micromanagement, and no corporate nonsense.
Regular social events, fun traditions, and the chance to work with some of the smartest and most ambitious people in the industry.
Show more

Title: Student Assistant in People Analytics
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in this role where you’ll support our mission to turn data into actionable insights that improve employee experience and business outcomes.

Welcome to Organisational Transformation

You’ll be part of People Analytics & Insights where you, together with your colleagues, will drive Ørsted’s people data strategy and deliver impactful insights across the employee lifecycle. As part of a small, dynamic team, you’ll help shape the products and analytics that support recruitment, performance, engagement, and well-being. You’ll collaborate closely with teams in Finance, QHSE, and Global People Services, and work alongside our Senior Analyst to support ad hoc analytics requests, conduct deep dives, and contribute to product development.

As a team, we value curiosity, clarity, and impact—working together to turn complex data into contextualised stories.

You’ll play an important role in:


supporting data-driven decision-making by analysing people metrics across the business
conducting deep dives into topics like pay equity, turnover, and engagement
cleaning and preparing raw data from multiple systems
creating insights and narratives to answer open-ended business questions
collaborating with stakeholders to ensure data accuracy and relevance.


To succeed in the role, you:


are currently enrolled in a master’s programme in data science, computer science, mathematics, physics, business analytics, or a related field
have experience working with data – either through internships or academic projects
are familiar with analytical tools and languages such as Python or similar
can work independently and communicate insights clearly
are available to work 15–20 hours per week and ideally have at least two years left in your studies.


Maybe you’ve read the above and can see you have some transferable skills, even though they don’t quite match all the points. If you think you can bring something to the team, we still encourage you to apply.

Shape the future with us

Send your application to us as soon as possible. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we’ve found the right candidate.

As an applicant or employee, you may request reasonable work and position accommodation or adjustments via accommodation@orsted.com.

Title: Student Assistant for advanced analytics
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join us in this role where you’ll help develop data and statistically driven tools for our trading floor. You’ll influence decisions and handle tasks on your own, thereby contributing with your knowledge and expertise.

Welcome to Bioenergy

You’ll be part of Advanced Analytics where you, together with your colleagues, will will develop forecasts, analyses, and dashboards which provide our trading floor with a strong basis for data and statistical driven decision making in the daily operation at our Danish power stations, wind turbines, solar PV, electric boilers, heat pumps, and P2X. As a team, we continuously strive to do better and develop our skillset. We have an informal and very open culture and you’ll always be able to get help and learn from your colleagues.

You’ll play an important role in:


developing and implementing performance tracking
developing dashboards to visualise decision support and performance tracking
developing and implementing forecasting models using AI/ML/DL, incl. stochastic modelling and statistical data analysis
communicating and collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, i.e., team members, traders, etc.


To succeed in the role, you:


are currently studying data science, applied mathematics, or another relevant course within analytics and/or engineering
have at least two years left before graduating
are a strong Python programmer
have experience with writing and reviewing maintainable and testable code
are familiar with machine-learning concepts (supervised and unsupervised learning) and data analytics
have knowledge of Azure DevOps, Docker & Kubernetes, or electricity markets as a plus.


Maybe you’ve read the above and can see you have some transferable skills, even though they don’t quite match all the points. If you think you can bring something to the team, we still encourage you to apply.

Shape the future with us

Send your application and CV to us as soon as possible. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we’ve found the right candidate.

As an applicant or employee, you may request reasonable work and position accommodation or adjustments via accommodation@orsted.com.

Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country. We don't take applications or inquiries from external recruiters or agencies into account for this position.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
At Vipps MobilePay, we’re simplifying life for millions of people across the Nordics, and data is at the heart of making that happen. As a Data Engineer in our friendly and ambitious Aarhus team, you’ll play a key role in making data accessible, trusted, and impactful — helping millions of people in the Nordics enjoy simpler lives, while working closely with colleagues across teams, locations, and disciplines.

This is a great opportunity if you’ve got a few years of experience and are ready to take the next step, growing your skills, solving meaningful challenges, and making a real impact on one of the most loved digital products in the Nordics.







💡 What you’ll be doing

You’ll be part of the Data Product Hub in the Data & Insights area, collaborating with 17 data professionals across Aarhus, Copenhagen, and Oslo, and partnering with colleagues across the business to turn data into insights and solutions that make a real difference for our users

.We build the platform, tools, and models that make data accessible, discoverable, and trusted across the company. By enabling teams to easily consume and use data—from infrastructure and data modeling to analysis, we enable smarter, data-informed decisions in daily work and product development, helping shape better experiences for millions of users.







Some of the things you’ll get to do:

Develop, build and maintain data pipelines and data models using tools like dbt, Databricks, SQL, and Python.
Ensure data is accurate, trusted, and easy to find — enabling smart, data-driven decisions company-wide.
Collaborate with colleagues across disciplines, from product managers to analysts, developers, and sales, to understand needs and turn them into valuable data solutions.
Take on challenges ranging from improving how we measure product performance to enabling smoother customer journeys through data.
Share knowledge through pair programming, technical discussions, and contributing to our internal data community.
Contribute to a culture of continuous improvement, celebrating wins, running retros, and always looking for ways to work smarter.
Experiment and grow, try new things with the support of your team




This is a hands-on role with room to expand your skills and influence how we work and evolve our data platform over time.




🧠 Who we’re looking for

We believe great engineers are made through experience and curiosity. You don’t need to know everything, but you should be eager to learn, proactive in finding solutions, and comfortable working closely with people as much as with technology.




You might be a great fit if you:

Are comfortable working with data tools and concepts and working with tools like SQL, Python, dbt and cloud platforms. Experience using Databricks and Azure is a plus, but not a requirement.
Enjoy working closely with others — across technical and non-technical teams. You are not afraid to ask questions, share ideas, or offer help.
Have experience creating and/or evolving data models and/or a data platform to support a variety of user needs.
Are motivated by solving problems for your users, creating a great user experience and seeing the results of your work in action.
You want to improve over time and are open to feedback and not afraid to try, experiment and learn.
Communicate clearly and enjoy turning complexity into something understandable and usable.
Ideally, you’ll bring around 3 years of hands-on experience in data engineering or a similar role — but if you have a bit less and can demonstrate strong skills, drive, and a learning mindset, we’d still love to hear from you.
Are fluent in English — our everyday working language.




Bonus points if you:

Like talking to stakeholders, understanding needs, and helping shape roadmaps.
Have experience building scalable data products to support things like product analytics or personalization.




✨ What you’ll get from us

Real responsibility from day one, the support to grow with it and a voice in shaping how we work and evolve our data platform.
The opportunity to help build one of the most loved digital products in the Nordics.
Learning and development alongside experienced colleagues across Denmark and Norway.
A social, down-to-earth team that cares about the work and each other.
Hybrid setup: Work from our beautiful Aarhus office, with the flexibility to work up to 2 days from home.
Friday bars, hikes, ping pong, padle tennis, and more.
Work-life balance: We work smart and keep wellbeing in focus.




📬 How to apply

Click the button, answer a few quick questions, and you’re all set. We review applications continuously. We’d love to hear from you.




About the company

We’re one Nordic mobile wallet that was once two: Vipps from Norway and MobilePay from Denmark. Now, we’re united with a shared goal: to make payments easy, smart, and accessible. We serve over 12 million users and 500,000 points of sale across the Nordics — and process more than 1.3 billion transactions every year.

We’re proud of our culture, where #oneteam, #keepitsimple, and #noworries are more than just hashtags. We believe diversity makes us better and welcome everyone, regardless of background or identity.

Show more
HTML:
At Vipps MobilePay, we’re simplifying life for millions of people across the Nordics, and data is at the heart of making that happen. As a Data Engineer in our friendly and ambitious Aarhus team, you’ll play a key role in making data accessible, trusted, and impactful — helping millions of people in the Nordics enjoy simpler lives, while working closely with colleagues across teams, locations, and disciplines.

This is a great opportunity if you’ve got a few years of experience and are ready to take the next step, growing your skills, solving meaningful challenges, and making a real impact on one of the most loved digital products in the Nordics.



💡 What you’ll be doing

You’ll be part of the Data Product Hub in the Data & Insights area, collaborating with 17 data professionals across Aarhus, Copenhagen, and Oslo, and partnering with colleagues across the business to turn data into insights and solutions that make a real difference for our users

.We build the platform, tools, and models that make data accessible, discoverable, and trusted across the company. By enabling teams to easily consume and use data—from infrastructure and data modeling to analysis, we enable smarter, data-informed decisions in daily work and product development, helping shape better experiences for millions of users.



Some of the things you’ll get to do:

  • Develop, build and maintain data pipelines and data models using tools like dbt, Databricks, SQL, and Python.
  • Ensure data is accurate, trusted, and easy to find — enabling smart, data-driven decisions company-wide.
  • Collaborate with colleagues across disciplines, from product managers to analysts, developers, and sales, to understand needs and turn them into valuable data solutions.
  • Take on challenges ranging from improving how we measure product performance to enabling smoother customer journeys through data.
  • Share knowledge through pair programming, technical discussions, and contributing to our internal data community.
  • Contribute to a culture of continuous improvement, celebrating wins, running retros, and always looking for ways to work smarter.
  • Experiment and grow, try new things with the support of your team


This is a hands-on role with room to expand your skills and influence how we work and evolve our data platform over time.

Bonus points if you:
