Title: Process Data Scientist
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a Process Data Scientist to help us translate our manufacturing and supporting processes pain points, into first class Manufacturing Intelligence Use Cases via data analytics /science. If you thrive by being a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data, then you just might be a great colleague to our highly skilled Process Analytics organization.

Your New Role

The Process Data Scientist is a critical role within FUJIFILM Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) as the business is expanding and we are introducing new technologies, programs, and customers continuously – with data excellence being one of the mission enablers. We will provide ongoing support to our new site in Holly Springs, NC, USA.

You will be a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data usage and analytics value chain, whilst being the owner of already validated monitoring applications, e.g., an electronic chromatogram review setup and machine learning batch performance models. We continuously strive to identify opportunities to improve internal systems and practices, as well as provide direction and development of digital/data offerings to our partners.

Your Primary Tasks Will Be


Support process investigations, root cause analysis, optimization with data support and analysis
Process Analytics systems support to manufacturing across all product modalities
Develop, validate, and deploy ETL pipelines and help build the process data ecosystem
Support process trending, continued process verification (CPV) and annual product reviews (APQR)
Support development of applications with models for process characterization and scale-up/out
Develop, validate, and deploy multivariate batch monitoring models
Support innovation and systems improvement initiatives in the Process Analytics space



The Skills & Knowledge We Hope You Possess


You have a master’s degree in in a relevant science or engineering discipline (i.e., Engineering, Bioinformatics or similar) with 2 years of industry experience or a Bachelors in the same area with 4 years of industry experience.
You have working-knowledge of SQL and a solid understanding of data science and the Python data science ecosystem (NumPy, SciPy, pandas, Scikit-learn, Jupyter Notebook).
Familiarity with SIMCA-online, TIBCO Statistica, Visual Basic and Git version control are a plus.
It would be considered an advantage if you also have GMP experience, having worked on delivering GxP applications.



We value candidates who are naturally curious, greet people with a smile, and possess a can-do attitude. You demonstrate humility and respect for those around you. As someone who is pragmatic and structured, you have a keen focus on quality and enjoy working independently. You are proactive in dynamic entrepreneurial environments. Most importantly, you possess strong communication skills and appreciate the support of a cross-functional team.

The team

The Process Analytics team is embedded in the Process Science (PS) organization and provide leadership and subject matter expertise to existing production-ready process data business processes, while also seeking to develop and introduce new Manufacturing Intelligence in clinical, PPQ and commercial processes primarily in the large-scale Cell Culture manufacturing.

We are a growing team of highly professional dedicated scientists/engineers with data management and data science expertise - but also broad experience within pharmaceutical development and manufacturing of monoclonal antibodies.

The work environment is international and informal. The role is based in our Hillerød, Denmark location, and we offer a flexible work arrangement where a defined number of working hours can be carried out in the employee’s home.

We keep a high pace and focus on a vital work life balance while having fun. We put a strong emphasis on psychological safety through trust and empowerment within our teams and hope that this is something that speaks to you as well.

Application

Has this sparked your interest, then please upload your CV and cover letter as soon as possible, as we screen candidates on a continuous basis and call in for interviews.

The Company

FUJIFILM Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Hillerød, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication, and ambition to enable impact for the world’s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare’s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customers’ products – enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one another’s passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

FUJIFILM Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identify or any other protected class.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

Title: Data Engineer
Company: Recruit IT - Rekruttering af IT specialister
Place: Kolding, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Engineer til Sunset Boulevard – vær med til at sætte retningen for dataintegrationer og performanceoptimering




Vil du være med til at bygge fundamentet for datadrevne beslutninger, der direkte påvirker forretningens drift, medarbejderbonusser og gæsteoplevelser? Har du solid erfaring med SQL, Azure og integrationer – og trives du, når du både kan optimere eksisterende løsninger og udvikle nye? Så er det måske dig, vi søger på vegne af vores kunde, Sunset Boulevard i Kolding.




Om rollen




Som Data Engineer hos Sunset Boulevard bliver du en del af den kommercielle afdeling i et lille, specialiseret team, der brænder for at omsætte data til reel forretningsværdi. Du får ansvaret for backend-delen af virksomhedens dataplatform, hvor du især skal sikre stabile integrationer og udvikle det tekniske fundament for Qlik Sense-rapporteringen, som bruges aktivt i alle restauranter og på alle kontorer.




Du vil arbejde tæt sammen med BI-manageren, som har ansvaret for Qlik og analyser, og du får frihed til at påvirke retningen for teknologivalg og arkitektur. Derudover bliver du en central spiller i udviklingen af en ny integrationsplatform, som skal løfte virksomhedens datainfrastruktur til næste niveau.




Hos Sunset Boulevard får du en arbejdsplads med en unik 4-dages arbejdsuge, der er blevet praktiseret i 5 år, og hvor fokus på fordybelse og effektivitet er en integreret del af kulturen. Hver dag er der fast fordybelsestid, møder har klare agendaer og beslutningsfokus – og pseudoarbejde er skåret væk.




Dine primære opgaver bliver at:




Sikre stabile og skalerbare integrationer mellem Azure-dataplatformen og on-prem servere (NAV/BC)
Udvikle og vedligeholde ETL-processer, transformeringslag og integrationer via Azure Data Factory og Azure Functions
Arbejde med SQL, samt Python til at modellere, rense og berige data
Udvikle API-integrationer til interne og eksterne systemer
Klargøre data til Qlik Sense-rapportering, som bruges til performance­måling, finansiel rapportering, markedsanalyser m.m.
Bidrage til opbygningen af en fremtidig integrationsplatform
Understøtte høj datakvalitet og sikre, at datagrundlaget er robust nok til forretningskritiske beslutninger




Sunset Boulevard forestiller sig, at du…




Har stærke kompetencer inden for SQL, Azure Functions og Python
Har erfaring med Azure Data Factory og gerne Qlik
Har arbejdet med dataintegrationer, ETL og API-udvikling
Er teknisk stærk, men også kan se data i en forretningsmæssig kontekst
Trives i et miljø med frihed under ansvar, hvor du får stor indflydelse på løsningerne
Er struktureret, kvalitetsbevidst og tager ansvar for at komme helt i mål med opgaverne




Sunset Boulevard tilbyder




En unik 4-dages arbejdsuge, hvor fokus på effektivitet og fordybelse giver bedre resultater og mere fritid
En central rolle i en virksomhed, hvor data har direkte indflydelse på drift og medarbejderbonusser
Stor frihed til at vælge teknologier og præge retningen for dataintegrationer
Et team med høj faglighed, kort vej til beslutninger og en kultur præget af fokus, forberedelse og respekt for alles tid
Attraktive ansættelsesvilkår inkl. pension, sundhedsforsikring og kantineordning







Sunset Boulevard vil gøre det lidt bedre end forventet




Sunset Boulevard er Danmarks største danskejede fastfoodkæde med rødder i Odense, hovedkontor i Kolding og mere end 50 restauranter fordelt over hele Danmark og med enkelte knappenåle i både Grønland, på Færøerne og i Tyskland. Siden 1996 har de haft appetit på mere – og det har de stadig.




Hos dem handler det ikke alene om god, frisklavet mad af gode råvarer – det handler også om mennesker. De tror på stærke relationer, store ambitioner og på, at man lærer mest, når man tør prøve sig frem. Som medarbejder hos Sunset Boulevard er du en vigtig del af et fællesskab, hvor de hjælper hinanden, har det sjovt og hvor de øver sig i at blive lidt bedre – hver dag.




De gør os umage med at skabe mad, der både smager godt og af mere – og går op i, at gæsterne føler sig velkomne, set og forkælet. For dem er det den samlede oplevelse, der tæller.

Show more

Title: Football Statistician (Data Collection)
Description:
JOIN OUR TEAM AT GENIUS SPORTS!




WHO ARE WE?




Genius Sports is the official data, technology, and commercial partner driving the connection between sports, betting, and media on a global scale. Our mission is to create a more sustainable sports data network powered by rich, official live data. To achieve this, we're seeking enthusiastic Statisticians to join our team and collect match data while attending live sporting events.




ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT FOOTBALL?




If you love football and want to be part of the action while getting paid, this is your opportunity! We are looking for individuals in the Thisted area to collect official in-game statistics from football events in Superliga; 1st Division; 2nd Division, 3rd Division and the Danish Cup.




As a Statistician, you will use our user-friendly smartphone-enabled software to report live events, including every shot, goal, tackle, and save. Don’t worry if you lack previous reporting experience - we provide comprehensive e-learning courses and practical training to ensure you’re fully prepared to cover live games. This is the perfect chance for sports enthusiasts to earn extra income while doing something they love.




WHAT WE OFFER:

Guaranteed base pay of €70 per game
A performance-based reward system
Coverage of travel expenses

If you’re eager to immerse yourself in the world of sports and want to be part of our global network of statisticians, we want to hear from you!




JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Basic level in English
Regular availability for a few hours on weekends and weekday evenings
Familiarity with using a smartphone
Willingness to travel
A strong knowledge of football
Reliability, commitment, organization, and integrity
Exceptional attention to detail




GET TO KNOW US:

For more information about our mission and values, visit: Genius Sports




ARE YOU READY TO JOIN THE GENIUS SPORTS TEAM?

If you’re excited about this opportunity, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now and become a vital part of our team!

Show more

Genius Sports is the official data, technology, and commercial partner driving the connection between sports, betting, and media on a global scale. Our mission is to create a more sustainable sports data network powered by rich, official live data. To achieve this, we're seeking enthusiastic Statisticians to join our team and collect match data while attending live sporting events.


ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT FOOTBALL?


If you love football and want to be part of the action while getting paid, this is your opportunity! We are looking for individuals in the Thisted area to collect official in-game statistics from football events in Superliga; 1st Division; 2nd Division, 3rd Division and the Danish Cup.


As a Statistician, you will use our user-friendly smartphone-enabled software to report live events, including every shot, goal, tackle, and save. Don’t worry if you lack previous reporting experience - we provide comprehensive e-learning courses and practical training to ensure you’re fully prepared to cover live games. This is the perfect chance for sports enthusiasts to earn extra income while doing something they love.


WHAT WE OFFER:

  • Guaranteed base pay of €70 per game
  • A performance-based reward system
  • Coverage of travel expenses

If you’re eager to immerse yourself in the world of sports and want to be part of our global network of statisticians, we want to hear from you!


JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  • Basic level in English
  • Regular availability for a few hours on weekends and weekday evenings
  • Familiarity with using a smartphone
  • Willingness to travel
  • A strong knowledge of football
  • Reliability, commitment, organization, and integrity
  • Exceptional attention to detail


GET TO KNOW US:

For more information about our mission and values, visit: Genius Sports


ARE YOU READY TO JOIN THE GENIUS SPORTS TEAM?

If you’re excited about this opportunity, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now and become a vital part of our team!

Title: Senior Consultant
Description:
Kan du omsætte data til indsigt - og indsigt til forandring?




Er du skarp på analyse, elsker at formidle, og trives du i krydsfeltet mellem data, strategi og ledelsesrådgivning? Så læs videre – vi leder efter dig.




Hos Dataminds hjælper vi vores kunder med at forstå deres forretning bedre gennem data. Vi løser konkrete forretningsudfordringer ved at omsætte data til handlinger, der skaber reel værdi i praksis. Vi søger en Senior Consultant, der kan bygge bro mellem mennesker og modeller og sikre, at indsigter ikke blot forstås, men også omsættes til bæredygtige beslutninger, som skaber forandring.




Jobbet – hvad skal du lave?




Du bliver en nøglespiller i vores management consulting team, hvor du skal bringe dataindsigter hele vejen fra model til mødelokale. Det indebærer bl.a.:




Udarbejdelse og præsentation af analyser og strategiske beslutningsgrundlag baseret på data og machine learning
Oversættelse af komplekse indsigter til tydelige budskaber, der skaber handling
Rådgivning af ledere og stakeholders med fokus på at skabe ejerskab, så løsninger forankres og realiseres
Projektledelse fra start til slut




Du bliver en del af et team, der kombinerer høj faglighed med en uformel stemning og et fælles mål om at gøre en forskel.




Hvem er du?




Du har en stærk analytisk profil – men dit særkende er, at du også kan formidle dine indsigter, så de skaber forståelse og handling. Du formår at tage styring i projekter og relationer, og du har en naturlig troværdighed i dialogen med beslutningstagere.




Vi forestiller os, at du:




Har en relevant uddannelse (fx cand.merc., cand.oecon., cand.polit. el.lign.)
Har 3+ års erfaring med analyse og præsentation – gerne fra konsulentverdenen eller en analytisk rolle tæt på ledelsen
Har stærke kompetencer indenfor:

- Kvantitativ analyse og datadrevet problemløsning

- Formidling og visualisering af data (f.eks. PowerPoint, Power BI, Excel)

- Stakeholder management og ledelsesrådgivning

- Projektledelse og implementering

Er nysgerrig, selvkørende og har en struktureret tilgang til dit arbejde
Trives i konsulentrollen og værdsætter samarbejde, faglig sparring og fællesskab




Hvad kan du forvente af os?




Hos Dataminds får du:

En rolle med ansvar, indflydelse og mulighed for at sætte dit præg
En vækstvirksomhed i bevægelse – med masser af muligheder og kort vej fra idé til handling
Et stærkt fagligt miljø, hvor vi løfter hinanden og nørder data med stolthed
Et uformelt arbejdsmiljø med bordtennis, fredagsøl, løbeture og højt til loftet, i hjertet af Aarhus 




Om Dataminds




Dataminds er en innovativ konsulentvirksomhed med speciale i Data Science, Analytics og Business Intelligence. Vi arbejder for nogle af landets største virksomheder og organisationer – altid med ambitionen om at skabe reel forandring og forretningsværdi med data.




Klar til at tage næste skridt?




Send din ansøgning og dit CV til job@dataminds.com, og fortæl os, hvordan du kan være med til at løfte Dataminds og vores kunder til næste niveau.




Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Kathrine Deleuran på kkd@dataminds.com eller 30248734. 




Arbejdsplads: Ankersgade 12C, 1. sal, 8000 Aarhus C

Arbejdstid: Almindelig kontortid

Ansættelsesform: Fuld tid (37 timer)

Tiltrædelse: Snarest




Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Show more

Title: Student Worker, Pricing & Commercial Analytics, Hørsholm
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our Junior Pricing & Data analyst

Are you a structured and data-driven student with experience or a strong interest in pricing, data analytics, and AI? Do you enjoy working with large datasets and translating data into insights that drive commercial performance? If so, this could be the perfect opportunity for you!

At Novonesis, the newly formed company from the merger of Novozymes and Chr. Hansen, we are seeking a Junior Pricing & Data Analyst to help us elevate how we use data to support pricing strategy and commercial decision-making in the Food & Beverage Biosolutions (FBB) business area.

Welcome to Pricing & Commercial Analytics…

You will be part of Pricing & Commercial Analytics team of 5 colleagues with solid and diverse experience in Pricing and Commercial Excellence from various industries and consulting backgrounds. The team is responsible for pricing strategy, commercial analytics, and insights generation—and sits within Strategy, Integration & Commercial Excellence in the FBB organization.

In This Role You’ll Make An Impact By

Performing advanced data analytics to build data-driven insights that help identify commercial opportunities and achieve commercial objectives.

What You’ll Do


Analytics: Perform various commercial analysis on large datasets with tools such as Excel, SQL, Python, Knime and Power BI.
Modeling: Conduct scenario modeling to assess the impact of pricing changes, pipeline health, and other commercial factors, leveraging your skills in statistics or AI.
Commercial Dashboards: Build and maintain Power BI dashboards that enable Sales and Marketing teams to understand performance and take data-driven actions
Provide Data Insight: Translate commercial data to insight that is comprehensible by stakeholders to better understand their business and easily identify pricing challenges and opportunities.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Share knowledge and support colleagues from Marketing and Sales to foster a collaborative learning environment, contributing as an integral member of the team.


To Succeed You Must Hold


You are in the final year of your bachelor or in the 1-2nd year of your master’s degree in Data Science, Business, Economics, Finance or a related field
You have passion and experience with data analytics and tools such as Python, SQL, or similar. You are a proficient Microsoft Excel wizard.
You enjoy problem-solving and turning data into actionable insights
You are proficient in English, both written and spoken.


What You’ll Gain


Real-World Business Acumen: Develop a strong understanding of pricing and commercial analysis, and strategic decision-making.
Technical Skills: Deepen your knowledge of tools like Power BI, Excel, SQL, Python or Knime.
Networking Opportunities: Build relationships with experienced professionals across various functions.
Mentorship & Guidance: Receive mentorship and guidance from experienced pricing and monetization managers and business leaders.
Career development: Gain applicable and valuable work experience at a leading global company.


Who You Are

You possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills, enabling you to analyze large datasets and extract actionable insights effectively. You are keen to learn and develop and set a strong footing in your career progression.

We expect you to be able to work 15-20 hours per week primarily from the offices in Hørsholm and Lyngby while being flexible with working hours and working from home.

Application deadline: August 25th, 2025

We will screen in-coming applications and invite for interviews continuously during the application period, so please apply as soon as possible.

Contact details: Head of Pricing & Commercial Analytics Brian Lauridsen at BRILA@novonesis.com

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is dedicated to fostering a unique community by embracing and respecting differences. We make all employment decisions based on business needs, ensuring that every individual can thrive, regardless of identity or background such as ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Stay alert: Avoid recruitment scams

At Novonesis, We Are Committed To Maintaining a Safe And Transparent Recruitment Process. Please Be Aware Of Potential Scams Targeting Job Seekers And Take Note Of The Following


Novonesis will never ask for sensitive personal information, such as bank account details, Social Security numbers, or passwords, at any stage of the hiring process.
Novonesis does not make employment offers without conducting interviews with candidates.


If you receive suspicious communication claiming to be from Novonesis, please do not share any personal or financial information. We encourage you to verify the legitimacy of the message by contacting us directly through our official channels.

  • Novonesis will never ask for sensitive personal information, such as bank account details, Social Security numbers, or passwords, at any stage of the hiring process.
  • Novonesis does not make employment offers without conducting interviews with candidates.

Title: Part-Time Analyst (m/f/d)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
PATRIZIA is a leading partner for global real assets.

The expertise and commitment of our global teams form the basis of our success. Shaping a sustainable future and making a positive contribution to society is what drives our daily business.

PATRIZIA Global Partners (PGP) is the company’s international real estate division, which invests throughout North America, Europe and Asia with best-in-class local operating partners. Most recently, PGP has launched the PATRIZIA Sustainable Communities fund, a real estate impact vehicle, and the PATRIZIA Global Real Estate Debt Fund, a specialised real estate debt strategy. It has also invested in a data centre platform across North and South America. PGP continues to evolve, actively pursuing opportunities in real estate private equity, real asset debt, and specialised investment strategies.

The role


We are looking for someone to join PGP’s team as soon as possible at our Copenhagen Office.
As a Part-time Analyst, you will join our investment and fund management team of ten dedicated professionals responsible for sourcing, analysing, selecting, and managing real estate investments through local operating partners. The role offers a broad range of assignments.


Your Responsibilities


Conduct macro- and micro-level market analysis, including sector-specific research
Perform financial and strategic analysis of investment opportunities, including financial modelling and return calculations
Preparation of Investment Committee materials
Prepare presentation materials for client meetings, investor briefings, and industry events
Maintain and update PGP’s proprietary deal database with information on investment opportunities
Benchmark performance and monitor risk across PGP’s investment portfolio
Meetings with international operating partners


What we look for


Strong analytical skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint; knowledge of or willingness to learn VBA is an advantage
Strong academic track record with excellent verbal and written English skills
Preferably in the third year of a bachelor’s degree or the first year of a master’s degree in Economics, Business, Finance, or a related field
Self-motivated, driven, and an effective team player
Detail-oriented and thorough, with an interest in working in a dynamic, international, and engaging environment
The workload is approximately 15–20 hours per week, with flexibility on both sides during busy periods.


What we offer


Competitive remuneration package
Various skill building and learning opportunities through PATRIZIA Academy, like talent development programs and mentorship
Inclusive and equal-opportunity workplace (incl. ED&I Committee) in an international environment
Possibility to participate in different employee resource groups (NextGen, LGBTQ+ Alliance, Female Advance, Parents & Carer Network etc.)


Sounds like you?

If you have any questions, please contact Philip Olander, Associate Director, at philip.olander@patrizia.ag or on +45 2544 2052, or Peter Lindeschouw, Associate Director, at peter.lindeschouw@patrizia.ag or on +45 4216 0786.

Applications in English are welcome as soon as possible and no later than Friday, 22 August 2025. To apply, please email your cover letter, CV, academic transcripts, and any references to Job.DK@patrizia.ag.

Title: Softwareudvikler med SQL-kompetencer og fokus på data
Description:
Til vores kunde DCS ApS i Trige, nord for Aarhus, søger vi en erfaren og dedikeret softwareudvikler med stærke SQL-kompetencer og fokus på data.




Du får en central rolle i at optimere virksomhedens databaseløsninger og udvikle effektive, skalerbare systemer.




Du får ansvaret for data i virksomheden, og du kommer til i tæt samarbejde med ledelse og virksomheden at videreudvikle og styrke brugen af data.




Hos DCS ApS sælger de IT- og elektronikprodukter for mere end 1,2 milliarder om året gennem deres mange digitale platforme. Deres kunder dækker alt fra de største, nordiske og europæiske online forhandlere til de mindre, lokale forhandlere i Danmark. Siden 1994 har DCS ApS været med til at sætte den digitale dagsorden. Deres domæne blev registreret i 1996, hvor de åbnede en af Danmarks allerførste webshops – og eCommerce, data og digitale systemer er stadig én af grundstenene i deres forretning.




Virksomheden beskæftiger i dag cirka 80 medarbejdere og har en kultur præget af iværksætterånd, hvor der er stor fokus på samarbejde. Du bliver del af deres it-team, hvor de pt. er fire backend softwareudviklere med fokus på interne systemer og to udviklere i Polen, som har fokus på deres webshops.




Hos DCS ApS får du en central rolle i at optimere virksomhedens dataarkitektur og sikre, at dataudnyttelsen på tværs af systemerne er optimal.

Du vil få ansvaret for at få et overblik over virksomhedens data og databaser, analysere datakvalitet og sikre, at data er tilgængelig og anvendelig for de relevante afdelinger og systemer. Ligeledes vil du arbejde med at udvikle og optimere SQL-forespørgsler, stored procedures, triggers og funktioner for at understøtte forretningsbehovene. Du er selv med til at analysere og definere opgaverne, så engagement og selvstændighed vægtes højt.




Du har ansvaret for at implementere tekniske løsninger, der kan styrke den operationelle drift og forretningsmæssige beslutningstagning ved at sikre hurtig og effektiv adgang til data.

I tæt samarbejde med ledelsen og øvrige afdelinger vil du bidrage til at videreudvikle og optimere virksomhedens datadrevne processer og sikre, at data understøtter virksomhedens strategi og mål.




Du vil få ansvar for at drive og koordinere alle de projekter, der involverer dataopsamling, -opbevaring og -anvendelse. Dette kan omfatte implementering af nye dataintegrationsløsninger og systemer, samt vedligeholdelse og optimering af eksisterende systemer.




Du vil referere direkte til CMO, Thomas Kirkeby og kommer til at arbejde tæt sammen med ham. Virksomheden er organiseret i en flad struktur, hvor ledelsen besidder stærke IT- og datamæssige kompetencer. De har en agil tilgang til systemudvikling, hvor løbende justeringer af datagrundlaget spiller en central rolle.




Dine faglige og personlige kvalifikationer

Vi forventer, at du har en relevant IT-uddannelse og mindst 3-5 års professionel erfaring med lignende ansvarsfulde stilling. Gerne flere års erfaring.




Du er teknisk stærk og har indgående erfaring med SQL og SQL-databaser, herunder CTE-tabeller, SQL-cursors, -triggers og stored procedures. Det er også en fordel, hvis du har et bredt kendskab til teknologier og udviklingssprog – f.eks. kendskab til PowerBI, SQL Reporting Service, C#/.NET, Docker m.v.

Data- og databasemiljøet er opbygget som en kombination af egne systemer omkring Microsoft Dynamics C5, med integrationer til blandt andet Apport WMS, nShift Cnet og Icecat. Projektstyring håndteres via Asana som projektstyringsværktøj.




At du har forretningsforståelse og kan koble data, systemer og forretning sammen vil være naturligt i denne rolle i tæt sparring med indkøb, salg og ledelse.




Som person er du selvkørende, nysgerrig og har stor passion for data. Du har lyst til at gøre en forskel og hjælpe forretningen gennem gode dataløsninger af høj kvalitet.




DCS ApS tilbyder

En spændende og fagligt udfordrende stilling, hvor du får et stort ansvar og mulighed for at udvikle og præge dataretningen hos en ambitiøs virksomhed, hvor data er højt prioriteret – hvilket afspejles i gode karrieremuligheder for den rigtige profil.

Du bliver en del af et stærkt kollegialt team og får engagerede kollegaer på tværs af virksomheden. Både ledelse og alle afdelinger er datadrevne, hvorfor dit arbejde vil blive meget værdsat.




Mere om virksomheden

DCS ApS holder til i Trige, nord for Aarhus, i deres 6.500 m2 store kombinerede lager- og administrationsfaciliteter. Siden etableringen i 1994 har de løbende tilpasset sig markedet for at fastholde deres stærke position, som betyder, at de kan tilbyde deres kunder et unikt setup.




Måske kender du dem fra deres to primære webshops, DCS.dk og Compumail.dk, hvor de tilbyder B2B- og B2C-kunder mere end 250.000 forskellige IT- og elektronikprodukter på tværs af brands som Lenovo, Logitech, Jabra, Apple, Samsung og mange flere.

I 2022 indviede DCS ApS deres nye topmoderne lager- og administrationsfaciliteter.




Interesseret?

Vi hos Bloom glæder os til at modtage din ansøgning og CV snarest. Samtaler afholdes løbende, og ansættelse sker, når vi har fundet den rette kandidat. Har du spørgsmål vedrørende stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte seniorkonsulent Dorte Pape på tlf. 3160 9365 eller via dp@bloom.dk.




Hvis du søger jobbet via ’Easy Apply’ skal du ikke forvente et svar på din ansøgning. Det vil du altid få, hvis du søger via jobannoncen på https://bloom.dk/jobs/softwareudvikler-med-sql-kompetencer-og-fokus-paa-data-347/




Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Show more
HTML:
Til vores kunde DCS ApS i Trige, nord for Aarhus, søger vi en erfaren og dedikeret softwareudvikler med stærke SQL-kompetencer og fokus på data.


Du får en central rolle i at optimere virksomhedens databaseløsninger og udvikle effektive, skalerbare systemer.


Du får ansvaret for data i virksomheden, og du kommer til i tæt samarbejde med ledelse og virksomheden at videreudvikle og styrke brugen af data.


Hos DCS ApS sælger de IT- og elektronikprodukter for mere end 1,2 milliarder om året gennem deres mange digitale platforme. Deres kunder dækker alt fra de største, nordiske og europæiske online forhandlere til de mindre, lokale forhandlere i Danmark. Siden 1994 har DCS ApS været med til at sætte den digitale dagsorden. Deres domæne blev registreret i 1996, hvor de åbnede en af Danmarks allerførste webshops – og eCommerce, data og digitale systemer er stadig én af grundstenene i deres forretning.


Virksomheden beskæftiger i dag cirka 80 medarbejdere og har en kultur præget af iværksætterånd, hvor der er stor fokus på samarbejde. Du bliver del af deres it-team, hvor de pt. er fire backend softwareudviklere med fokus på interne systemer og to udviklere i Polen, som har fokus på deres webshops.


Hos DCS ApS får du en central rolle i at optimere virksomhedens dataarkitektur og sikre, at dataudnyttelsen på tværs af systemerne er optimal.

Du vil få ansvaret for at få et overblik over virksomhedens data og databaser, analysere datakvalitet og sikre, at data er tilgængelig og anvendelig for de relevante afdelinger og systemer. Ligeledes vil du arbejde med at udvikle og optimere SQL-forespørgsler, stored procedures, triggers og funktioner for at understøtte forretningsbehovene. Du er selv med til at analysere og definere opgaverne, så engagement og selvstændighed vægtes højt.


Du har ansvaret for at implementere tekniske løsninger, der kan styrke den operationelle drift og forretningsmæssige beslutningstagning ved at sikre hurtig og effektiv adgang til data.

I tæt samarbejde med ledelsen og øvrige afdelinger vil du bidrage til at videreudvikle og optimere virksomhedens datadrevne processer og sikre, at data understøtter virksomhedens strategi og mål.


Du vil få ansvar for at drive og koordinere alle de projekter, der involverer dataopsamling, -opbevaring og -anvendelse. Dette kan omfatte implementering af nye dataintegrationsløsninger og systemer, samt vedligeholdelse og optimering af eksisterende systemer.


Du vil referere direkte til CMO, Thomas Kirkeby og kommer til at arbejde tæt sammen med ham. Virksomheden er organiseret i en flad struktur, hvor ledelsen besidder stærke IT- og datamæssige kompetencer. De har en agil tilgang til systemudvikling, hvor løbende justeringer af datagrundlaget spiller en central rolle.


Dine faglige og personlige kvalifikationer

Vi forventer, at du har en relevant IT-uddannelse og mindst 3-5 års professionel erfaring med lignende ansvarsfulde stilling. Gerne flere års erfaring.


Du er teknisk stærk og har indgående erfaring med SQL og SQL-databaser, herunder CTE-tabeller, SQL-cursors, -triggers og stored procedures. Det er også en fordel, hvis du har et bredt kendskab til teknologier og udviklingssprog – f.eks. kendskab til PowerBI, SQL Reporting Service, C#/.NET, Docker m.v.

Data- og databasemiljøet er opbygget som en kombination af egne systemer omkring Microsoft Dynamics C5, med integrationer til blandt andet Apport WMS, nShift Cnet og Icecat. Projektstyring håndteres via Asana som projektstyringsværktøj.


At du har forretningsforståelse og kan koble data, systemer og forretning sammen vil være naturligt i denne rolle i tæt sparring med indkøb, salg og ledelse.


Som person er du selvkørende, nysgerrig og har stor passion for data. Du har lyst til at gøre en forskel og hjælpe forretningen gennem gode dataløsninger af høj kvalitet.

Måske kender du dem fra deres to primære webshops, DCS.dk og Compumail.dk, hvor de tilbyder B2B- og B2C-kunder mere end 250.000 forskellige IT- og elektronikprodukter på tværs af brands som Lenovo, Logitech, Jabra, Apple, Samsung og mange flere.

I 2022 indviede DCS ApS deres nye topmoderne lager- og administrationsfaciliteter.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We're looking for a hands-on Data Platform Engineer to join a high-impact team building a scalable AWS-based data platform for a trailblazer in AI governance and analytics. You’ll collaborate across engineering, DevOps, and compliance teams to drive performance, observability, and data integrity across systems.




Responsibilities

Architect and evolve a scalable, high-availability cloud infrastructure on AWS
Build robust data platforms to support large-scale analytics and governance tools
Implement automation through Infrastructure as Code and CI/CD workflows
Lead container orchestration with Kubernetes, Docker, Helm, and ArgoCD
Support data infrastructure compliance, performance tuning, and reliability
Ensure alignment with cloud security and data governance standards




Ideal Candidate

3+ years of AWS infrastructure and DevOps experience
Deep expertise with Kubernetes, Docker, and tools like Terraform or Pulumi
Programming experience in Python and Typescript
Familiarity with distributed data systems and SQL optimisation
Fluent in English
Problem-solver with a collaborative and pragmatic mindset




This role offers a competitive salary, flexible hybrid working, and a chance to grow within an innovative company shaping the future of trustworthy AI and data infrastructure.

Show more

  • Architect and evolve a scalable, high-availability cloud infrastructure on AWS

Title: [Paid Student Job] Founder's Associate in VC-funded fintech scaleup
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for an ambitious and hands-on Founder's Associate (Working Student) to join Performativ. This is a rare opportunity to work side-by-side with the founding & executive team of a high-growth fintech scale-up, gaining exposure to strategic decision-making, operations, and data-driven execution.

As a Founder's Associate, you will support strategic and operational initiatives across multiple business areas. You’ll be working with large volumes of data, helping shape key decisions, and have direct access to the founders of Performativ.

What you’ll do 📈


Work directly with the founding team on strategic projects across commercial, operational, and product functions
Analyze large datasets to generate insights that support high-stakes decision-making
Build and maintain Excel models, dashboards in Hubspot, and reports to track business performance
Conduct market research and benchmarking of the industry
Prepare investor materials and internal documentation
Own and drive mini-projects independently with full responsibility


What we’re looking for 🎯


Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, lookups, (very) complex, nested formulas.
Hungry and ambitious students enrolled in a top-tier university program (business, finance, economics, engineering, or similar) with outstanding academic results
Strong analytical mindset and ability to work with large, complex datasets
High attention to detail and a structured way of thinking
Proactive, hands-on attitude with a willingness to roll up your sleeves
Comfortable working 20 hours/week on average (30 hours/week during peak periods) Flexibility provided around exam schedules.


What we can offer you 🌱


Trust and responsibility to shape the future of Performativ’s success in the European market from day 1.
Join a fast-growing fintech scaleup supported by top-tier VCs.
Work with intelligent, passionate, and driven professionals with experience from leading institutions (such as Goldman Sachs, McKinsey, BCG, Amazon etc).
Accelerate your career with opportunities for professional development and leadership.


Join a Team of Fintech heroes! 🚀

Performativ is making waves in the wealth management ecosystem and is changing the way investment advisors and financial institutions do business around the world. Working at Performativ means working at a fast-paced tech scaleup with intelligent people who are passionate about their work. We are on a scaling journey beyond all metrics and expectations - and can't wait to have you join us in making a real impact.

We are funded by some of the leading VC funds in the world and expectations are set to be established as a European market leader in a record amount of time.

You can read more about our product at performativ.com

We value passion 🔥

At Performativ, we are builders first. We are passionate with ambitious goals and value the time and effort people put into their work. You will be part of the family from day one, and responsible for making your mark and driving forward your vision. Autonomous work is embedded in our culture, and we are committed to ensure you have all the tools and support you need while acknowledging the importance of flexibility.

Title: Junior Campaign Manager (Remote, Europe)
Description:
A Few Words About LearnWorlds

Learning is humanity's only real superpower; it turns knowledge into skills, products, and competitive edge.

At LearnWorlds, our mission is to empower individuals, businesses, and communities to unlock growth through learning. We offer a powerful, flexible, and AI-powered e-learning platform designed for modern, complex business models - from solopreneurs to global enterprises.

Our all-in-one platform combines course creation, website building, monetization, analytics, and automation, giving customers everything they need to build impactful, scalable learning experiences. What sets us apart is our unmatched flexibility and ability to adapt to each customer's unique structure, branding, and business goals.

We serve more than 11,000 customers in over 150 countries, helping them create, sell, and scale online academies and knowledge products. Our team is fully remote (with optional offices in Greece and Cyprus), and we're just getting started.

About The Role

We're looking for a Junior Campaign Manager to join our fast-growing Marketing team at LearnWorlds. In this role, you'll be instrumental in ensuring smooth and high-quality execution of multi-channel marketing campaigns. You will support senior marketing team members in launching and managing campaigns that drive demand generation, lead nurturing, and conversion across digital channels.

This is a hands-on, detail-oriented role that requires strong project coordination and copywriting skills, curiosity to learn, and a collaborative spirit. You'll be at the operational heart of our campaigns—coordinating assets, managing timelines, preparing short-form marketing copy, and ensuring proper process adherence through our internal tools (Slack, Asana, Zoom, etc.).

You'll be joining a cross-functional Marketing Tribe that includes Senior Growth Marketing Managers, a Content Manager and the Tribe's Head—all focused on building and executing full-funnel marketing initiatives.

Key Responsibilities

Campaign Coordination & Setup


Support the planning and launch of campaigns across paid, email, and social channels
Coordinate development of assets and messaging with internal teams (Brand, Demand Gen, Design, Dev, MarkOps)
Execute timely and structured campaign launch coordination using platforms like Slack, Asana, Zoom, etc


Short-Form Copywriting


Write or adapt short-form copy for digital ads, landing pages, email headers, CTAs, and social media promotions
Align messaging with the ICP and campaign concept provided by senior team members
Collaborate with the Content Manager and Brand team to ensure tone of voice consistency and copy quality
Proofread and review copy across all campaign materials before launch


Project Management


Maintain Asana boards and campaign timelines to ensure projects move forward on schedule
Secure and document team alignments through Slack, brief templates, and check-ins


Launch Execution


Handle logistics for webinars and virtual events (Zoom setup, speaker coordination, live-day management)
Assist in campaign launches (UTMs setup, briefs creation, Asana task tracking)


Performance Support


Collaborate with Growth Marketing Managers to monitor campaign KPIs and performance
Coordinate reporting tasks and optimization action points


Process Excellence


Follow structured processes to ensure consistent and high-quality execution
Maintain internal documentation for repeatable campaign processes and templates


Requirements


1+ year of experience in a marketing coordination, campaign support, or similar role
Some experience or demonstrated ability to write engaging, concise copy for digital ads, landing pages, emails, and social posts
Comfortable using task management tools (e.g., Asana), communication tools (e.g., Slack), and basic analytics/reporting tools
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines
Eagerness to learn and develop campaign marketing and copywriting skills in a collaborative environment
Excellent written and verbal communication in English
A proactive mindset and strong attention to detail


Nice to Have


Experience in SaaS, digital learning, or e-learning industries
Familiarity with campaign platforms such as Meta, LinkedIn, and Google Ads
Hands-on involvement in executing webinars, paid social campaigns, or email marketing flows.


Benefits


Private life and health insurance plan
Fully remote work if you prefer to work from home, apart from when we have team meetings a few times per year
Your personal annual training budget
An annual home office allowance to set up your personal space
Company laptop
23 days of paid time off
3 early summer Fridays in July and August
A free LearnWorlds School to build and sell your own courses
Work in one of the globally top 5 e-learning courses platform
An opportunity to grow alongside us and shape the look and feel of tomorrow's e-learning
An entrepreneurial, international, and highly motivated team with a flat hierarchy that will both challenge you and help you reach your highest potential
Annual company retreats (see the video of our latest retreat)
Show more

  • Your personal annual training budget

  • Company laptop
  • 23 days of paid time off
  • 3 early summer Fridays in July and August
  • A free LearnWorlds School to build and sell your own courses
  • Work in one of the globally top 5 e-learning courses platform
  • An opportunity to grow alongside us and shape the look and feel of tomorrow's e-learning
  • An entrepreneurial, international, and highly motivated team with a flat hierarchy that will both challenge you and help you reach your highest potential
  • Annual company retreats (see the video of our latest retreat)

Title: Market analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
NTU International A/S is leading a consortium for the implementation of the EIB funded project called: Global Gateway private sector digital infrastructure project delivery advisory services and is searching for experts to support the core team during the implementation of this project.




The overall objective of this assignment is to provide digital infrastructure promoters comprehensive advisory services to secure and deploy financing from EIB and co-financers for projects contributing to the EC’s Global Gateway.




Duration: The intended start date is October 2025, and the period of implementation of the contract will be 48 months from this date.




Key Expert: Market analyst




☝️ Qualifications and skills:

University degree in a relevant discipline (Economics, Law, Finance or Engineering or other relevant field). Master’s degree would be an advantage;
Fluency in oral and written English;
Working knowledge of French will be considered as an asset.




☝️ General professional experience:

10 years’ experience in the digital / telecom sector;
5 years’ experience in market analysis in the digital economy/telecom sector.




☝️ Specific professional experience:

Experience of market analysis in developing countries and least developed countries, as demonstrated by the expert’s involvement in projects involving telecom operators fundraising, mergers and acquisition;
Experience of market analysis delivered for financial institutions (commercial banks or development banks);
Experience of market analysis in sub-Saharan Africa involving market review, competitive analysis, financial projects and risk analysis.




If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply and upload your CV via LinkedIn or sent to recruitment@ntu.eu. Due to the large number of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Title: AI Healthcare Data Specialist
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Ambu A/S is currently looking for an AI Healthcare Data Specialist to be based in Augsburg, Germany.

In Ambu we develop single-use endoscope solutions and the digital space is a fast growing part of the buisiness. The potential improvements that can be achieved with AI solutions are extraordinary. At the heart of these AI application lies the data and this is where you come in. We need your help to ensure the highest quality of data and annotatios for our deep learning models and your help to prove their performance in the clinic.

In this position you will join Ambu’s Algorithms team, a team of data specialists and deep learning engineers, with the common goal of bringing the best possible digital solutions to the doctors. The Algorithms team is currently based entirely at the Ambu headquarter in Ballerup, Denmark, but it is the company strategy to build up and expand our team in Augsburg, Germany. We believe it to be vital that you get integrated into the team quickly, therefore we expect you to start out your journey in Ambu, by spending 3 weeks at the headquarter in Denmark – getting introduced to the company, the work and the team. In addition, we expect that you travel at least 4 times to Denmark during the first year.

Key Responsibilities As AI Healthcare Data Specialist

Your work will be organised in an AI project team, where you in close collaboration with another AI Healthcare Data specialist will be responsible for getting the data. The focus will be on the clinical and data related tasks regarding user interaction, workflow understanding, data collection and annotation, clinical trials, implementation in products, and clinical documentation.

You will primarily...


Identify user needs and evaluate AI solutions to improve clinical workflow.
Design, establish and drive clinical data collection studies
Identify, define and communicate data and label needs/requirements
Ensure data quality and control
Clinical documentation package, including clinical risk related documentation


Experienced In Data Acquisition And Data Management

We are looking for an experienced candidate with a minimum of 5 years of experience working with clinical data collection studies. We imagine you may hold a Master of Biomedical Engineering or a similar field. Ideally, you have experience working with data annotation and anonymization. It is essential that you have a keen interest in AI and a drive for making clinical products. Desirable skills for this position are:


Knowledge of quality assurance in medtech
Experience working with medical personel
Experience in running clinical studies
Experience in data management, annotation and anonymization
General programming skillset – as a minimum in Python
General knowledge of deep learning theory and applications


As a person, you are highly motivated, self-driven, structured and with a strong sense of detail.

It is essential that you have excellent communication and English skills, both written and oral.

Ambu – a visionary and international workplace where your efforts matter

Ambu is a company that expands rapidly and has ambitious growth targets. We meet these targets through interdisciplinary teamwork between motivated and highly skilled employees. Your contributions and efforts are crucial to our success and by joining us you will get the opportunity to work in an international head office with an informal working environment.

We offer great opportunities for personal development. Furthermore, we offer a wide range of professional, social and financial employee benefits in addition to exciting job challenges and continuous professional and personal development.

Title: Dataanalytiker og BI-rapportudvikler
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Det uforløste potentiale for datainformeret beslutningsstøtte i den primære sundhedssektor er stort. Hos KiAP har vi derfor brug for dig til at hjælpe os med at skabe øgede muligheder for kvalitetsudviklingen i almen praksis. Brænder du for at bruge dine evner indenfor dataanalyse, dataforståelse, og datarapportering til at understøtte kvalitetsudviklingen hos de praktiserende læger, er det dig, vi har brug for!




Ansvarsområder

Som vores nye kollega kommer du til at arbejde på en bred vifte af projekter, der berører alt lige fra multimorbiditet over behandlingen af hjerte- og diabetespatienter, til håndteringen af personer med demens eller antibiotikaresistens, samt brugen af antipsykotika. Du kan dermed forvente en alsidig og varieret arbejdsdag i berøring med nogle af de mest aktuelle sundhedsfaglige emner.

Generelt kan dog siges, at det overordnede mål for KiAP’s arbejde, og dermed også denne stilling, er at skabe fundamentet for en øget behandlingskvalitet hos Danmarks praktiserende læger gennem udviklingen af databaserede software og analyser.




Kvalifikationer

For at understøtte Kvalitetsplatformen og KiAPs øvrige produktportefølje, har vi brug for en kollega med kendskab til, motivation for og/eller erfaring med at:

·        Udarbejde tilgængelige og indsigtsgivende BI rapporter

·        Arbejde med datamodeller og semantiske lag under de brugerhenvendte rapporter

·        Vedligeholde stamdata, som er nødvendige for meningsfuld rapportering

·        Automatisere og løbende optimere BI-rapporter for at effektivisere driften af løsninger

·        Formidle komplekse emner på en let forståelig måde til slutbrugere og samarbejdspartnere




Bemærk, at al sundhedsfagligt arbejde foregår på dansk hvorfor gode sprogkundskaber i dansk er nødvendigt.




Vil du vide mere

Du kan læse mere om KiAP og vores arbejde med sundhedsdata på www.kiap.dk. Har du spørgsmål til jobbet kan IT Drifts- og Udviklingschef Jan Kristensen (tlf. 40 45 67 85 e-mail jankristensen@kiap.dk) eller datakonsulent Kasper B. Schmidt (tlf. 23 49 34 73 e-mail: kbschmidt@kiap.dk) kontaktes.

Se den fulde stillingsbeskrivelse: www.kiap.dk/om/stillinger/stillinger.php




Ansøgning

Ansøgningsfristen er mandag d. 15. september 2025 kl. 12.00. Der indkaldes løbende til samtaler.

Ansøgning og CV sendes til sekretaeren@kiap.dk.

Show more

Ansøgning og CV sendes til sekretaeren@kiap.dk.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Azure Data Engineer




Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses og MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi bruger teknologier som Databricks, Fabric, Spark, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory og Azure Synapse. Vi søger profiler med erfaring inden for enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som vil bygge innovative dataløsninger.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.




Hvilken rolle får du?




Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.




Din rolle bliver at




rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code, fx. Terraform
fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Du har en videregående uddannelse i software engineering, human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU samt erfaring i data engineering
Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring, kan skrive Python og har lyst til data engineering-delen - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
Du har erfaring med - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Spark - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling




Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere




Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.




Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.




Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.




Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Hvis du har under 5 års erfaring, bedes du også vedhæfte dine karakterblade i samme fil som dit CV. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Show more

Title: Go-To-Market Analyst (UK, full-time, Copenhagen-based)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
🥞 About ‘All Gravy’

The next generation of employees are used to apps like Instagram, TikTok and Spotify in their personal life - but when they go to work at a restaurant chain or retail store, they’re met with software created before they were born.

We are modernising the tools for frontline employees and transforming the experience into one that is engaging and motivating; making their lives easier - from getting paid to developing their careers.

We’re innovating on the whole employee journey: from being recruited, onboarded, growing skills, knowing when to work, and connecting with co-workers.

We've grown 330% over the last year and are looking to accelerate further. We already work with some of the most exciting brands in the Nordics and the UK (Pizza Pilgrims, Honest Burgers, Ottolenghi, Dishoom, Wahaca, Q8, 7-Eleven, Best Western) and we're now expanding even more into the United Kingdom.

We're backed by some of Europe’s leading investors (Moonfire, Scale Capital, Nordic Makers, Upfin, Founders, Nordic Web Ventures) and Angels (Bradley Horowitz (GP, Wisdom Ventures), Terese Hougaard (Partner, Atomico), Phil Chambers (CEO, Peakon).

Who are we?

We are passionate, have an ambitious mission, and our users love us! ♥️

And this is just the beginning. The best is yet to come, and we hope to bring you on board to achieve this mission together. We are a fun and hard-working team that is looking for passionate professionals to join our mission. Join us to shape the future for shift & gig workers 🚀

🤩 The role: GTM Analyst

We are looking for a Go-To-Market Analyst for our UK market, full-time.

You are likely early in your career and want a full-time position that will give you a great boost in your professional development.

You’ll be responsible for business development, including outbound emailing / calling (i.e., cold canvassing) and creating partnerships to drive opportunities.

You'll work mostly on the UK market but might also target other countries.

The sales team has grown significantly over the past 12 months and is already filled with talented and ambitious people - one is a former Olympic medallist, others have previously founded startups. You’ll be part of this journey and help shape an incredible, sales-focused culture across the company.

😎 The job and responsibilities

Daily activities include:


Pipeline Generation:
Sourcing leads and researching new prospects to target
Reaching out to these leads with a multi-channel approach (think LinkedIn, phone, e-mails) - note that phone is a key ingredient here
Generating qualified meetings for the commercial team
Ensuring a smooth handover process from you to AE
Using the best-in-class tools for creative prospecting
Attending the meetings you are booking, together with the AE, for a steep learning curve


All Gravy is undergoing high growth; hence the job and responsibilities will develop over time, and there will be plenty of opportunities for you to learn and grow.

Who are you?

You have great energy, a good sense of humour & you love to hit targets. You should enjoy working in the dynamic startup environment, like to make sales happen and be a team player.

We look for employees who like being part of a team, are real team players, and have a mindset of learning & growing.

We expect you to:


Speak and write English fluently
Have some sales experience or the willingness to get into an outbound sales environment (and be able to communicate why!)
Nice to have: B2B sales experience within SAAS / software sales
Be ambitious - you love hitting targets and are able to self-motivate!
Be bold - you’re not afraid to pick up the phone to get to tell people about All Gravy
Have excellent communication skills
Have a good sense of humour - be willing to contribute to this being a fun place to work
Be excited about building a big company from a small starting point, and want to grow personally on the way there


We are in the midst of building an awesome company and can't wait to onboard you - therefore we will hire the right candidate as soon as we find him/her.

💡 Even if you do not tick every box on this page, you might be the perfect fit for the job! We treasure our learning culture and encourage all humble people to apply!

💎 What we offer

We are a motivated, young, and dynamic team working closely together on our mission – at the moment, we are 35 people and cannot wait to welcome the next person to the team!

We have fun together while collaborating to create a product people love and aspire to be the best place to work.

We have all the perks you’d expect from a startup - lunches, lots of social events (padel tournaments, dinners, wine-tastings, strategy offsites, you name it!), fussball table, a stocked fridge with snacks & drinks, and a regular Friday bar!
Show more
HTML:
🥞 About ‘All Gravy’

The next generation of employees are used to apps like Instagram, TikTok and Spotify in their personal life - but when they go to work at a restaurant chain or retail store, they’re met with software created before they were born.

We are modernising the tools for frontline employees and transforming the experience into one that is engaging and motivating; making their lives easier - from getting paid to developing their careers.

We’re innovating on the whole employee journey: from being recruited, onboarded, growing skills, knowing when to work, and connecting with co-workers.

We've grown 330% over the last year and are looking to accelerate further. We already work with some of the most exciting brands in the Nordics and the UK (Pizza Pilgrims, Honest Burgers, Ottolenghi, Dishoom, Wahaca, Q8, 7-Eleven, Best Western) and we're now expanding even more into the United Kingdom.

We're backed by some of Europe’s leading investors (Moonfire, Scale Capital, Nordic Makers, Upfin, Founders, Nordic Web Ventures) and Angels (Bradley Horowitz (GP, Wisdom Ventures), Terese Hougaard (Partner, Atomico), Phil Chambers (CEO, Peakon).

Who are we?

We are passionate, have an ambitious mission, and our users love us! ♥️

And this is just the beginning. The best is yet to come, and we hope to bring you on board to achieve this mission together. We are a fun and hard-working team that is looking for passionate professionals to join our mission. Join us to shape the future for shift & gig workers 🚀

🤩 The role: GTM Analyst

We are looking for a Go-To-Market Analyst for our UK market, full-time.

You are likely early in your career and want a full-time position that will give you a great boost in your professional development.

You’ll be responsible for business development, including outbound emailing / calling (i.e., cold canvassing) and creating partnerships to drive opportunities.

You'll work mostly on the UK market but might also target other countries.

The sales team has grown significantly over the past 12 months and is already filled with talented and ambitious people - one is a former Olympic medallist, others have previously founded startups. You’ll be part of this journey and help shape an incredible, sales-focused culture across the company.

😎 The job and responsibilities

Daily activities include:

  • Pipeline Generation:
    • Sourcing leads and researching new prospects to target
    • Reaching out to these leads with a multi-channel approach (think LinkedIn, phone, e-mails) - note that phone is a key ingredient here
    • Generating qualified meetings for the commercial team
    • Ensuring a smooth handover process from you to AE
    • Using the best-in-class tools for creative prospecting
  • Attending the meetings you are booking, together with the AE, for a steep learning curve

All Gravy is undergoing high growth; hence the job and responsibilities will develop over time, and there will be plenty of opportunities for you to learn and grow.

Who are you?

You have great energy, a good sense of humour & you love to hit targets. You should enjoy working in the dynamic startup environment, like to make sales happen and be a team player.

We look for employees who like being part of a team, are real team players, and have a mindset of learning & growing.

We expect you to:

  • Speak and write English fluently
  • Have some sales experience or the willingness to get into an outbound sales environment (and be able to communicate why!)
  • Nice to have: B2B sales experience within SAAS / software sales
  • Be ambitious - you love hitting targets and are able to self-motivate!
  • Be bold - you’re not afraid to pick up the phone to get to tell people about All Gravy
  • Have excellent communication skills
  • Have a good sense of humour - be willing to contribute to this being a fun place to work
  • Be excited about building a big company from a small starting point, and want to grow personally on the way there

We are in the midst of building an awesome company and can't wait to onboard you - therefore we will hire the right candidate as soon as we find him/her.

💡 Even if you do not tick every box on this page, you might be the perfect fit for the job! We treasure our learning culture and encourage all humble people to apply!

💎 What we offer

We are a motivated, young, and dynamic team working closely together on our mission – at the moment, we are 35 people and cannot wait to welcome the next person to the team!

We have fun together while collaborating to create a product people love and aspire to be the best place to work.

We have all the perks you’d expect from a startup - lunches, lots of social events (padel tournaments, dinners, wine-tastings, strategy offsites, you name it!), fussball table, a stocked fridge with snacks & drinks, and a regular Friday bar!

Title: Student Analyst, Data & Sustainability, Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Urban Partners we believe that ‘powering the progress of cities and citizens’ is our opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable and equitable world. We do this by investing in assets, companies, technologies, and solutions. 

Becoming our new Student Analyst in the Sustainability team, you will have a unique opportunity to support Urban Partners in managing climate risks and opportunities. If you get energy from working for an internationally growing company and want to be part of making a difference, you may be our new team member.

The team

You will become a part of our Sustainability Team of 10 people, and you will support the team in analysing climate risk and opportunities, work on projects that decarbonize and improve the sustainability of urban ecosystems across our investment strategies.

We are a place where people truly work together as a team, valuing each other’s differences and the importance of each and every team member. Professional and personal development is something we give high priority, and with us you will develop by receiving and giving feedback from colleagues and by sparring with your team members. You will be a part of a powerhouse of brilliant and caring people raising the bar for the industry.

The position

Responsibilities

We expect that you can work about 15-20 hours per week with the opportunity to be flexible during exams. You will be supporting the company’s industry-leading sustainability professionals with primary responsibilities including:


Data analysis within transitional & physical climate risk
Research & development within decentral renewable energy solutions
Supporting strategic work within decarbonization roadmaps and action plans
Supporting GHG management & reporting aligned with leading standards such as SBTi


Qualifications

We expect that you are a 3rd or 4th year Bachelor's or Master’s student within economics, finance, data science, renewable energy or, similar, with excellent grades. You are interested in climate data management and business development and have strong communication skills and analytical capabilities. Besides, we hope that you are/have:


Skilled in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint. Experience with Power BI is preferred
Fluent in English
A strategic thinker that can navigate in high-complexity
A self-driven team-player
Highly organized and able to monitor and process many “moving parts” in a structured and effective manner (e.g., across several touchpoints with partners, managing and prioritizing inbound questions and requests)
Curious constant learner. Knowledge within renewable energy / sustainability is preferred, and interest in the area is required
Positive person that appreciates humor in the team
Some work or volunteer experience. Relevant work experience is a plus but not a requirement


What We Offer


Make a difference by helping create urban spaces and places that enrich people’s lives in the most sustainable way
Lead the industry with an innovator that is pioneering new approaches while raising standards and inspiring the industry
Learn and grow as part of a powerhouse of brilliant people where teamwork, feedback and different ways of thinking are at the core
Be your whole self in a purpose-driven culture with a strong sense of belonging, based on trust, celebration and caring for each other


Join Us

If you are interested, please let us know more about you as soon as possible, and no later than 1st of September 2025.
Show more
