Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Do you want to be part of shaping the future of fashion? BESTSELLER is looking for a talented and dynamic individual to join our AI Fashion Planning team as a Business Analyst.

Become a part of our mission to drive data-driven fashion innovation. Your key to success in this role is your passion for supply chain planning and your ability to understand our planners' processes and their ways of working to ensure new technology can be embedded and taken up by them. 

YOUR TEAM

By joining our AI Fashion Planning team, you will be at the forefront of developing state-of-the-art AI solutions for some of BESTSELLER’s most strategically important projects within demand planning and inventory optimisation.

You will join a cross-functional group of data scientists, product specialists and stakeholders – all working together to embed AI solutions that create measurable value in our business.

YOUR ROLE

As our Business Analyst you will focus on ensuring that AI products developed by the team are fully embedded in user workflows, driving adoption and value realization.

Furthermore, your tasks will include:


Designing next-level planning processes and solutions in close collaboration with data scientists and planners.
Facilitating change management processes for our AI solutions across the organization.
Driving data analysis and help derive key metrics for product improvement.
Supporting the team and stakeholders with demand planning and inventory management expertise and knowledge of best practices.
Creating visualizations, dashboards, and presentations to support data-driven decisions.


Your Benefits


You will be working in one of the world’s largest fast fashion companies, and our AI Fashion Planning team is at the forefront of innovation.
We believe in empowering our team members to explore new ideas, solve complex challenges, and make a real impact.
You will be part of a vibrant, supportive environment with passionate colleagues and plenty of opportunities to grow your career.


YOUR PROFILE

You are a self-driven, analytical thinker with excellent communication skills. You thrive on working with both people and processes and have a strong desire to make an impact through tech. This role is perfect for someone with real-life experience as a planner and supply chain specialist and a passion for driving data-driven decision-making combined with expertise in change management. 

Furthermore, you need the following qualifications:


Experience in driving product adoption within user communities.
A good understanding of data analysis, with the ability to interpret and present insights.
Strong communication skills with the ability to bridge the gap between technical teams and business stakeholders.


We look forward to hearing from you

If you’re excited by the opportunity to shape the future of fashion through AI, we’d love to hear from you! Apply today and join us on our journey to transform the industry.

If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to reach out to Jakob Blaavand on +45 21 68 49 41. Otherwise, please send us your application as soon as possible and no later than 15 September 2025.  We review applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we find the right candidate. 

Location: Aarhus, Denmark

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 400 people strong, located in Denmark, Spain and Rwanda. We are excited about what we do, but there’s more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.
Show more

Title: IT-specialist
Place: Haderslev Municipality, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vi søger en Governance- og IT-specialist - med blik for både sikkerhed og mennesker




Hos os bliver du ikke bare “IT-sikkerheds- og GDPR-ansvarlig” – du bliver en del af PUMA, som står for Projekter, Udvikling, Medarbejdere og Assistance.

Det betyder, at du kommer til at arbejde tæt sammen med kolleger på tværs af hele organisationen – og være med til at skabe rammer, der gør vores hverdag både tryg, effektiv og inspirerende.




Hvad går jobbet ud på?

·        Holde styr på vores IT-sikkerhed, GDPR og beredskab

·        Rådgive ledelsen og bidrage til gode beslutninger

·        Udvikle governance-strukturer, der virker i praksis

·        Drive de løbende processer indenfor styrket beredskab og IT-sikkerhed på tværs af organisationen

·        Bidrage med teknisk indsigt, f.eks. i opsætning af sikkerhedsværktøjer, systemintegration og overvågning

·        Samarbejder med vores OT-, IT- og netværksleverandører

·        Assistere vores selvstyrende teams til bl.a. at arbejde med effektiv udnyttelse af data

·        Formidle vigtige emner på en enkel og forståelig måde – både på møder og foran kolleger

·        Samarbejde tæt med de to andre PUMA’er som bl.a. har ansvarsområderne; teknik, leverandørkontakt, HR




Hvem er du?

·        Du har en relevant uddannelse og en solid forståelse for IT-sikkerhed og GDPR

·        Du kan oversætte it-teknisk sprog til dagligdags dansk – og omvendt

·        Du trives med frihed under ansvar og tænker i “vi” frem for “jeg”

·        Du kan skabe tillid og bygge relationer på tværs af hele huset

·        Du er tryg ved at stå foran en forsamling og kan engagere dine kolleger, når vigtige emner skal præsenteres

·        Du trives i en rolle, hvor du både er rådgiver, facilitere og også selv får fingrene ned i det tekniske




Hvad får du hos os?

·        En central rolle, hvor din indsats kan mærkes

·        En kultur med ærlighed, respekt og selvstyring

·        Åbent arbejdsmiljø med korte beslutningsveje og engagerede kolleger

·        Plads til at du kan udvikle dig både fagligt og personligt

·        Tæt samarbejde med ledelsen og stabsfunktionen – og en plads i PUMA, hvor vi løfter i flok

Show more

Title: Student Assistant for Netcompanys IT Security Team
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Do you find Threat Hunting, Threat Intelligence, SIEM and EDR exciting, and do you want to be a deciding factor in IT Security in our internal as well as our customer’s environments? As a Student Assistant you ensure operations can perform their security-related tasks based on guidelines you help define.

Tasks and Technologies

As a Student Assistant you will be a part of Netcompany Operations and our dedicated security team consisting of skilled and committed colleagues. You will take part in defining how Denmark’s most ambitious IT company host solutions for critical Danish infrastructure and large international customers. You will encounter everything from identifying improvements to monitoring of servers and applications, optimising detection mechanisms and response thereof, advising colleagues about alerts as well as adjusting security tools.

You will be a trusted advisor for Netcompany’s delivery and project teams regarding how to solve security-related tasks.

Your Primary Responsibilities Involve


Investigating patterns and implementing alerts and visualisations in our SIEM to ensure detection of suspicious events.
Responding to and follow up on alerts generated by our SIEM and EDR solutions, including adjusting these to ensure precision.
Configuring integrations between our SIEM and other systems and environments, including Cloud and containers.
Configuring and monitoring our IDS/IPS solutions.


About You

We are seeking students, that can work approximately 16 hours a week. We are of course flexible in exam periods, but we also expect you to be flexible in times of need.

We Imagine That You


Have experience with both Windows and Linux and have knowledge with SIEM or EDR solutions.
Are enthusiastic about IT Security and aim to deliver high quality.
Understand security in networks, endpoints as well as architecturally.
Keep yourself updated with the global threat landscape and can use this knowledge for mitigation and detection.


It is a requirement for the position that you can be approved for PET security clearance.

Continue developing with us

At Netcompany, we focus on your personal and professional development.

We support you in your development and in reaching your goals. You will be included in projects equally with your colleagues and have the chance to take on responsibility from day one.

We offer a strong collegial community where you will work closely with your team who supports you both in task completion and in your development in the role. The close relationship with your colleagues and leader in everyday work helps to ensure the well-being of each employee and gives you concrete insights into the many different career opportunities as you build your experience.

Join an inclusive community

At Netcompany, we highly prioritise an inclusive community. We actively promote an open and welcoming work culture based on collaboration and mutual trust, where there is always an opportunity for sparring.

As part of our culture and values, all employees, regardless of background, identity, and experience, are met with understanding and respect and given equal opportunities for development and well-being.

As we are an international company with offices in many countries, you will have the opportunity to learn and collaborate internationally with colleagues from across the world. We offer a shared environment where we engage with each other across departments and projects. Additionally, we have a wide range of social and professional events that provide you with the best opportunities to expand and build a network early in your career. 

Send us your application

Upload your resume and a motivational letter to our recruitment system via the link. If you have unanswered questions, feel free to write to hr.dk@netcompany.com.

All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply regardless of gender, gender expression, sexuality, disability, age, religion and belief, political views, nationality, ethnicity, or social background.

We are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse environment. Our recruitment processes are based on individual merit. If you require any reasonable adjustments or additional support during the interview process, please email our responsible recruiters at reasonableadjustments@netcompany.com for assistance.
Show more

Title: Go-To-Market Analyst (UK, full-time, Copenhagen-based)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
🥞 About ‘All Gravy’

The next generation of employees are used to apps like Instagram, TikTok and Spotify in their personal life - but when they go to work at a restaurant chain or retail store, they’re met with software created before they were born.

We are modernising the tools for frontline employees and transforming the experience into one that is engaging and motivating; making their lives easier - from getting paid to developing their careers.

We’re innovating on the whole employee journey: from being recruited, onboarded, growing skills, knowing when to work, and connecting with co-workers.

We've grown 330% over the last year and are looking to accelerate further. We already work with some of the most exciting brands in the Nordics and the UK (Pizza Pilgrims, Honest Burgers, Ottolenghi, Dishoom, Wahaca, Q8, 7-Eleven, Best Western) and we're now expanding even more into the United Kingdom.

We're backed by some of Europe’s leading investors (Moonfire, Scale Capital, Nordic Makers, Upfin, Founders, Nordic Web Ventures) and Angels (Bradley Horowitz (GP, Wisdom Ventures), Terese Hougaard (Partner, Atomico), Phil Chambers (CEO, Peakon).

Who are we?

We are passionate, have an ambitious mission, and our users love us! ♥️

And this is just the beginning. The best is yet to come, and we hope to bring you on board to achieve this mission together. We are a fun and hard-working team that is looking for passionate professionals to join our mission. Join us to shape the future for shift & gig workers 🚀

🤩 The role: GTM Analyst

We are looking for a Go-To-Market Analyst for our UK market, full-time.

You are likely early in your career and want a full-time position that will give you a great boost in your professional development.

You’ll be responsible for business development, including outbound emailing / calling (i.e., cold canvassing) and creating partnerships to drive opportunities.

You'll work mostly on the UK market but might also target other countries.

The sales team has grown significantly over the past 12 months and is already filled with talented and ambitious people - one is a former Olympic medallist, others have previously founded startups. You’ll be part of this journey and help shape an incredible, sales-focused culture across the company.

😎 The job and responsibilities

Daily Activities Include


Pipeline Generation:
Sourcing leads and researching new prospects to target
Reaching out to these leads with a multi-channel approach (think LinkedIn, phone, e-mails) - note that phone is a key ingredient here
Generating qualified meetings for the commercial team
Ensuring a smooth handover process from you to AE
Using the best-in-class tools for creative prospecting
Attending the meetings you are booking, together with the AE, for a steep learning curve

All Gravy is undergoing high growth; hence the job and responsibilities will develop over time, and there will be plenty of opportunities for you to learn and grow.

Who are you?

You have great energy, a good sense of humour & you love to hit targets. You should enjoy working in the dynamic startup environment, like to make sales happen and be a team player.

We look for employees who like being part of a team, are real team players, and have a mindset of learning & growing.

We Expect You To


Speak and write English fluently
Have some sales experience or the willingness to get into an outbound sales environment (and be able to communicate why!)
Nice to have: B2B sales experience within SAAS / software sales
Be ambitious - you love hitting targets and are able to self-motivate!
Be bold - you’re not afraid to pick up the phone to get to tell people about All Gravy
Have excellent communication skills
Have a good sense of humour - be willing to contribute to this being a fun place to work
Be excited about building a big company from a small starting point, and want to grow personally on the way there


We are in the midst of building an awesome company and can't wait to onboard you - therefore we will hire the right candidate as soon as we find him/her.

💡 Even if you do not tick every box on this page, you might be the perfect fit for the job! We treasure our learning culture and encourage all humble people to apply!

💎 What we offer

We are a motivated, young, and dynamic team working closely together on our mission – at the moment, we are 35 people and cannot wait to welcome the next person to the team!

We have fun together while collaborating to create a product people love and aspire to be the best place to work.

We have all the perks you’d expect from a startup - lunches, lots of social events (padel tournaments, dinners, wine-tastings, strategy offsites, you name it!), fussball table, a stocked fridge with snacks & drinks, and a regular Friday bar!
Show more

We are a motivated, young, and dynamic team working closely together on our mission – at the moment, we are 35 people and cannot wait to welcome the next person to the team!

We have all the perks you’d expect from a startup - lunches, lots of social events (padel tournaments, dinners, wine-tastings, strategy offsites, you name it!), fussball table, a stocked fridge with snacks & drinks, and a regular Friday bar!

Title: Data Analyst - Maternity Cover (7 months)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Scheduling isn't simply filling shifts. It's finding the sweet spot that enables businesses to grow and team members to enjoy the perfect work/life balance.






At Planday from Xero, we aim to use Agentic AI to build a future where managers can seamlessly free up invaluable time for their business and teams. We're not just building software: we're on a mission to make shift work more human, to change work/life balance from a luxury to a reality for all shift workers. We're using advanced technology to help humans reach their full potential. At work and in life.






Founded in 2004, Planday is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark and helps create perfect schedules for hundreds of thousands of users across the world.






As a Data Analyst, you'll be reporting directly to our Head of Data & Analytics and will play a strategic role in transforming complex data into actionable insights that directly fuel our business growth and critical decisions.


You'll craft compelling data narratives, turning raw information into valuable assets that guide product development and key strategic choices.


Collaborating across teams, you'll uncover pivotal metrics and deep customer insights, empowering informed decisions throughout Planday. Through impactful visualizations and persuasive communication, you'll ensure these insights resonate with stakeholders at all levels.


Furthermore, you'll leverage advanced analytical techniques to pioneer predictive modeling and automation, fostering a culture of data-driven innovation that is central to Planday's continued success.






This role is a maternity cover role for about 7 months.







What you'll do

Collaborate cross-functionally with product, commercial, and leadership teams to define, track, and report critical metrics, delivering comprehensive customer insights.
Design and maintain robust data models that transform raw data into high-value assets, ensuring accuracy and quality.
Develop impactful, hands-on solutions, visualizations, and dashboards across the business, primarily utilizing Tableau to communicate insights effectively.
Leverage proficiency in Python, R, and SQL for advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and ensuring high data quality.
Apply advanced statistical analysis techniques for summarizing, interpreting, and predicting data, alongside machine learning concepts for predictive modeling techniques.
Translate complex data into clear, actionable narratives through compelling data storytelling, impactful presentations, and strong interpersonal communication.
During your time with us we’re expecting key projects to include: Product-Market-Fit analysis, customer lifecycle insights, as well as supporting product teams.







Success looks like

Exceptional data models that consistently deliver accurate, high-quality data assets, underpinning strategic initiatives.
Proactive delivery of actionable insights and critical metrics that directly lead to informed decisions and tangible business improvements for product and commercial teams.
Development and implementation of intuitive and highly impactful visualizations and dashboards that significantly elevate data-driven decision-making across Planday.
Insights and recommendations that are consistently trusted and acted upon by product and commercial teams, stemming from rigorous analysis and robust data practices.
Clear and compelling communication of complex data insights, fostering understanding and alignment among stakeholders, resulting in measurable positive business impact.
Proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking in addressing data-related challenges, leading to continuous improvement and advancement in our analytical capabilities.
Successful exploration and implementation of advanced analytical techniques, including machine learning, to unlock new opportunities and generate groundbreaking insights.







What you'll bring with you

Proven experience in Python, R, and advanced SQL (including window functions, CTEs) for advanced data management and statistical analysis.
Proficiency in crafting compelling data stories, leveraging visualization tools like Tableau to transform complex datasets into clear, impactful visualizations that resonate with diverse stakeholders.
Proven capability in product opportunity sizing, metric development, and building robust metric trees to guide product strategy and evaluation.
Demonstrated ability to lead and optimize data wrangling and cleaning processes across multiple, complex projects.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into compelling narratives through data storytelling and high-impact presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
A highly analytical mindset, consistently identifying and solving complex data challenges with innovative solutions that directly drive data-driven strategic decisions.
Practical application of machine learning fundamentals to solve specific business problems through predictive modeling.







At Planday, we offer you

Benefits like pension, health insurance and generous vacation
Flexible remote work
Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities
Meaningful work – everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe
Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities







Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.






At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.






As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.


All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Excel, Power BI
Description:
Data Analyst - Excel, Power BI

Data Analyst - Excel, Power BI




The location of the role is Paddington, London (hybrid working).

The duration of the contract is 8 months.

The pay rate on offer is £300 - £350 per day (via Umbrella agency).




The client is a multinational high-street retailer.

Business area: Food Packaging




Key accountabilities and measures

Provide analytical support and reports based on data research and analysis to the Compliance Team to drive data consistency and accuracy
Resolve commercial and technical queries for all stakeholders and provide appropriate commentary to ensure clarity on root cause and avoid any reoccurrence
Deliver efficient analytical reports and insights through data research and analysis to support the Compliance Team in driving data submissions accuracy
Effective co-ordination of data gathering processes to ensure alignment with external and internal reporting requirements
Collate and maintain data reports within agreed standards
Liaise internally and externally with departments, suppliers, and compliance agencies
Ensure timely transfer of raw sales data and packaging information from different business areas
Assist compliance team with data verification for reporting and ensuring data declarations completed and submitted to schedule
Monitor and audit data quality and report any issues to key stakeholders
Identify problems and recommend solutions to improve the processes and ways or working.
Ongoing training to confidently work with the business’ systems GMOR, SAP, PLM, FIND, Business objects, etc.
Resolve administrative problems and inquiries with reporting from the compliance agencies
Prepare written responses to routine enquiries
Raise any system issue logs with Tech support and ensure resolution the completion
Raise Purchase Orders and maintain the Compliance Invoicing tracker for the function.




Key skills and experience

Excellent knowledge and practical skills of Excel (PivotTables, VLOOKUP) and other Microsoft Office programs - Power BI
Ability to simultaneously manage, prioritise and deliver multiple projects/priorities on time
Strong delivery focus with great attention to detail, routine process, and completion of tasks.
Commitment to continuous improvement of digital and data skills
Confident and professional verbal and written communication skills
Takes initiative and comfortable working autonomously
Ability to initiate and build strong relationships with own team, across functions and channels

Show more

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
Kennedys is looking for a Reporting Analyst to join our Business Intelligence team, based in our Chelmsford office, and will be required to utilise in depth Excel knowledge to ensure client reporting is produced efficiently and accurately.

Team


Kennedys Business Intelligence team is responsible for delivering valued business intelligence to key clients and a senior internal audience.

The team is comprised of Reporting Analysts and Specialists, Business Analysts and Insight & Technical Analysts who monitor and report key metrics to demonstrate insights to the business.

Our Business Intelligence team is based in London and Chelmsford.

Key Responsibilities



Utilise in depth knowledge of Excel to ensure client reporting is produced efficiently and accurately
Ensure reports are delivered to a high standard, on time and to the requirement of the contract
Champion the importance of data quality, and work towards the vison of the Kennedy's Client Reporting and Insight team being deemed as Industry best.



Required Experience



Mental agility
Analytical skills
Attention to detail.



Please let us know if you require any additional support or adjustments to be made in order to submit your application to Kennedys.

*where a level of experience is indicated, this is a guideline only and represents the amount of time we would usually expect a candidate to accumulate the requisite level of experience. This does not preclude applications from candidates with more or less experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Status: 6 month Fixed Term Contract

Reports to: Global Payroll Manager

Works with: Finance Team

Job Purpose

Finance team: The role is to support the payroll team in managing and improving data quality, reconciliation and reporting during a period of high operational demand. The role is essential for ensuring accurate payroll reporting, supporting the rollout of a Global Payroll Provider and preparing for upcoming compliance requirements.




Principal accountabilities

Data Cleansing & Validation

Clean, structure, and validate large payroll data to ensure accuracy and consistency (both for current operations and during the roll out of the Global Payroll provider).
Identify and correct anomalies in payroll and accounting data
Collaborate with Payroll, HR and Finance teams to ensure data alignment, particularly within the HiBob platform.

Reconciliations

Perform regular reconciliations between payroll records and general ledger accounts.
Investigate and resolve discrepancies in payroll transactions and accounting entries.

Budget & Variance Analysis, Reporting

Assist in preparing payroll-related budget forecasts.
Analyse actual payroll costs against budgeted figures and explain variances.
Provide monthly variance reports with actionable insights.
Maintain year-to-date payroll reports and audit packs.
Support audits and compliance checks with accurate data and documentation.
Respond to ad hoc data requests from senior management and external auditors.
Assist in preparing data and reports for the mandatory payrolling of Benefits in Kind (BiKs) starting April 2026.
Process optimisation - Identify inefficiencies in workflows and streamline payroll processes

UAT Testing – Global Payroll Project

Lead testing and reconciliation during parallel runs for the Global Payroll Provider rollout.

Skills And Attributes

Proven experience in data analysis within payroll or finance.
Strong Excel and data manipulation skills; experience with HiBob is a plus.
Familiarity with payroll systems, accounting principles, and compliance requirements.
Analytical mindset with attention to detail.
Ability to work collaboratively across departments.
Experience supporting audits and compliance processes is desirable.
Strong communication and documentation skills.




Essential

Qualifications and experience

Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions (e.g. pivot tables, lookups, data validation).
Experience working with large datasets and performing data cleansing, transformation and validation.
Solid understanding of payroll processes, accounting principles, and financial reconciliations.
Familiarity with HRIS and payroll systems (e.g. HiBob, Moorepay, Papaya, Justworks or similar platforms).
Demonstrated ability to produce clear, accurate and insightful reports for stakeholders.
Experience supporting audits and compliance reporting.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across departments.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.




Preferred

Experience working within a global or multi-country payroll environment.
Experience participating in system implementations or UAT testing phases.
Ability to document processes and create user-friendly guides




Application Closing Date: 22nd August 2025

Please note that while we have a closing date for this application, we reserve the right to interview candidates and potentially close the role early should we find a suitable candidate before the closing date.




Help shape the future of reporting for global financial markets

The IFRS Foundation is a public interest, not-for profit organisation that sets corporate reporting standards for the capital markets globally. IFRS Accounting Standards are required for use by more than 140 countries whilst IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards are rapidly becoming the global baseline for sustainability disclosures worldwide.

We are a highly diverse and inclusive organisation. Our 350+ staff come from more than 45+ different countries and are united in supporting the mission of the Foundation to bring transparency, accountability and efficiency to capital markets worldwide. With offices in London, Frankfurt, Montreal, Tokyo, Beijing and San Francisco, the Foundation is truly a global standard-setter.

Show more

  • Support audits and compliance checks with accurate data and documentation.
  • Respond to ad hoc data requests from senior management and external auditors.
  • Assist in preparing data and reports for the mandatory payrolling of Benefits in Kind (BiKs) starting April 2026.
  • Process optimisation - Identify inefficiencies in workflows and streamline payroll processes

UAT Testing – Global Payroll Project

  • Lead testing and reconciliation during parallel runs for the Global Payroll Provider rollout.

Skills And Attributes

  • Proven experience in data analysis within payroll or finance.
  • Strong Excel and data manipulation skills; experience with HiBob is a plus.
  • Familiarity with payroll systems, accounting principles, and compliance requirements.
  • Analytical mindset with attention to detail.
  • Ability to work collaboratively across departments.
  • Experience supporting audits and compliance processes is desirable.
  • Strong communication and documentation skills.


Essential

Qualifications and experience

  • Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions (e.g. pivot tables, lookups, data validation).
  • Experience working with large datasets and performing data cleansing, transformation and validation.
  • Solid understanding of payroll processes, accounting principles, and financial reconciliations.
  • Familiarity with HRIS and payroll systems (e.g. HiBob, Moorepay, Papaya, Justworks or similar platforms).
  • Demonstrated ability to produce clear, accurate and insightful reports for stakeholders.
  • Experience supporting audits and compliance reporting.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across departments.
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.


Preferred

  • Experience working within a global or multi-country payroll environment.
  • Experience participating in system implementations or UAT testing phases.
  • Ability to document processes and create user-friendly guides


Application Closing Date: 22nd August 2025

Please note that while we have a closing date for this application, we reserve the right to interview candidates and potentially close the role early should we find a suitable candidate before the closing date.


Help shape the future of reporting for global financial markets

The IFRS Foundation is a public interest, not-for profit organisation that sets corporate reporting standards for the capital markets globally. IFRS Accounting Standards are required for use by more than 140 countries whilst IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards are rapidly becoming the global baseline for sustainability disclosures worldwide.

We are a highly diverse and inclusive organisation. Our 350+ staff come from more than 45+ different countries and are united in supporting the mission of the Foundation to bring transparency, accountability and efficiency to capital markets worldwide. With offices in London, Frankfurt, Montreal, Tokyo, Beijing and San Francisco, the Foundation is truly a global standard-setter.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Junior Data Analyst

Location: London, UK (Hybrid)

Salary: £35k–£40k (DOE)




Are you a detail-driven analyst with a passion for data and automation? Join a specialist investment firm that partners with some of the most exciting high-growth software companies across Europe and the US. In this dynamic role, you’ll play a critical part in streamlining data-driven workflows and powering smarter investment decisions through innovative tech.




This is an exciting opportunity for an early-career analyst to join a growing Data & Research function that sits at the heart of the firm’s investment strategy. You'll be part of a high-impact team driving digital transformation and working with modern tools to improve processes, insights, and decision-making.




Your Responsibilities:

Build and enhance data pipelines: Help design and maintain proprietary automation systems that support investment strategy.
Improve internal platforms: Collaborate on projects to streamline workflows and eliminate manual processes using modern tooling.
Deliver high-quality insights: Monitor key data metrics and trends to support investment research and decision-making.
Ensure data integrity: Validate and enrich datasets to maintain accuracy, completeness, and consistency across internal platforms.
Evaluate tools and vendors: Assist in reviewing and optimising external data providers and technical solutions.
Contribute to innovation: Continuously explore opportunities to improve systems through experimentation, automation, and modern engineering practices.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in a STEM or data-oriented field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Economics.
A meticulous attention to detail and passion for accurate, high-quality data.
Interest in data automation and how technology enables smarter decision-making.
Exposure to or willingness to learn tools like Python, SQL, Zapier, n8n, or similar.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while delivering at pace.
Strong communication skills to collaborate across teams and share insights clearly with non-technical stakeholders.
A curiosity-driven mindset and eagerness to learn new technologies and data tools.




It's A Bonus If You Have:

Experience with Google Cloud Platform, APIs, or GitHub.
Familiarity with structured data entry, validation processes, or workflow automation.
A genuine interest in private equity, venture capital, or financial technology.




The Benefits:

Join a mission-driven firm focused on supporting exceptional software companies.
Opportunity to work on impactful projects that shape investment outcomes.
Hybrid work model with a collaborative London-based team.
Mentorship and growth opportunities tailored to early-career talent.
Competitive salary and long-term progression within a growing data function.




If you're a motivated Junior Data Analyst eager to apply your skills in a fast-paced, tech-enabled environment, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and be part of a team turning data into competitive advantage.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Junior Data Analyst (Power BI / SQL)

Location: London (Hybrid – 2 days onsite)

Salary: £45,000 + Benefits

Job Type: Full-Time, Permanent




Are you a data-driven thinker using Power BI and SQL?

Looking for a collaborative environment where you can make a real impact while continuing to grow your skills?




We’re hiring a Data Analyst to join a growing team within a dynamic and forward-thinking Insurance services company with a global footprint. Reporting directly to the Group Data Lead, you’ll play a hands-on role in developing high-quality dashboards, reporting tools, and data solutions used by internal stakeholders and external clients.




What You’ll Be Doing:

Build and maintain Power BI dashboards, including externally-facing reports for clients and underwriting teams
Write SQL queries to extract, transform and support backend reporting
Collaborate with internal teams to gather requirements and translate them into insightful visualisations
Develop KPI dashboards and static reports (Excel, PowerPoint) for strategic insights
Support client rollouts and help onboard data-driven solutions




Tech Stack & Tools:

Power BI (including Paginated Reports)
SQL
Excel & PowerPoint
Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric is a bonus




Ideal Candidate:

1 years of experience in a Data Analyst or Reporting Analyst role
Solid experience with Power BI and confident using SQL
Strong communication skills – able to work with both technical and non-technical teams
A proactive, delivery-focused mindset – someone who takes ownership of tasks
Keen to learn and develop in a non-hierarchical, supportive environment
Comfortable working with small to mid-sized datasets (this is not a big data role)




What’s on Offer:

Competitive salary (up to £45K)
Hybrid working – 2 days per week in a central London office
A supportive team with mentorship from senior data professionals
Exposure to global teams across Europe, the US, and Asia
An inclusive, values-led culture with strong ethical foundations




If you're excited about leveraging your Power BI and SQL skills in a meaningful way and want to be part of a forward-thinking, global environment — apply today!

Title: Junior Data Analyst (Ref: 8-405)
Description:
Referment is working with a leading advisory firm that helps businesses tackle some of today’s biggest sustainability challenges, from climate risk and ESG strategy to regulatory compliance and sustainable finance.

They’re looking for a Junior Data Analyst who’s eager to learn, grow, and play a key role in shaping insights that drive impact. If you’re passionate about sustainability and love working with data, this is the perfect opportunity to kickstart your career.

What You’ll Do

Collect and process ESG and sustainability data from clients, APIs, and public sources.

Build clear, engaging dashboards and visualisations that tell a story.

Dig into data to uncover trends and insights that matter.

Support senior consultants on high-profile client projects.

Help develop models, impact metrics, and reports used by top decision-makers.

What We’re Looking For

A degree in a quantitative field (Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Environmental Science or similar).

Confidence with Excel plus experience in at least one data analysis tool/language.

A sharp eye for detail and a commitment to high-quality outputs.

Genuine interest in ESG, climate change, and sustainability.

Strong communication skills; you can turn complex data into clear insights.

The ability to juggle tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Why You’ll Love This Role

Work on projects that have a real-world impact.

Join a collaborative, purpose-driven team where your ideas matter.

Get mentorship and training to accelerate your career.

Gain exposure to high-profile sustainability projects across industries.

Enjoy flexible working and a competitive salary + benefits.

This is more than just a data role, it’s a chance to build a career in a field that’s shaping the future.

#Referment

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data & Insights Analyst

Location: London (Hybrid)

Type: Full-time

Salary: £55,000–£65,000 (DOE)




About the Company

We’re working with a London-based luxury fashion brand that’s integrating data at the core of their operations. As the business scales, they’re developing a bespoke ERP platform to drive better decision-making across production, inventory, and sales.




The Opportunity

This is a great opportunity for a skilled Data & Insights Analyst to join a growing team and help shape how data is used across the business. You’ll be responsible for designing pipelines, building dashboards, and delivering insight to support product and operational excellence.




Key Responsibilities

Build and maintain ETL processes using Python and Power Query M
Create clear, insightful dashboards in Power BI using DAX
Work closely with engineering and product teams to embed analytics into the ERP platform
Analyse large datasets to support operational efficiency and continuous improvement
Contribute to forecasting and inventory optimisation initiatives
Present findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Help establish and maintain best practices in data governance




What We’re Looking For

A STEM degree from a Russell Group university or equivalent
At least 2 years’ experience using Python for data analysis
Advanced Power BI skills, including DAX and Power Query M
Solid SQL experience and comfort working with relational databases
Strong analytical and communication skills
Experience working with product teams to implement data-driven solutions
Familiarity with forecasting or inventory planning is a plus




Why Apply?

Play a key role in shaping a data-first approach at a high-end fashion brand
Work in a hybrid environment with flexibility and autonomy
Competitive salary in a growing, innovation-focused business

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a new challenge?

Fancy helping us shape the future of motor insurance?

Prima could be the place for you.

Since 2015, we’ve been using our love of data and tech to rethink motor insurance and bring drivers a great experience at a great price. Our story began in Italy, where we’ve quickly become the number one online motor insurance provider. In fact, we’re trusted by over 4 million drivers. And now we’re expanding to help millions more drivers in the UK and Spain.

To help fuel that growth, we need a Data Analyst to join our Online Sales Team.

This team serves both our business and our customers.

As part of this team, you’ll optimise our online products, making sure they meet user needs and convert. You’ll also help strengthen our relationship with third party partners, such as price comparison websites, so we can better connect with our audience and turn more clicks into sales.

Excited to make an impact? Here are the details

What You'll Do


Analyse data from various business areas, including online conversion, operational efficiency, trading reports and strategic projects.
Identify improvement opportunities and support data-driven decision making in collaboration with teams like Pricing, Underwriting, Product & Engineering, UX, Customer Care and Claims.
Design and maintain dashboards in Tableau to monitor performance of the metrics that matter, as well as impact of initiatives to enable deeper analysis.
Participate in the integration and automation of data exchange between local and global teams.
Collaborate with other Data Analysts and Data Scientists to share best practices and strengthen Prima’s data-driven culture.
Support and lead key business initiatives, including the launch of new channels and propositions.
Manage successful relationships with 3rd party commercial partners.


What We're Looking For


A minimum of 2–3 years of professional experience is required in data analytics, management consulting, or other roles that are analytically driven.
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative or analytical field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Business Administration, or Economics.
A solid understanding of business in regulated industries
Excellent analytical mindset and problem solving skills
A keenness and confidence in stakeholder management, both internally and externally.


Nice to Have


Proficiency with SQL, Python, Excel & Tableau
Experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., Databricks)
Understanding of or interest in UK Motor Insurance


Why You’ll Love It Here

We want to make Prima a happy and empowering place to work. So if you decide to join us, you can expect plenty of perks.

🤸Work Your Way: Enjoy hybrid working, with a mix of home and office days. Plus, for up to 30 days per year, work from anywhere.

🏁 Grow with us: We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. Get access to learning resources, mentorship and a growth plan tailored to you.

🌈 Thrive and perform: Your best work begins when you feel your best. Enjoy private healthcare, gym discounts, wellbeing programs and mental health support.

Think you’re a match? Apply now.

At Prima, we celebrate uniqueness. If you don’t meet every requirement but are passionate about this role, we still want to hear from you. Innovation thrives on diverse perspectives.
Prima is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Need accommodations during the process? Email us at talent.acquisition@prima.it. Let’s build the future of insurance, together.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Graduate Data Analyst

Salary: £28,000 – £35,000 per annum




About the Role

Nexus IT is a specialist recruitment agency connecting top talent with leading IT firms across the UK. On behalf of our client, an innovative technology consulting company, we are seeking a Graduate Data Analyst to join their growing analytics team.

This role is ideal for recent graduates who are eager to launch their career in data analysis. You’ll gain hands-on experience working on real-world projects, supported by experienced analysts and consultants. Please note: initial onboarding will take place at our client’s London office.




Key Responsibilities

As a Graduate Data Analyst, your role will involve supporting data-driven initiatives for both internal and external stakeholders. Core responsibilities include:

Assisting with data gathering, research activities, and preliminary analysis
Contributing to the development and maintenance of data pipelines and workflows
Creating and updating visual dashboards using Power BI
Writing and optimizing SQL queries for data extraction and analysis
Presenting findings and insights in an accessible manner for both technical and non-technical audiences
Documenting data processes, methodologies, and best practices
Participating in team meetings and collaborative problem-solving sessions
Continuously enhancing technical skills through real-time project exposure and mentorship




Candidate Profile

We are seeking a motivated and analytical individual who is eager to learn and contribute. The ideal candidate will possess:

A degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Business, or a related field
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel for data manipulation and organization
Basic understanding of SQL, or a strong interest in developing SQL skills
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau (preferred, not required)
Excellent attention to detail and a problem-solving mindset
Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey insights clearly
A positive, proactive attitude and a willingness to learn and grow within the role




What You’ll Gain

This role offers a structured pathway into data analytics, with opportunities to learn, grow, and progress in your career. Benefits include:

Competitive salary (£28,000 – £35,000)
38-hour work week
Remote working, with optional hybrid access in London
Performance-based bonuses
28 days annual leave plus UK public holidays
Enhanced pension scheme
Professional membership fee reimbursement
Paid leave entitlements for UK Armed Forces Reservists
Access to a 24/7 Employee Assistance Programme, including GP and mental health support




Hiring Process

Our process is designed to be transparent and collaborative:

Introductory Call – A casual chat to understand your interest and share role details
HR Interview – A discussion about your skills, goals, and alignment with the team
Technical Assessment – A practical task to demonstrate your analytical ability

Throughout, we encourage open dialogue to ensure the opportunity fits your career aspirations.




Diversity & Inclusion

Our client is committed to fostering an inclusive and supportive workplace. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and will provide reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process.




Important Information

Applicants must have the legal right to work in the UK, as visa sponsorship is not available for this role.

  2. HR Interview – A discussion about your skills, goals, and alignment with the team
  3. Technical Assessment – A practical task to demonstrate your analytical ability

Throughout, we encourage open dialogue to ensure the opportunity fits your career aspirations.


Diversity & Inclusion

Our client is committed to fostering an inclusive and supportive workplace. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and will provide reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process.


Important Information

Applicants must have the legal right to work in the UK, as visa sponsorship is not available for this role.

Title: Data Analyst (Finance)
HTML:
London (GB)

Octopus Energy UK 🇬🇧 – Finance /

Full-time /

Hybrid



After starting a mere 10 years ago, Octopus is the largest energy supplier in the UK. We’ve built the technology to serve millions of energy customers and handle the billions of pounds worth of customer and third party transactions that this entails. As Octopus has grown, so too has the complexity, variation and scale of data that we use as a finance team.

Furthermore the finance team is currently undergoing significant transformation with a new accounting platform, OCR system and expense system all on the way. We’ve taken transformation so far that we’ve even been awarded “Transformation team of the year” at the recent GenCFO Finance Awards. In line with this transformation we are looking to build better tools and analysis that supports this growth.

As such, we are looking for a Data Analyst to work at the intersection between data, accounting and finance, using their experience in data to build great data tools to streamline processes and collate, analyse and report on this data. They’ll need a passion for working with data to bring insight and efficiency to the teams around them whilst excelling at listening, understanding challenges and formulating pragmatic solutions.

This is a fantastic opportunity to work at the intersection of finance and data in an award winning team for a high growth business that is at the forefront of the net zero transition.

What You'll Do

  • Work throughout Octopus Energy Group to build solutions for teams ranging from our UK energy retail team to International retail and services teams;
  • Become a subject matter expert on our finance systems and data;
  • Build, maintain and assure reports for the finance teams;
  • Maintain data models used to report on financials from our CRM system (Kraken);
  • Help with one off deep dive analyses and reconciliations using SQL and Python;
  • Build and maintain dashboards and data apps using Streamlit for the finance teams;
  • Build new dbt SQL data models for use in dashboards and month end reports;
  • Provide analytical and data support for financial audits and regulatory reporting;
  • Work closely with a broad range of teams at Octopus


What You'll Need

  • A curious and self driven mentality - when faced with a new problem is capable of seeking out an answer without lots of help and support;
  • Highly data literate and numerate - can make sense of lots of data and shape it into a coherent story;
  • Has great attention to detail;
  • Learns fast and is enthusiastic about learning new technologies;
  • Great communicator, can explain complex technical problems to non-technical teams and also understand problems faced by non-technical teams and distill an effective and efficient tech solution;
  • Experience with SQL, Python, Excel and Google sheets


Nice to have -

  • Accounting experience - has a good grasp of accounting principles and experience of the month end process
  • Experience with building dashboards using Streamlit
  • Experience working with accounting systems (e.g. Netsuite)
  • Experience working in a modern cloud data warehouse environment
  • Experience working collaboratively on codebases using git
  • Experience building models using dbt


If this sounds like you then we'd love to hear from you.

Are you ready for a career with us? We want to ensure you have all the tools and environment you need to unleash your potential. Need any specific accommodations? Whether you require specific accommodations or have a unique preference, let us know, and we'll do what we can to customise your interview process for comfort and maximum magic!

Studies have shown that some groups of people, like women, are less likely to apply to a role unless they meet 100% of the job requirements. Whoever you are, if you like one of our jobs, we encourage you to apply as you might just be the candidate we hire. Across Octopus, we're looking for genuinely decent people who are honest and empathetic. Our people are our strongest asset and the unique skills and perspectives people bring to the team are the driving force of our success. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute. Our commitment is to provide equal opportunities, an inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Frasers Group we’re rethinking retail. Through digital innovation and unique store experiences, we’re serving our consumers with the world’s best sports, premium and luxury brands globally. As a leader in the industry, we’re elevating the retail experience for our consumers through our collection of established brands, including Sports Direct, FLANNELS, USC, Frasers, and GAME.



Why join us?



Our mission- we are building the worlds most admired and compelling brand ecosystem



Our purpose – we are elevating the lives of the many with access to the world’s best brands and experiences



At Frasers Group, we fear less and do more. Our people are forward thinkers who are driven to operate outside of their comfort zone to change the future of retail, embracing challenges along the way. The potential to elevate your career is massive, the experience unrivalled. To be able to make the most of it you need to live and breathe our principles:



Think without limits - Think fast, think fearlessly, and take the team with you
Own it and back yourself - Own the basics, own your role and own the results
Be relevant - Relevant to our people, our partners and the planet

Are you ready to join the Fearless?





Job Description



This is a Data Analyst role where you will be working as part of the analytics team within the Estates function, focusing on developing, analysing & creating tools/models/reports used by the business. You must have an analytical mindset, strong communication skills & be able to adapt to fast paced, ever changing business environments.



Role Description:



Update and maintain a key quarterly report within the business – collecting data from stakeholders, validating and analysing inputs, and delivering summary insights.
Maintain and enhance existing Power BI dashboards; design and develop new reports as needed.
Produce ad-hoc reports and perform detailed analysis of property data using Excel.
Write and optimise database queries.
Working with large data sets - analysing, interpreting & drawing conclusions to support business critical decisions
Assist in the implementation of AI and automation projects, primarily in Airtable.
Identify trends and provide strategic recommendations.
Collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders across the business.


Qualifications



Essential Skills:



Advanced Excel skills.
Experience in developing Power BI reports, including writing and optimising DAX measures.
Proficient in SQL, and experienced working with relational databases.
Able to manage and prioritise workload.
Strong problem-solving ability & a commercial mindset
Able to communicate with a wide range of stakeholders with various levels of technical understanding.
Proactive, independent, self-starter who is ready to jump in and get things done

Desirable:



Experience with VBA and Power Query.
Understanding of financial concepts such as EBITDA, or an interest in developing financial knowledge.
Familiarity with Airtable.
Experience with programming languages such as Python or R.
Background in commercial property, utilities, or Mergers & Acquisitions.


Additional Information



Along with your benefits package we also offer a wide range of perks for our colleagues:



Reward, Recognition and Opportunities



Frasers Champion- Our employees are at the heart of our business and we ensure individuals are recognised every single month for their hard work. Frasers Champion is a peer nominated scheme where 8 winners will receive double their pay for a month where they have thought without limits, owned it or been relevant.



Fearless 1000 – By October 2025, we want our share price to hit £10. If that happens for 30 or more consecutive trading days, all colleagues across the business will receive a bonus! The top 1000 performers in the company will receive unprecedented bonuses, worth from £50,000 to £1million! Senior leaders across the business nominate these performers twice a year for embodying our core values and delivering exceptional performance*.



*subject to terms and conditions



Frasers Festival – an event like no other! Our Frasers Festival is our celebration for Head Office and Retail Staff across the UK and Europe – hosting a MEGA brand village, guest speakers from the world's biggest brands, evening entertainment, the ultimate Frasers Fearless Fitness Challenge and much more.



CEO Sessions – Once a quarter we offer 20 employees the opportunity to attend our “CEO Sessions” ran by our CEO and leadership team. Employees have the chance to connect, network and submit questions around specific topics such as our Sports or Luxury business.



Retail Reconnect – In order to build the planets most admired and compelling brand ecosystem, all employees must understand our business, product and customers. Each financial year, Head Office employees will gain insights by spending two days in one of our stores or the Warehouse. The goal is to learn how the work you do impacts our teams on the frontline, and to bring ideas back to the office which will improve how we work.



Employee Welfare



Frasers Fit – Our Everlast Gyms Team are on a mission to make our workforce the best, and fittest on the planet! We run free gym classes for employees as well as discounted memberships to our clubs. Frasers Fit is our wellbeing programme which aims to support and improve colleagues Physical, Financial & Mental wellbeing. The app is accessible for every employee and includes training, nutrition and lifestyle advice- all completely free.



Retail Trust – We know that its not just about physical health, mental wellness is equally important which is why all of our employees get free access and support from the Retail Trust charity. This includes a 24 hour wellbeing helpline, wellness hub, counselling and financial/legal support.



What’s next?



Our Recruitment Team will be reviewing applications and all candidates will receive a response, whether you are successful or unsuccessful. Shortlisted applicants may be asked to confirm a few key details before being booked in for a first stage interview with the Recruiter- this will be behaviourally focussed and centred around how you align with our Culture and Values. If successful you will be invited to a final interview, on-site, with the team.

Title: Data Analyst
Company: SR2 | Socially Responsible Recruitment | Certified B Corporation™
Description:
📊 Data Analyst | Financial Services | Hybrid (1 day per quarter onsite)







Permanent | Competitive Salary







An established and fast-growing financial services provider is seeking a Data Analyst to support the next phase of its exciting growth. Operating at the intersection of technology and finance, this organisation delivers innovative solutions to businesses across the UK, with a strong focus on customer experience and data-driven decision making.







As a key member of the data team, you'll play a pivotal role in transforming business requirements into meaningful, actionable insights through reporting, data modelling, and dashboard development.







💼 What You'll Be Doing:

Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with teams across the business to understand data needs and provide insights that directly impact strategy and operations.
Data Modelling & Analysis: Develop and maintain scalable, high-quality data models using SQL and cloud-based platforms.
Dashboarding: Create visually compelling and interactive dashboards using Tableau.
Performance Reporting: Monitor key financial, risk, and compliance metrics and present data clearly to relevant stakeholders.
ETL & Pipelines: Collaborate with Data Engineers to optimise data pipelines and ensure reliable data flow across systems.
Data Governance: Promote best practices around data integrity, accuracy, and secure storage.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities to enhance reporting processes and analytical efficiency.










✅ What We're Looking For:

Proven experience in a similar Data Analyst role, ideally within a regulated environment, ideally financial services
Strong SQL skills – able to write complex queries and work with large, relational datasets
Advanced Tableau (Essential) expertise – comfortable building dashboards from scratch and interpreting insights for a non-technical audience
Proficient with Excel and general data manipulation techniques










🌟 Why Join?




This is a genuinely collaborative environment where every team member has the chance to shape outcomes and influence change. The business is ambitious, values-driven, and committed to using data to make a real difference — both internally and for its customers.




You'll benefit from a flexible working model, a supportive culture, and the opportunity to contribute meaningfully to a company that’s scaling at pace.




Location: Hybrid/Remote – with just 1 day per quarter required on-site in the south west.




Ready to apply or learn more? Let’s have a confidential conversation.

Title: Junior Insight Analyst
Description:
THE ALLSAINTS TEAM




At AllSaints we are in the business of feelings - making our customers feel cool and confident. If, like us, you believe in the power of a great outfit, we'd love to talk to you.




We're a global brand made up of a very diverse mix of talented people in a huge variety of roles. Our products are designed in house and made by a small number of suppliers and artisans around the world to sustainable standards.




We are a brand embarking on a very exciting plan and we are seeking new members of the team who want to contribute to this.




THE ROLE:




The Junior Insight Analyst is a crucial member of the AllSaints digital team, reporting to the Global Head of Customer Data and Insight. This role is instrumental in executing the company's customer data and insights strategy, with a primary focus on driving D2C growth across our global markets, including the UK, US, and EU. As part of a focused team, you will support the management and application of customer data to inform key business decisions.




This position requires a solid grasp of customer behavior across both online and offline channels, including our retail stores. The ideal candidate will possess a strong foundational understanding of data modeling and analytics, coupled with excellent communication skills.




WHAT WILL I BE DOING?




Data & Analysis:




- Analysis:

Analyse customer behavior across all touchpoints to pinpoint trends, opportunities, and areas for enhancement
Perform customer segmentation to enable targeted marketing campaigns and personalised customer experiences
Assess customer lifetime value and attrition rates to contribute to the development of customer retention and loyalty initiatives
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) such as website traffic, conversion rates, average transaction values, and customer satisfaction metrics

- Reporting:

Take ownership of the timely and accurate delivery of regular reports (weekly, monthly, quarterly, and ad hoc) providing actionable insights at both global and regional levels
Contribute to the design and development of standardised reporting templates and interactive dashboards to effectively track progress and performance against key metrics
Support the presentation of findings and insights to senior management and relevant stakeholders in a clear, concise, and impactful manner

- Visualisation:

Utilise data visualisation tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI) to create visually compelling and informative reports and dashboards
Assist in the development of interactive visualisations that empower users to explore data and extract meaningful insights
Contribute to the design of custom visualisations tailored to specific business needs and requirements

- Execution:

Play a supportive role in the execution of the customer data, insights, and analytics strategy, ensuring alignment with e-commerce and D2C objectives
Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven initiatives and contribute to the measurement of their impact
Actively seek to expand knowledge of the latest trends and best practices in customer data and analytics

- Quality:

Assist in the management of customer data, upholding high standards of data quality, accuracy, and completeness
Support adherence to established data governance policies and procedures to ensure ongoing regulatory compliance (e.g., GDPR, CCPA)




Collaboration & Communication:

- Teamwork:

Collaborate effectively and proactively share knowledge with various teams, including digital, retail, merchandising, marketing, IT, and customer service, to support projects and initiatives

- Communication:

Clearly and concisely communicate data insights and findings to team members and stakeholders across different levels of the organisation
Assist in translating complex data analysis into actionable insights that are easily understandable for non-technical audiences
Contribute to the preparation and delivery of presentations and reports for senior management and stakeholders




Technical Skills:

SQL:Proficient in writing and optimising SQL queries, with the ability to contribute to data model design
Python: Desirable: familiarity with Python libraries relevant for data analysis (e.g., Pandas, NumPy) and machine learning (e.g., Scikit-learn) is advantageous
Data Visualisation Tools: Experience creating insightful visualisations and dashboards using data visualisation tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI)
Web Analytics: Experience tracking and analysing website traffic and user behavior using platforms such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics




WHAT SKILLS DO I NEED?




Experience in a data and insights role, ideally within the retail or fashion sector
Solid SQL skills and practical experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau) and web analytics platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics)
A developing technical understanding of data modeling and analytics principles
Understanding of customer segmentation methodologies and behavior analysis techniques
Strong communication and presentation abilities
Familiarity with CRM systems is beneficial
Awareness of GDPR and data privacy regulations




ABOUT THE LOCATION




Based in our East London Studios in vibrant Shoreditch with perks and benefits offered from local businesses including discounts on food, shopping and health & beauty. Studio Location.




Approximately a 10 minute walk from Liverpool Street Station and a 5 minute walk from Shoreditch High Street.




WHAT WE STAND FOR




The Customer is the Boss We work as one proud team to get the best for our customers

One Team We are joined up and encourage others to share their ideas

We Do What We Say We Will We know our goals, and we work with clear outcomes in mind

We Are Responsible We are self aware, understand the impact we have on others and are positive about the future




BENEFITS




A generous wardrobe allowance so that you can wear our beautiful clothes to work each day
We are a disability committed certified employer
Employee discount for you to spend with family and friends
25 days holiday increasing to 28 days after 2 years continuous service
Bank holidays, birthdays and volunteering days off
Access to dental cash plan & free virtual GP appointments through Aviva
UNUM employee assistance helpline
Life assurance cover
Access to discounted gym membership and corporate discounts
Hybrid working in our historic East London studios, working hours are 9-5.30pm
Free, confidential, wellbeing and lifestyle support with Retail Trust
Enhanced family leave benefits (neonatal, fertility, maternity, paternity, adoption, menopause)
Health days for you to use either for physical or mental wellness
Dedicated mental health support from our mental health first aiders
Eye care vouchers, season ticket loans and much more!




#WeAreAllSaints




Our aim is to develop truly diverse teams and create an environment where everyone feels respected, valued and able to give of their best whilst contributing to the success of our brand.




We recognise the importance and strength of diversity and commit to providing equal opportunities to everyone in our employment and recruitment processes. We safeguard against any form of discrimination irrespective of gender, gender reassignment, marital status, race, ethnic origin, nationality, disability, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status or age.




Even if you feel you don’t tick all the boxes, we’d still very much like to hear from you. We want you to know that finding people who have a passion for our brand and are open to learning is incredibly important to us.




If you need any support or adjustments during your application, please get in touch with us and we are happy to help.

Show more

Our aim is to develop truly diverse teams and create an environment where everyone feels respected, valued and able to give of their best whilst contributing to the success of our brand.


We recognise the importance and strength of diversity and commit to providing equal opportunities to everyone in our employment and recruitment processes. We safeguard against any form of discrimination irrespective of gender, gender reassignment, marital status, race, ethnic origin, nationality, disability, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status or age.


Even if you feel you don’t tick all the boxes, we’d still very much like to hear from you. We want you to know that finding people who have a passion for our brand and are open to learning is incredibly important to us.


If you need any support or adjustments during your application, please get in touch with us and we are happy to help.

Title: Junior Excel Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Excel Data Analyst

Location: London (Hybrid – with global team collaboration)

Salary: up to £45,000 + Benefits




Are you an Excel power user with a knack for automation and process improvement?

We’re hiring a proactive and technically skilled Excel Data Analyst to join a growing team within a high-performing, globally-connected Insurance services organisation.




This is a fantastic opportunity to modernise internal tooling and play a hands-on role in streamlining processes across international teams. You’ll be a key player in evolving the way data is structured, analysed, and reported across the business.




What You’ll Be Doing:

Data Analysis & Reporting

Clean, structure and analyse data from diverse sources
Apply statistical techniques to derive insights
Communicate findings to both technical and non-technical audiences
Conduct regular data quality checks and support data governance practices




Tooling & Automation

Build and maintain advanced Excel-based tools
Use macros and VBA to automate manual workflows
Assist in integrating tools with databases and external systems
Support ongoing Power BI dashboard development




Project & Process Support

Coordinate small internal projects and user requirements
Assist in writing user stories, test cases, and acceptance criteria
Apply structured problem-solving (e.g. pyramid principle, hypothesis-led design)
Deliver user training and documentation for tools developed

Tech Stack & Tools:

Advanced Microsoft Excel (including Macros and VBA)
Power BI (desirable)
SQL/database integration (advantageous)
Familiarity with data lake or cloud-based tools is a bonus




Ideal Candidate:

Strong Excel skills – confident in macros, complex formulas, and VBA
A proactive problem-solver who enjoys driving process efficiencies
Excellent communicator, comfortable working across functions and regions
Organised, detail-oriented, and accountable for your own deliverables
Experience in financial services or insurance is a plus
Familiarity with Agile methodologies is helpful but not essential




What’s on Offer:

Competitive salary (£40–45K)
Hybrid working – 2 days onsite in a central London location
A collaborative and values-led team culture
Exposure to global teams in Europe, Asia, and North America
Opportunities to shape and improve internal tools and workflows
A socially responsible business supporting causes globally through dedicated CSR efforts




Ready to make an impact with your Excel and automation skills?

APPLY NOW!!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Halian | Managed Services, Recruitment Agency & Contract Staffing
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst with a good understanding in data modeling / data warehouse development, and business intelligence tooling to join my clients payments team, within the fintech space. This role is pivotal in building and optimizing data systems and pipelines that support analytics, reporting.




Key Responsibilities

Develop high-quality Power BI and Tableau dashboards, supporting business teams in making data-informed decisions.
Ensure data integrity, reliability, and performance through testing, monitoring, and documentation.
Exposure to Data Modelling and Warehousing would beneficial as you will need to build data models or migrate existing ones.
Drive best practices in data governance, metadata management, and data security.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our data platform and tooling.




Required Skills & Experience

3–5 + years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a FinTech or Payments environment.
Exposure and a good understansinf in data modeling (dimensional and normalized), ETL/ELT design, and data warehousing techniques.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with scripting languages such as Python or Scala.
Demonstrated ability to create impactful dashboards using Power BI and Tableau.
Deep understanding of data pipeline orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, dbt, Azure Data Factory).
Experience working in agile, cross-functional teams, collaborating closely with data analysts, engineers, and business stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and an ability to balance short-term fixes with long-term scalable solutions.




Nice to Have

Experience with real-time or streaming data (Kafka, Kinesis).
Familiarity with financial transaction data or payment processing systems.
Exposure to data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, PCI-DSS) and data security best practices




This role offers a 2 stage interview process and is required to work on site 3 days a week in central London.




Apply now to be considered!

Show more
